"ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "CBS/AP", "published": "2018-03-24T04:40:00.000+03:00", "title": "Michael Bennett, Philadelphia Eagles player, indicted for allegedly shoving paraplegic worker", "text": "CBS/AP March 23, 2018, 4:40 PM Michael Bennett, Philadelphia Eagles player, indicted for allegedly shoving paraplegic worker \nMichael Bennett in a Dec. 24, 2017, file photo. Michael Ainsworth / AP Email \nHOUSTON -- A grand jury has indicted Philadelphia Eagles player Michael Bennett for allegedly injuring a 66-year-old paraplegic woman when he tried to get onto the field at last year's Super Bowl to celebrate with his brother, Martellus Bennett. Michael Bennett, a three-time Pro Bowl defensive end, was indicted on one felony count of injury to the elderly, the Harris County District Attorney's Office announced Friday. \nThe charge carries a penalty of up to 10 years in prison and a $10,000 fine. \nAuthorities said Bennett, 32, was a spectator at the game in Houston when he tried to get onto the field immediately after the game to see his brother, a tight end for the Patriots at the time. Prosecutors said he pushed through security personnel, including a 66-year-old disabled woman who had told him to use a different entrance to access the field. Medical records show that the woman suffered a sprained shoulder, police said. \nCBS affiliate KHOU reports that the injured worker has been with security management Contemporary Services since 2013. The company said she's an \"excellent\" employee\" and they are \"proud to have her.\" \nA warrant has been issued for Bennett's arrest, and prosecutors are working with his lawyers to plan his surrender. \nThe Philadelphia Eagles earlier this month acquired Bennett from the Seattle Seahawks. The Eagles released the following statement on the alleged incident: \n\"We are aware of the situation involving Michael Bennett and are in the process of gathering more information. Because this is an ongoing legal matter, we will have no further comment at this time.\" \u00a9 2018 CBS Interactive Inc. All Rights Reserved. "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "Marlen Garcia", "published": "2018-03-24T07:34:00.000+03:00", "title": "Happy 90th birthday, James Lovell, Chicago\u2019s space pioneer", "text": "\u201cHouston, we\u2019ve had a problem.\u201d\nJames Lovell was the astronaut who famously uttered those words after an explosion aboard the Apollo 13 spacecraft in 1970. He was the flight commander charged with landing on the moon. After an oxygen tank exploded, Lovell, Jack Swigert and Fred Haise had to call off their mission and figure out how to get back to Earth.\nTwenty-five years later, actor Tom Hanks played Lovell in a Hollywood film about their epic journey.\nApollo 13 astronauts Fred Haise, James Lovell, and John Swigert (left to right) leave a helicopter to step aboard the carrier Iwo Jima in the Pacific Ocean after their successful recovery. | AP\nWe\u2019d like to give this American hero, who lives in a north suburb of Chicago, a shout-out as he turns 90 Sunday. Chicago\u2019s Adler Planetarium is celebrating Lovell\u2019s achievements in a yearlong campaign , encouraging space fans to write Lovell notes to let him know what kind of impact his space travels had on them.\nEDITORIAL\nLovell\u2019s name is synonymous with Apollo 13, but we\u2019ll never forget his Apollo 8 mission in 1968. It was the first manned flight to break from the Earth\u2019s orbit and travel around the moon.\nRELATED: Lovell spoke to Sun-Times reporter Robert Herguth about his faith in a podcast last year.\nWe asked author Robert Kurson, whose book \u201cRocket Men: The Daring Odyssey of Apollo 8 and the Astronauts Who Made Man\u2019s First Journey to the Moon\u201d will be out next month, to give a few good reasons to celebrate Lovell today. Here\u2019s his excellent list:\nJim Lovell donated many of his coolest space-related memorabilia and artifacts to the Adler Planetarium, giving Chicagoans and other visitors an intimate glimpse into the early years of space travel and exploration. He is a wonderful explainer and storyteller who often makes himself available to media and others who are interested in NASA, space, the Moon, and the future of space travel. He is a devoted husband, father and family man who has been married to the same woman, Marilyn, for 65 years. (Astronaut life was notoriously hard on marriages. In fact, the crew of Apollo 8 \u2014 Frank Borman, Lovell, and Bill Anders \u2014 is the only crew from either the Gemini or Apollo programs whose marriages all survived intact.) He is not just one of the nicest astronauts you\u2019ll meet, he\u2019s one of the nicest people you\u2019ll meet, a reputation that goes back to his earliest days with NASA. Unlike some astronauts, he dreamed as a kid of flying on rockets into space and exploring the cosmos, and he seems to have lost little of that boyhood wonder for exploration to this day. He had a golden retriever that liked to watch the Apollo 13 movie when it played on television at his home. Happy Birthday, Commander James Lovell. You continue to make Chicago proud.\n ", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "james lovell", "sentiment": "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "npr.org", "published": "2018-03-23T14:18:00.000+03:00", "title": "Navy Admits 70-Year Crew List Error In USS Indianapolis Disaster : The Two-Way", "text": "Navy Admits To 70-Year Crew List Error In USS Indianapolis Disaster Facebook \nClarence Donnor who was mistakenly believed to have been aboard USS Indianapolis when it was sunk by a Japanese submarine in July 1945. U.S. Navy photo hide caption toggle caption U.S. Navy photo Clarence Donnor who was mistakenly believed to have been aboard USS Indianapolis when it was sunk by a Japanese submarine in July 1945. U.S. Navy photo \nOn Aug. 12, 1945, days after atomic bombs were dropped on Japan, the Donnors received an official telegram at their home in Big Rapids, Mich. Their son, U.S. Navy Radio Technician 2nd Class Clarence Donnor was missing in action, it said. \nAlthough they did not know it at the time, Donnor had been listed as aboard on the USS Indianapolis, which had been sunk by a Japanese submarine in the Philippine Sea on July 30, resulting in the largest loss of life at sea in U.S. Navy history. \nIndianapolis sank in less than 15 minutes, with some 300 sailors and Marines going down with the ship. With few lifeboats, many of the remaining faced death by exposure or shark attack until being rescued days later. \nDonnor, however, was nowhere near the disaster playing out in the Pacific. His assignment to the Indianapolis had been canceled moments before the ship deployed on a secret mission to deliver atomic bomb components to the island of Tinian, the airstrip used to launch the attacks on Hiroshima and Nagasaki. Instead, he had received orders to report for officer training at Fort Schuyler, N.Y. \nUSS Indianapolis preparing to leave Tinian after delivering atomic bomb components, circa 26 July 1945. U.S. Naval History and Heritage Command Photograph hide caption toggle caption U.S. Naval History and Heritage Command Photograph USS Indianapolis preparing to leave Tinian after delivering atomic bomb components, circa 26 July 1945. U.S. Naval History and Heritage Command Photograph \nAs researchers Richard Hulver and Sara Vladic explain in a paper published by the Naval History and Heritage Command, the next day, Donnor's mother, Ruth, sent a letter to the chief of naval personnel to apprise him of the mistake. \"We are pleased to inform you that we have talked with our son since that date [when he was declared missing on 30 July] and also had a postal card and letter. He is now en route to a naval school in New York,\" she wrote. \nA copy of a letter from the mother of RT2c Clarence W. Donnor to the Chief of Naval Personnel. U.S. Navy hide caption toggle caption U.S. Navy A copy of a letter from the mother of RT2c Clarence W. Donnor to the Chief of Naval Personnel. U.S. Navy \nThe Navy quickly changed Donnor's classification from \"missing\" to \"survivor\" and apologized: \"Any anxiety you may have been caused by the telegram stating that your son was missing is deeply regretted.\" \nEven so, thanks to a simple clerical error, Donnor's fate and that of the USS Indianapolis have been intertwined ever since. \nHe was aboard the Indianapolis briefly before being sent ashore after receiving his new orders immediately before the cruiser departed San Francisco. \n\"Donnor's arrival onboard was apparently recorded, but his hasty departure overlooked,\" Hulver, a historian with the Naval History and Heritage Command and Vladic, a filmmaker and author write. \"Thus, when the paper records were reconstructed, he remained on the final crew list resulting in a complement of 1,196 \u2014 one man too many.\"", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "clarence william donnor", "sentiment": "negative"}, {"name": "clarence w. donnor", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "clarence donnor", "sentiment": "none"}], "organizations": [{"name": "navy", "sentiment": "negative"}, {"name": "u.s. navy radio", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "u.s. navy", "sentiment": "none"}], "locations": [{"name": "uss indianapolis", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "japan", "author": "Daniel Jeremiah", "published": "2018-03-24T01:54:00.000+03:00", "title": "2018 NFL Draft: Five takeaways from Josh Allen's pro day", "text": "Sam Darnold took advantage of his opportunity to make a big impression on NFL scouts at his pro day on Wednesday, and on Friday, it was Josh Allen 's turn. The Wyoming QB was outstanding during a 60-throw workout that drew representatives from half the league's teams .\nWhile I'll be surprised if the Browns don't pick Darnold first overall in the 2018 NFL Draft , I wasn't surprised to hear Cleveland decided to send a contingent, including owner Jimmy Haslam, to Laramie, Wyo., to see Allen work out on Friday. He's my No. 4 QB in the draft, and he has a chance to be the best NFL player of this year's QB class.\nHere are my takeaways from Allen's pro-day workout.\n1) I can't remember a time when a quarterback prospect has done a better job in the offseason. Allen had a great performance in January at the Reese's Senior Bowl . He was the talk of the NFL Scouting Combine earlier this month with the athletic ability and arm strength he showed off in Indianapolis. On Friday, he had one of the better pro-day throwing sessions we'll see. He won the offseason.\n2) Allen's footwork, accuracy and touch were improved at the pro day from what we saw him from him a few weeks ago at the combine. It was clear that he and his QB coach, Jordan Palmer, wanted to focus on touch throws in this workout, and he showed well in that area. Of course, he also showed off his cannon of a right arm. He threw fastballs with ease.\n3) Allen still needs to work on anticipation. That's going to be a challenge for him because he has such a strong arm and will lock onto his first read at times, but I think he can do it if given time to develop before he's thrust into action in the NFL. That's why landing with a team that has an established starter would be the ideal scenario for him.\n4) I'm expecting four QBs to go in the top six picks next month, and I expect Allen to be in that group. Now, where he goes is still a question, but he reminded everyone on Friday of just how special he can be. He has rare arm talent, but he doesn't quite have the same touch and precision that guys like Darnold and Baker Mayfield possess. Allen has the most upside of any QB in this draft, but he also has a lower floor than some of his fellow signal-callers.\n5) One executive who's been making the rounds to the QB workouts this draft season texted me this message on Friday: \"These (pro days) are all the same to me. Let the tape and intangibles make your decision.\"\nAt the end of the day, teams have to go back to the tape and decide if they're comfortable with what they see from the QB. There's no doubt he had some rough outings against Power Five competition during his college career, but there's also no denying his upside. I see Allen making progress. He's trending up, but he's going to need time to fully realize his potential. He needs a franchise that will be patient with him. The payoff could be huge.\nFollow Daniel Jeremiah on Twitter @MoveTheSticks .", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Last Slide Next Slide Buy Photo Snow blankets a garden outside of the PNC Center near the Indianapolis Arts Garden in downtown Indianapolis on Wednesday, March 21, 2018. (Photo: Michelle Pemberton/IndyStar) Buy Photo CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE Spring greeted Indiana with a heavy blanket of snow Tuesday night. Sunshine returned Wednesday in Indianapolis, and much of the snow began to melt away. But snow quickly returned to the forecast, and a new set of weather advisories suggest that snow shovels should be kept handy this weekend. Early Thursday, the National Weather Service issued a special weather message saying snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, with localized amounts up to 8 inches, and ice accumulations of a light glaze are possible from late Friday through Saturday evening. If the forecast comes to fruition, the heavy snowfall could have an impact on planned weekend events like the IHSAA basketball state finals , and the March For Our Lives rally. \u2014 NWS Indianapolis (@NWSIndianapolis) March 22, 2018 Cities targeted in the weather warning include Indianapolis, Shelbyville, Lafayette, Kokomo, Frankfort, Muncie, Crawfordsville and Anderson. Those communities have been placed under a winter storm watch until 2 a.m. Saturday. \"A winter storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel,\" said a NWS statement. Previously, One national weather forecaster on Wednesday estimated 8 to 12 inches for Central Indiana over the weekend. Meteorologist Tara Dudzik with the National Weather Service said there will be precipitation, but she is not expecting a foot of snow. Chances of rain arrive Friday evening, mixing with snow after 1 a.m., according to the NWS . Snow showers are expected to pick up after 4 a.m., but precipitation amounts are expected to stay between a quarter and a half inch. Snow, rain and freezing rain will continue fall Saturday, with most coming before 3 p.m. as the high temperature approaches 36 degrees. When it comes to forecasting final snowfall totals this far out, Dudzik said, it's simply too early to tell. As a storm moves through the Central Plains and into the Midwest, anything could happen. \"Even a shift of 50 miles in the track is going to be a big difference in the type of weather,\" she said Wednbesday. With several days before the system is expected to pass through Central Indiana, Dudzik said the southern half of the state is likely to see rain, but that is likely to transition to snow stretching from Lafayette to Indianapolis and beyond. \"Anywhere north of that line right now looks like more of a snow event,\" she said. Although Saturday's high is expected to reach the high 30s, there is the potential for the snow to accumulate on the roads, especially to the northeast. \"If it drops with the snow, it could cool rather quickly,\" she said. High temperatures are expected to be in the upper 40s through the end of the week, with sunshine in the forecast Thursday and Friday, according to the NWS. Rain could return to the forecast as soon as Monday evening, with a 50 percent chance of rain possible. Call IndyStar reporter Holly Hays at (317) 444-6156. Follow her on Twitter: @hollyvhays . They cannot talk to us,\" Capt. Chris Major of the Indianapolis Fire Department told CBS affiliate WTTV .\nThe station recently took video of fire department crews responding to a call of an overdose. Medics found a man in the grass near a busy intersection. He was unresponsive and struggling to breathe after medics say he overdosed on the street drug called KD.\n\"Their movements are slow and lethargic, a lot of drooling and a loss of function. We find them with their clothes off, eating the grass, pulling dirt out of the ground and trying to put it in their mouth,\" Major said.\nKD is a mix of either marijuana , tobacco , or the synthetic marijuana known as Spice doused in a heavy-duty bug spray, like Raid. Users smoke the mixture.\n\"We find people passed out with it still in their hand. That is how fast it has an effect on them,\" Major said.\nHe says his team has had nearly a dozen KD overdose runs in one day, sometimes treating the same person multiple times a day.\n\"They do not know what is in this stuff or who has made it so they are all taking chance, which for some reason they are willing to do because we get the same people using over and over again,\" Major said.\nAuthorities say they are trying to find the source of the drug.\nIn a statement, Kelly M. Semrau, Senior Vice President for Global Corporate Affairs, Communication and Sustainability at SC Johnson, which manufactures bug sprays such as Raid and OFF!, said the effects reported in recent news accounts are \"completely inaccurate.\"\n\"According to our scientific experts, exposure to the active ingredients in these products would not cause the reported effects,\" the statement reads. \"Global authorities, including the World Health Organization (WHO) and the U.S. EPA, for many decades have studied these active ingredients and they have not reported ill effects like this. Additionally, even if these active ingredients were intentionally overused, we would not expect these types of symptoms, nor would they last for 45 minutes.\"\n\"Our products are safe when used as directed,\" the company said.", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": "published": "2018-03-21T21:55:00.000+02:00", "title": "NCAA unveils 2019 Women\u2019s Final Four Logo | NCAA.com", "text": "NCAA unveils 2019 Women\u2019s Final Four Logo NCAA Contact | Archive | RSS \nTAMPA, Fla. \u2014 Featuring colors representative of warm-toned sunsets and the excitement of the Tampa Bay area nightlife, the 2019 NCAA Women\u2019s Final Four logo has been unveiled. \nThe University of South Florida will host the NCAA Women\u2019s Final Four on April 5 and 7, 2019 at Amalie Arena in Tampa. The city and arena will be hosting America\u2019s marquee women\u2019s sporting event for the third time after previously hosting in 2008 and 2015. \n\u201cTampa Bay continues to combine a passion for women\u2019s basketball with a top local organizing committee and that has led us to a city that the women\u2019s basketball community and fans are excited to return to,\u201d said Lynn Holzman, NCAA vice president of women\u2019s basketball. \nMORE: View the updated 2018 interactive bracket \n\u201cWe look forward to working again with the Tampa Bay Sports Commission, South Florida and Amalie Arena in creating a memorable experience for our teams, fans and the Tampa Bay community.\u201d \nDesigned by Section 127 in Indianapolis, the teal, orange, blue, yellow and white 2019 Women\u2019s Final Four logo was inspired by Florida\u2019s palm trees, sunsets, ocean ripples and reflection of the water. The logo also reflects the vibrancy, architecture and ironwork of Tampa\u2019s Ybor City Historic District, which has been designated as a National Historic Landmark, with several structures in the area listed in the National Register of Historic Places. In 2008, Seventh Avenue, the main commercial thoroughfare in Ybor City, was recognized as one of the \u201c10 Great Streets in America\u201d by the American Planning Association. \n\u201cHosting a third NCAA Women\u2019s Final Four in our hometown is truly a monumental opportunity,\u201d said Rob Higgins, executive director of the Tampa Bay Sports Commission. \u201cThis is an event that continues to impact our community not only financially, but also socially. We couldn\u2019t be more excited to unveil the 2019 NCAA Women\u2019s Final Four logo, as we\u2019re confident it will soon become a brand that represents a legacy of lifelong memories for student- athletes and fans.\u201d \nSelect upper-level single-session tickets will be on-sale March 27, starting at $35, while all-session tickets for the 2019 NCAA Women\u2019s Final Four will go on sale in the fall. For those fans who can\u2019t wait until this fall, join the fun by becoming a \u201cFinals Fanatic\u201d in the 300 level of Amalie Arena for only $75 per person. The Finals Fanatic package includes an all-session ticket,a food voucher, a meet and greet with celebrities and former players, a photo on the Women\u2019s Final Four court and airtime on the Amalie Arena videoboards throughout the Women\u2019s Final Four. \nFor the latest event, volunteer and registration information for the Women\u2019s Final Four, visit ncaa.com/womensfinalfour. They cannot talk to us,\" Capt. Chris Major of the Indianapolis Fire Department told CBS affiliate WTTV .\nThe station recently took video of fire department crews responding to a call of an overdose. Medics found a man in the grass near a busy intersection. He was unresponsive and struggling to breathe after medics say he overdosed on the street drug called KD.\n\"Their movements are slow and lethargic, a lot of drooling and a loss of function. We find them with their clothes off, eating the grass, pulling dirt out of the ground and trying to put it in their mouth,\" Major said.\nKD is a mix of either marijuana , tobacco , or the  synthetic marijuana known as Spice doused in a heavy-duty bug spray, like Raid. Users smoke the mixture.\n\"We find people passed out with it still in their hand. That is how fast it has an effect on them,\" Major said.\nHe says his team has had nearly a dozen KD overdose runs in one day, sometimes treating the same person multiple times a day.\n\"They do not know what is in this stuff or who has made it so they are all taking chance, which for some reason they are willing to do because we get the same people using over and over again,\" Major said.\nAuthorities say they are trying to find the source of the drug.\nIn a statement, Kelly M. Semrau, Senior Vice President for Global Corporate Affairs, Communication and Sustainability at SC Johnson, which manufactures bug sprays such as Raid and OFF!, said the effects reported in recent news accounts are \"completely inaccurate.\"\n\"According to our scientific experts, exposure to the active ingredients in these products would not cause the reported effects,\" the statement reads. \"Global authorities, including the World Health Organization (WHO) and the U.S. EPA, for many decades have studied these active ingredients and they have not reported ill effects like this. Additionally, even if these active ingredients were intentionally overused, we would not expect these types of symptoms, nor would they last for 45 minutes.\"\n\"Our products are safe when used as One of the youngest students helping to plan the event is 15-year-old Isabella Fallahi, a freshman at Carmel High School. She will be one of the speakers at Saturday\u2019s event. "published": "2018-03-23T14:24:00.000+03:00", "title": "Eurasion Economic Summit to discuss technology vs politics", "text": "Eurasian Economic Summit to discuss technology vs politics ISTANBUL The Marmara Group Foundation will hold the 21st Eurasian Economic Summit with its partners on April 11-12 to discuss the relationship between technology and politics, bringing together current and former statesmen, business people, opinion leaders, NGOs and religious representatives from all over the world. \n\u201cAs a modest non-governmental organization, we will carry out the Eurasian Economic Summit, which is regarded as an internationally accepted event that has been continuously held for 33 years,\u201d Marmara Group Foundation president Akkan Suver said at an Istanbul press conference on March 21.\n\u201cUnder this years\u2019 main topic \u2018The dilemma of our century: Technology vs. politics,\u2019 we will open up discussions with statesmen, business people, academics, clergymen and young people,\u201d he said.\n\u201cThis dilemma is a common concern for all of us in terms of peace, stability, economy and future. We will debate this,\u201d Suver said.\n\u201cMeanwhile, we are considering our summit as an opportunity for the correct expression and presentation of the terrorist incidents we have been living in and the successful and justified Afrin campaign,\u201d he said, referring to the Turkish military operation in neighboring Syria.\nAnother session of the event will address the impact of gender equality along with the development of technology under the heading \u201cThe mind blowing expectations of women.\u201d\nThe summit has been held together with the Istanbul Ready-Made Garment Exporters\u2019 Association (\u0130HK\u0130B) since 2003. However, the term is usually used for the terrorists who were killed in the operations. \nSpeaking at an event in Istanbul's Ba\u011fc\u0131lar district, Erdo\u011fan said that he discussed the ongoing counter-terror operation with U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday, and with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday. \nThe president underlined that Turkey will continue to protect the victims of the Syrian war, adding that it would not take a step back in its anti-terror operations. \n\"The work won't stop in Afrin, there is also Idlib, Manbij,\" Erdo\u011fan said, signaling the continuation of Operation Olive Branch. \nOperation Olive Branch was launched by Turkey on Jan. 20 to remove the PKK/PYD/YPG/KCK and Daesh terrorists from Afrin in northwestern Syria. The Turkish Armed Forces (TSK) and the Free Syrian Army (FSA) entered Afrin town center and liberated it from terrorists on March 18. \nAccording to the Turkish General Staff, the operation aims to establish security and stability along Turkish borders and in the region as well as to protect Syrian people from the oppression and cruelty of terrorists. \nThe operation is being carried out under the framework of Turkey's rights within international law, U.N. Security Council resolutions, its right to self-defense under the U.N. charter and respect for Syria's territorial integrity, it said. \nThe military also said, \"utmost importance\" is being placed on not harming any civilians. \nThe operation in Afrin \u2013 bordering Turkey's Hatay and Kilis provinces \u2013 was widely expected in the wake of Turkey's Operation Euphrates Shield in northern Syria, which cleared Daesh terrorists from Turkey's border between Aug. 24, 2016, and March 2017. \nOn March 18, Turkish-backed troops liberated the town center of Afrin, which had been a major hideout for the YPG/PKK since 2012 when the Assad regime in Syria left the city to the terror group without putting up a fight.", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "published": "2018-03-23T15:13:00.000+03:00", "title": "Turkey will not stop in Syria, Manbij and Idlib are next: Erdo\u011fan", "text": "I told Putin and Trump we won\u2019t step back in Syria: Erdo\u011fan ISTANBUL President Recep Tayyip Erdo\u011fan has said he told both U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin that \u201cTurkey will not step back in Syria,\u201d vowing that the ongoing campaign in Afrin will be expanded to other parts of the war-torn country, including Manbij.\n\u201cLast night I spoke with U.S. President Trump on these issues. I discussed the same things with Putin two days ago. I told them: \u2018We won\u2019t take steps backward from here. We are on the side of the suffering and the oppressed,\u2019\u201d Erdo\u011fan said in an address at a meeting of his Justice and Development Party (AKP) in Istanbul on March 23.\nErdo\u011fan and Trump spoke on the phone late on March 22 about strained ties between Ankara and Washington, particularly troubled due to the U.S.\u2019s ongoing partnership with the People\u2019s Protection Units (YPG) in the fight against the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) in Syria. Turkey considers the YPG to be the Syrian offshoot of the Kurdistan Workers\u2019 Party (PKK) and therefore as a terrorist organization.\nThe Turkish military, along with the Free Syrian Army (FSA), launched \u201cOperation Olive Branch\u201d against the YPG in Afrin on Jan. 20, and Erdo\u011fan vowed that operations \u201cwill not end in Afrin. Next are Idlib and Manbij.\u201d\nManbij, a northwestern Syrian town, is particularly important as it is still under the control of the YPG alongside U.S. troops. Turkey has long been urging the U.S. to let the YPG pull back from Manbij to the east of Euphrates amid threats that it will not hesitate to launch an attack on YPG positions even if American troops are present.\nNo withdrawal from Manbij: US\nHowever, a senior U.S. official said the U.S. \u201chas no intention to leave Manbij,\u201d despite Turkey\u2019s words.\n\u201cU.S. forces are located in Manbij. We have made it very clear with the Turkish government that we will continue to operate there,\u201d State Department spokeswoman Heather Nauert said at a press conference in response to a question about the U.S.\u2019s stance on Manbij.\nNauert also said talks with Ankara \u201chave not been concluded\u201d and Washington is willing to continue conversations, referring to the three \u201ctechnical committees\u201d formed by Turkey and the U.S. to solve contentious issues between the two countries.\nTurkish and American delegations met in Washington on March 8 and 9 to find a way to resolve the Manbij problem but the dismissal of U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson has caused uncertainty about how the two countries will proceed. Turkish Foreign Ministry Undersecretary \u00dcmit Yal\u00e7\u0131n is expected to travel to the U.S. to meet his counterpart John Sullivan next week.\n\u2018More than 3,700 terrorists neutralized\u2019\nMeanwhile, Erdo\u011fan stated that Turkey\u2019s operations against the PKK and YPG are ongoing in various parts of Syria and Iraq and the number of \u201cneutralized terrorists\u201d in Syria since Jan. 20 exceeds 3,700.\n\u201cWe will continue. We previously struck them through the Euphrates Shield Operation. And 160,000 [Syrian] brothers and sisters were able to return to their homes in an area of 2,000 square kilometers thanks to that operation. This piece of land is now under our control and locals are returning to their homes,\u201d he said.\nStrategic partnership\nIn a statement issued after Erdo\u011fan\u2019s phonecall with Trump, Turkish presidential spokesman \u0130brahim Kal\u0131n stated that two leaders discussed \u201cbilateral relations and regional issues.\u201d\n\u201cOur president held a phone conversation with U.S. President Trump. Bilateral and regional topics were discussed in the conversation,\u201d Kal\u0131n said in a written statement.\nBoth leaders agreed to continue collaboration for common strategic goals and resolve issues that negatively affect bilateral relations, he added in a statement issued later on March 22.\n\u201cThe importance of strengthening relations between the two NATO allies and strategic partners was discussed,\u201d Kal\u0131n said.", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "trump", "sentiment": "negative"}, "text": "Number of \u2018anti-vaccination families\u2019 in Turkey increases to 23,000 in 2017: Top doctor ISTANBUL The number of families in Turkey who say they are against vaccination rose to 23,000 in 2017, up from just 183 in 2011, according to the head of the Turkish Society of Clinical Microbiology and Infectious Diseases. \n\u201cWith scientific thought taking a backseat, the number of people believing in anti-vaccination ideas has steadily increased. According to studies, the number of anti-vaccination families was 183 in 2011, 387 in 2012, 913 in 2013, 1,370 in 2014, 1,091 in 2015, 11,470 in 2016, and 23,000 in 2017,\u201d Prof. Dr. Alpay Azap was quoted as saying by daily Birg\u00fcn on March 23.\n\u201cInfectious diseases have led to mass deaths. Vaccinations are the most effective method in the prevention of many infectious diseases. Vaccinations do not only protect the person that they are used on, they also protect people who are not vaccinated or cannot be vaccinated. People who have not developed immunity do not contaminate infections through vaccinations, so the spread of infection in society is prevented,\u201d Azap said.\nHe added that based on the general view that the effectiveness of vaccination is 95 percent, 99 percent of society needs to be vaccinated in order for the 94 percent \u201cimmunity threshold\u201d to be sustained.\nMeanwhile, main opposition Republican People\u2019s Party (CHP) deputy Tur Y\u0131ld\u0131z Bi\u00e7er told Birg\u00fcn that the Health Ministry was not \u201cdoing enough\u201d to prevent people from adopting anti-vaccination views.\n\u201cFamilies see it as a personal right not to have their child vaccinated. But this is an issue that concerns the whole society. The Health Ministry, which should be preventing this situation from being legitimized and is responsible for society\u2019s health, is not doing its part,\u201d Bi\u00e7er said.", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "alpay azap", "sentiment": "none"}], "organizations": [{"name": "turkish society of clinical microbiology", "sentiment": "none"}], "locations": [{"name": "turkey", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "istanbul", "sentiment": "none"}]}, "rating": null, "crawled": "2018-03-23T15:09:29.035+03:00"}, {"thread": {"uuid": "e2c21ad4e2e0bcdabdc06ab36332242a6f03da27", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/.wHSUbtEfZQ2IR95VYfCVm0awHfGZN1gkyHF3X4Os9Z8RsDaDCIt3cF.eyMPGsSvPXxXj886DQdH.tpj1g8sTcxEavRw46NBFhtdeK7atZvs40Tf2tWZMh6PM1.ibwd8_Y5hHgbgcbs-", "site_full": "www.dailysabah.com", "site": "dailysabah.com", "site_section": "http://dailysabah.com//rss/life", "site_categories": ["media"], "section_title": "Daily Sabah - The adventure of bread and baked products has reached a different dimension today. \nOrganized by Messe Stuttgart Ares Fair every two years, the International Trade Fair for Bakery, Patisserie Machinery, Ice Cream, Chocolate and Technologies (IBATECH) Istanbul is getting ready to host professionals of all the related sectors for the 12th time at CNR Expo on April 12-15. \nThe fair is the biggest of the Eurasian region and the only one that is presented in 20 different languages. \nHigh-technology developments, such as customized flour produced at the first dark mill factory in Turkey \nwhere 20 people work and whole wheat flour that doesn't lose its vitamin value for six months, will be presented at IBATECH for the first time. \nThe fair will bring together visitors and delicious tastes. \nNational team chefs will cook at the fair, while famous chefs will be in attendance. Nearly 5,000 slices of pizza, a ton of ice cream, two tons of cake and cookies and 8,000 street bagels will be offered along with the limitless standard bread. \nFlour that doesn't lose its vitamin value for six months \nMore than 400 companies will present their talents at the fair. Some of those companies led the way in their fields with flour that doesn't lose its vitamin value for six months. That flour is being produced at the first dark mill factory in Turkey. Meanwhile, the machine making the dessert called \"halka\" (ring in English), which is a part of Turkish culture, will also be on display. \nFurthermore, cloth bags produced by nature-friendly fabrics, fridges for dried meat that has contributed to the formation of famous steakhouse Nusret's concept, an egg-breaking machine that combines the egg sector with speed and high technology ovens used in cooking process, which is equally important in the production process will be on display.", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [], "organizations": [{"name": "messe stuttgart ares fair", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "international trade fair for bakery", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "cnr expo", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "patisserie machinery", "sentiment": "none"}], "locations": [{"name": "turkey", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "istanbul", "sentiment": "none"}]}, "rating": null, "crawled": "2018-03-23T05:35:59.002+03:00"}, {"thread": {"uuid": "9888bc92606ff60324d945f59c40fd402c08e571", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/.wHSUbtEfZQ2IR95VYfCVm0awHfGZN1gFFW4Etb4IcEJ0AQy8bCJ9YG_kkSp70HVji6Eqf04bSvei4Ct0KpqS0sX0WySM5XsUDfFMHTdWsybyTUaqms_EKXn0X_V1El5hlZWSlbBf9sPf05MFRoMc7HVF7MaMwR3nnMOizD51R0-", "site_full": "www.dailysabah.com", "site": "dailysabah.com", "site_section": "http://dailysabah.com//rss/politics", "site_categories": ["media"], "section_title": "Daily Sabah - Politics", "title": "YPG will be cleared from all parts of northern Syria, Turkey tells US", "title_full": "YPG will be cleared from all parts of northern Syria, Turkey tells US", "published": "2018-03-23T21:34:00.000+03:00", "replies_count": 0, "participants_count": 0, "site_type": "news", "country": "TR", "spam_score": 0.0, "main_image": "https://iadsb.tmgrup.com.tr/978705/645/344/0/56/1490/850?u=https://idsb.tmgrup.com.tr/2018/03/23/ypg-will-be-cleared-from-all-parts-of-northern-syria-turkey-tells-us-1521837421496.jpg", "performance_score": 0, "domain_rank": 46835, "social": {"facebook": {"likes": 0, "comments": 0, "shares": 0}, "gplus": {"shares": 0}, "pinterest": {"shares": 0}, "linkedin": {"shares": 0}, "stumbledupon": {"shares": 0}, "vk": {"shares": 0}}}, "uuid": "9888bc92606ff60324d945f59c40fd402c08e571", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/.wHSUbtEfZQ2IR95VYfCVm0awHfGZN1gFFW4Etb4IcEJ0AQy8bCJ9YG_kkSp70HVji6Eqf04bSvei4Ct0KpqS0sX0WySM5XsUDfFMHTdWsybyTUaqms_EKXn0X_V1El5hlZWSlbBf9sPf05MFRoMc7HVF7MaMwR3nnMOizD51R0-", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "", "published": "2018-03-23T21:34:00.000+03:00", "title": "YPG will be cleared from all parts of northern Syria, Turkey tells US", "text": "YPG will be cleared from all parts of northern Syria, Turkey tells US DAILY SABAH YOUR E-MAIL VERIFICATION CODE Ankara and Washington continue talks on Manbij, one of the most debated issue between two NATO allies, to find common ground to end U.S. support for the PKK-affiliated groups and drawing a map road for the post-YPG period \nAnkara has been looking to find common ground with Washington on the withdrawal of the PKK-affiliated People's Protection Units (YPG) from Manbij and areas east of the Euphrates River under the control of the group where there is also a U.S. military presence for the pretext of the fight against Daesh. Speaking at an event in Istanbul's Ba\u011fc\u0131lar district, President Recep Tayyip Erdo\u011fan said on Friday that he discussed the ongoing counterterrorism operation against the YPG with U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday, and with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday. \nHe said that Turkey will not step back in its counterterrorism operations and will continue to protect the victims of the Syrian war. \"The work won't stop in Afrin, there is also Idlib, Manbij,\" Erdo\u011fan said, signaling the continuation of Operation Olive Branch against the YPG, while also reiterating Turkey's determined stance to eliminate PKK threats to its national security. The northern Syrian city of Manbij has been one of the most hotly debated points of contention between Ankara and Washington. In Idlib, however, the Turkish military established observation points last October to monitor the cease-fire in the de-escalation zones. \nAccording to the Astana agreement, reached between Turkey, Russia and Iran last year, Turkey is projected to gradually establish 12 observation points, from Idlib's north to south. \nAnkara's demand from the U.S. to cease arming the YPG and ensure its withdrawal to east of the Euphrates dates back to former President Barack Obama's time in office. The U.S. had promised to meet Ankara's demands, but has not so far, which has strained relations between the two countries. \nAs part of recent rapprochement between the two NATO allies, Ankara looks to establish an agreement that would lead to the withdrawal of the YPG from Manbij and the future administration of the city. \nForeign Minister Mevl\u00fct \u00c7avu\u015fo\u011flu said earlier this month that there has been a mutual understanding on the need for a road map, but no deal has been finalized yet with the U.S.. \nAccording to Turkish officials, Turkish and U.S. troops would ensure security in Manbij once the YPG withdraws and the two countries would monitor the withdrawal process. \nAnkara has been arguing that the future administration of Manbij should reflect the demographics of the province, determined according to a census before the civil war broke out and the YPG took control, which was predominantly Arab. \n\u00c7avu\u015fo\u011flu said the same model will be applied to other regions afterwards, including in those east of the Euphrates River and Raqqa. \nA U.S. State Department spokesperson on Thursday said that the U.S. has no intention to leave Manbij.\"U.S. forces are located in Manbij. We have made it very clear with the Turkish government that we continue to operate there,\" Heather Nauert said in a press conference in response to a question about the U.S. position on Manbij. \nMeanwhile, Foreign Ministry spokesman Hami Aksoy said on Friday that Turkey reached an understanding with the U.S. during the meetings on March 8-9 and an undersecretary might visit Washington to try \nto find common ground on Manbij. Speaking at a press conference in Ankara, Aksoy reiterated that Turkey expects solid steps from the U.S. and that Foreign Ministry Undersecretary \u00dcmit Yal\u00e7\u0131n might visit Washington next week for talks on Manbij. \nTurkey believes that U.S. President Trump also wants to improve bilateral ties, but that his efforts are undermined by holdovers from the previous administration and establishment officials. \n\u00c7avu\u015fo\u011flu said Ankara is aware of Trump's eagerness to normalize relations, but added that \"he should be handling the system fully\" to do so. \nErdo\u011fan and Trump discussed bilateral and regional issues over the phone, Presidential Spokesman \u0130brahim Kal\u0131n said Thursday. \nThe conversation marks the third time the two presidents have spoken since November 2017, and it was two months since their last call. \n\"President Donald J. Trump spoke today with President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey to reaffirm the importance of strong relations between the United States and Turkey, as NATO allies and strategic partners, and to exchange views on regional developments,\" a statement from the White House said. \nTouching on the possible implications of the ouster of National Security Adviser H.R. McMaster on ties, Aksoy said that continuity and maintaining dialogue is fundamental. \nTrump said Thursday that former U.S. Ambassador to the U.N. John Bolton will replace McMaster as national security adviser next month. \nAfter former State of Secretary Rex Tillerson's visit in February, Ankara and Washington agreed to establish joint working groups to overcome their differences, particularly the U.S.' support for the YPG in Syria, the G\u00fclenist Terror Group (FET\u00d6) and Iraq. \nThe decision on Manbij was discussed on March 8-9 between the working groups from both countries in Washington.", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "vladimir "2018-03-24T10:15:00.000+03:00", "title": "\u2018Argentina, Turkey look for better relations\u2019", "text": "\u2018Argentina, Turkey look for better relations\u2019 \n\u201cThis visit will bring new business [opportunities] to both countries,\u201d says Argentinian official Ariel Cohen Sabban, President of Delegation of Argentine Jewish Association (DAIA) \nBy Nilay Kar Onum \nISTANBUL \nThe current relations between Turkey and Argentina are expected to further improve in the coming days, the head of the Delegation of Argentine Jewish Association said. \nSpeaking to Anadolu Agency in Istanbul, Ariel Cohen Sabban, President of the Delegation of Argentine Jewish Association (DAIA) said: \u201cWe think that the relations between Turkey and Argentina will grow from day to day.\u201d \nSabban arrived in Istanbul on Friday with an 18-person Argentinian media delegation invited by Turkey\u2019s Foreign Ministry together with the Foreign Economic Relations Board of Turkey (DEIK) for a three-day visit. \n\u201cWe are sure that this visit to Foreign Economic Relations Board of Turkey will bring new business [opportunities] to both countries,\u201d he said. \u201cIt will also bring better relations between Argentina and Turkey.\u201d \nHe stated that Turkey and Argentina were \"on the same page\" in terms of improving their ties: \u201cBoth countries want to improve and want to restart a different vision in the world.\u201d \nIn January 2017, Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu had paid a visit to Argentina\u2019s capital of Buenos Aires. It was the first foreign minister-level visit after 18 years. \n\u201cYou may not always agree [with each other] but you must respect each other and you must be proud of your identity,\u201d Sabban continued. \n\u201cWe need to understand the past, we need to live the present and we need to project the future. So, the new generation could live on a better planet.\u201d \nThe ties between Turkey and Argentina dates back to 1910 when the first consular protocol was signed between the two countries. 2010 marked the centenary of bilateral relations, according to the Turkish Foreign Ministry's website. \nEconomic ties \nStating that the economic ties between the two countries fell behind the potential, Sabban implied to \u2018huge potential\u2019 in the relations. \n\u201cThe economic relations between the two countries could be much bigger than today. Today, it is very small in terms of the potential.\u201d \nThe trade volume between Turkey and Argentina in 2017 stood at approximately $610 million, which also remained below expectations. \nHe underlined the importance of having \u201cdialogue\u201d, \u201crespect\u201d and \u201ctrust\u201d among the nations in terms of establishing better ties. \n\u201cI am sure that this way of talking about everything; culture, politics, and problems [between the two countries] will bring a new way of confidence and grow the relations between the two countries.\u201d \nThe Jewish community in Turkey \nSabban expressed his pleasure that Jewish people had been living in Turkey in \u201cgood conditions.\u201d \n\u201cJewish people have been here for many, many years, in very good conditions. [\u2026] They are living here and investing in this country. We also need to thank for this,\u201d he said. \n\u201cIf I am here with kippah [the Jewish skullcap] in this country, I think everything is better than before,\u201d the president of DAIA added.", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "", "published": "2018-03-23T23:18:00.000+03:00", "title": "Police arrest over 170 FETO suspects across Turkey", "text": "Police arrest over 170 FETO suspects across Turkey \nArrests have been made in several Turkish provinces, including Istanbul and capital Ankara \nBy Mustafa Bayer and Sezgin Pancar \nANKARA \nPolice arrested 174 FETO suspects during early morning operations across Turkey on Friday. \nOut of the total, 12 suspects, including eight active and former soldiers were arrested during police operations in 15 Turkish provinces. \nAccording to Van Police Department, simultaneous operations were carried out in Van, Isparta, Bitlis, Ankara, Manisa, Izmir, Antalya, Tokat, Balikesir, Bingol, Konya, Kocaeli, Kastamonu, Hakkari and Sirnak provinces. \nSeparately, police arrested 38 FETO suspects in the capital, according to Chief Public Prosecutor's Office in Ankara. The suspects were affiliated to a labor confederation closed under a decree-law for its FETO links. \nAlso, three suspects were arrested in Ankara-based simultaneous operations across seven provinces. \nThe arrests, 30 in the capital and 11 in other provinces, came after arrest warrants were issued by the Chief Public Prosecutor\u2019s Office in Ankara. \nOf them, eight suspects were accused of using ByLock, an encrypted mobile phone application used by FETO members to communicate during and after the defeated 2016 coup, and providing financial support to FETO-affiliated Bank Asya after the group's judicial coup attempt on Dec. 17-25, 2013. \nAlso, Ankara police arrested 24 other FETO suspects as part of their anti-terror operation against FETO's setup within the Turkish police. \nTen others were arrested in Mediterranean provinces of Adana and Mersin, and northwestern provinces of Istanbul and Balikesir. \nPolice also arrested 25 suspects who were employees of a FETO-linked publishing company, Isik Publishing. \nA police source told Anadolu Agency that Istanbul police also launched a simultaneous operation to catch 55 suspects in 13 provinces, including Istanbul. So far, they nabbed 25 suspects out of the total, the source who spoke on condition of anonymity due to restrictions on talking to the media, said. \nSeven suspects, including a dismissed civil servant were also arrested as part of a FETO probe in Samsun, Kirikkale and Ordu provinces, Samsun police said. \nThe suspects were accused of working for FETO-linked firms and using ByLock, an encrypted cellphone app said to be used by FETO members to communicate during and after the defeated 2016 coup. \nOne more FETO suspect was held in central province of Eskisehir. During a search of suspect Yilmaz Y.'s home, police seized many books by Fetullah Gulen. \nAdditionally, six FETO suspects were arrested in central Kayseri province. The wanted suspects were said to be hiding in safehouses. \nSeparately, 35 suspects have been arrested in an operation centered in western province of Afyonkarahisar. \nIn simultaneous operations, police apprehended 35 suspects, including dismissed soldiers and military school students, over FETO links in 17 provinces. \nThe suspects were sent to a courthouse after health checkups in Afyonkarahisar Public Hospital. \nThirteen soldiers -- including 11 on duty -- were arrested in operations across nine provinces including Mersin, Ankara, Istanbul and Izmir. \nMersin Chief Public Prosecutor's Office said FETO's so-called imams had repeatedly contacted several military personnel through pay-phones. \nPolice arrested 13 suspects in operations across nine provinces. \nThe Fetullah Terrorist Organisation (FETO) and its U.S.-based leader Fetullah Gulen orchestrated the defeated coup of July 15, 2016, which left 250 people martyred and nearly 2,200 injured. \nAnkara also accuses FETO of being behind a long-running campaign to overthrow the state through the infiltration of Turkish institutions, particularly the military, police, and judiciary.", "highlightText": "", 0, "author": "", "published": "2018-03-23T21:40:00.000+03:00", "title": "14 Daesh members plotting Istanbul attacks captured", "text": "14 Daesh members plotting Istanbul attacks captured   \nStorming residential buildings in nine districts of Istanbul early Friday, police captured 14 suspects linked to the terrorist group Daesh. Suspects, including 13 foreigners, were planning to carry out attacks in the city, media outlets reported. The nationalities of foreign suspects were not revealed. Police also found digital propaganda material in possession of suspects for Daesh. \nOn Marh 9, Istanbul police captured 21 Daesh militants, foiling potential attacks. The terrorist group is responsible for several attacks in Istanbul as well as other cities. In June 2016, three Daesh militants killed 45 people in an armed attack followed by suicide bombings at the city's Atat\u00fcrk Airport. Last year, during New Year's celebrations, a Daesh militant killed 39 people at a popular nightclub on the Bosporus shore. The militant was captured alive in Istanbul's Esenyurt district a few weeks later. \nAmid fears that Daesh militants who fled Syria could hit Europe and Turkey, authorities have heightened crackdowns on the terrorist group with almost daily operations. Though Daesh lost a number of its strongholds in Iraq and Syria, a controversial deal, between Daesh and Syrian terrorist groups linked to the PKK that carry out attacks against Turkey, facilitated their safe evacuation from Raqqa, Syria. \nTurkey has stopped thousands of people from trying to enter Syria to join the group over the past few years. It is now concerned with militants fleeing Iraq and Syria following the fall of the terrorist group. Israel Today | Israel News", "text": "American Ambassador Responds to Palestinian Leader Calling Him a 'Son of a Dog' Wednesday, March 21, 2018 | Israel Today Staff America \nTension between the Palestinian Authority and the Trump Administration ratcheted up yet again this week when Palestinian leader Mahmoud Abbas insulted the American ambassador to Israel. \nSpeaking to Palestinian officials at his headquarters in Ramallah, Abbas referred to US Ambassador David Friedman as a \"son of a dog.\" \nTrump \"has said that [Jewish] settlement building is legitimate,\" Abbas complained. \"That\u2019s what several American officials have said including, first and foremost, their ambassador in Tel Aviv, David Friedman. He said [settlers] are building on their land. Son of a dog, they are building in their land?\" \nFriedman was made aware of Abbas' remarks just moments before delivering a speech of his own at the Sixth Global Forum for Combating Antisemitism in Jerusalem. \nThe American decided to bring up Abbas' insult, asking his audience, \"Antisemitism or political discourse? Not for me to judge, I will leave that up to you.\" \nIsrael Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu noted that such rhetoric from the Palestinian leadership has become the norm ever since Trump took office and Washington stopped blindly accepting the Palestinian narrative. \n\"For the first time in decades, the American administration has stopped pampering the Palestinian leaders and says to them: \u2018Enough is enough,\u2019\" said Netanyahu. \"Apparently, the shock from the truth is causing them to lose their tempers.\" \nWant more news from Israel? The Prime Minister told\nhim that today Iran threatens not only the Middle East but the entire world\nand added that Iran had to be prevented from acquiring nuclear weapons. The\ntwo men discussed advancing bilateral cooperation in technology, innovation\nand trade.\nPrime Minister Netanyahu thanked Bulgarian President Radev for Holocaust\ncommemoration in Bulgaria and said that he appreciated the latter's position\nin the struggle against anti-Semitism.\nPrime Minister Netanyahu:\n\"Mr. President, you have always been a staunch ally of the Jewish state and\nthe Jewish people. You've spoken eloquently and powerfully against\nanti-Semitism and you are welcome as a true friend, as is Bulgaria. We have\na special relationship with Bulgaria \u2013 past, present and future.\nWe'll never forget that 75 years ago, the people of Bulgaria in Sofia stood\nup in an exemplary way against the Nazi demands for deportation: The\nclerics, the teachers, the intellectuals who came to the train station in\nSofia. And I was always impressed by the telegram of the German\nrepresentative to Berlin who said, explaining the failure of this\ndeportation. He said: \"The people of Bulgaria haven't developed enough.\" And\nin fact, it showed the moral heights that Bulgaria reached in those days.\nAnd we know that there were dark periods in those horrible years. But we\nalways remember what happened in Sofia as a testament of human morality and\nfriendship to our people.\nToday we have excellent relations and they are buttressed by Bulgarian Jews\nwho came here, who form an integral human bridge between us. And equally, we\nhave flourishing relations, which we work in many ways to cement and develop\nin this visit of yours in a variety of fields, all fields really.\nAnd that leads me to the future. You were yesterday in Beer-Sheva, you saw\nour cyber center. Israel is seizing the future, not only in matters of cyber\nsecurity but in all matters of technology that will change our lives. I'm\nstill under the impression of a breakfast I had on Sunday with a visionary,\nElon Musk, who speaks about changing the world. He speaks about reaching\nMars, speaks about plumbing the depths of the earth and the human mind, and\nthese are not fantasies \u2013 these are things that are happening. Israel is at\nthe forefront of all this scientific research and technological know-how.\nWe're eager to share it with our friends. You are our friends, we share with\nyou the past, a vibrant present and unbelievable future.\nWelcome to Jerusalem friend.\"\nBulgarian President Radev:\n\"Thank you for the warm words that you have said about Bulgarian people.\nI want to congratulate you with the 70th birthday of Israel, which is now\nnothing but an example for a modern state with functional institutions,\nvibrant democracy and vibrant civil society. We are together in\ncommemorating the 75th anniversary on an unprecedented act of the rescue of\nBulgarian Jewish population, which is nothing but a solid foundation to\nbuild upon our ties. Israel National News", "text": "  Jerusalem Mayor Nir Barkat won't seek reelection Jerusalem Mayor Nir Barkat won't seek reelection \nNir Barkat says he will run for Knesset seat with Likud rather than seek third term as mayor of Israel's capital. Contact Editor Nir Barkat Nir Barkat's office \nJerusalem Mayor Nir Barkat announced Sunday that he would not seek reelection, and that he would instead submit his candidacy for the Likud list for the Knesset elections in 2019. \nBarkat will have served as the mayor of Israel's capital for ten years by the time municipal elections are held this October. \nThe mayor made the announcement in a video posted to his Facebook page. \n\"Sixteen years ago, I left all my business and dedicated myself to saving Jerusalem, the city I where I grew up and raised my family, at an annual salary of on shekel,\" Barkat said. \"With the help of many partners, especially Prime Minister Binyamin Netanyahu, we brought about a historic turnaround and put Jerusalem back on the road to growth, with the largest budget in the city's history.\" \n\"Now that Jerusalem is back on the right track, I won't run for a third term as mayor. I'll leave city hall at the end of my term, but I'll never leave Jerusalem. \n\"Now, I have decided to serve the State of Israel on a national level and to strengthen the Likud movement. which I believe in with all my heart and intend to seek the support of its members in the upcoming elections. My father always wished for myself and my brothers that we would serve the State of Israel without having to ask for anything in return. In every role that the public will impose on me, I will continue to serve for a shekel a year and will harness my experience and skills as a paratrooper officer, as a high-tech entrepreneur and as the leader of the most fascinating and complex city for the management of the citizens of Israel,\" he concluded. \nMoshe Lion, who ran against Barkat in the 2013 elections, announced that he would run  22, 2018 10:16 pm) Afghan National Security Advisor Mohammad Haneef Atmar went to the United States on Thursday after concluding two-day official talks with German officials. \u201c\u2026I have "2018-03-23T03:00:00.000+03:00", "title": "NC central working committee meet begins to review poll results", "text": "Back To Normal Life NC central working committee meet begins to review poll results \nKathmandu, March 23: A central working committee (CWC) meeting of the main opposition Nepali Congress (NC) kicked off at the party central office Sanepa to review the post-elections scenario. \nThe meeting began at 12:00 noon today will make a thorough review of the 'unexpected' results the party got in the elections to the House of Representatives and State Assemblies held in two phases late last year. \nThe meeting chaired by Party President and former Prime Minister Sher Bahadur Deuba is attended by senior leader Ram Chandra Poudel, General Secretary Dr Shashanka Koirala and other officials and central members. \nThe previous CWC meeting convened on January 18 and 19 held general discussions on the issue while the today's meeting will go through the issue in detail, as stated by party spokesperson Bishwa Prakash Sharma. \nThough this is the first CWC meeting of the party after the twin elections held on November 26 and December 7 last year, in-depth discussions on the poll results were still awaited. Those meeting focused on taking official decisions regarding the election of National Assembly, elections of the President and Vice President and on discussions about party's parliamentary statute. \nHe said this meeting which will last for three to four days in connection with holding extensive discussions shall also fix the date and place for the party's general body meeting. \nSome youth leaders in the party who have formed panels have been blaming the party leadership's working style for the drubbing the party faced in the elections. \nCentral committee members supporting party senior leader Ram Chandra Poudel and those supporting party president Sher Bahadur Deuba are said to be preparing for a showdown in the meeting, trading charges at each other in the meeting, the former blaming the party president's 'wrong' working style for the party's loss in the elections and the latter on the defensive. \nThe Nepali Congress, which is the country's largest and oldest party, could win only 63 seats, including 23 seats towards the first-past-the-post system and 41 seats in the proportional representation system, in the elections to the 275-member House of Representatives. \nThe Nepali Congress has to be content as the main opposition party in the federal and the provincial parliaments after the drubbing in the elections. "2018-03-25T03:00:00.000+03:00", "title": "Ram Nawami today", "text": "  Ram Nawami today \nKathmandu, Mar. 25:The Ram Nawami festival, the birthday of Hindu God Ram, is being celebrated across the country today. \nLord Ram, who was born to the then King of Ayodhya, Dashrath and his first queen Kaushalyawati, is considered the seventh incarnation of God Bisnhu.As per the Hindu mythology, it was God Ram who triumphed over Ravana, the then King of Lanka, a symbol of demonic and evil powers, and established peace and harmony in the society. The ninth day of the month of Chaitra on Shukla Paksha or the period of waxing moon, in the Lunar calendar is celebrated as the Ram Nawami, in commemoration of the birth of Lord Ram, said religious scholar Prof Dr Ramchandra Gautam. Ram, who is considered as an ideal man and the embodiment of perfect manhood and high morale, was born in the Treta Yug for the protection of virtue. can use IPL to regain place in limited overs squad, says Subramaniam Badrinath \nAustralian batsman Chris Lynn has revealed that he is on the road to recovery and will be available for the start of the IPL for the Kolkata Knight Riders. Lynn, who had earlier dislocated his right shoulder, was ruled out of Pakistan Super League T20 tournament. He was bought by the KKR for 9.8 crores. \nIt\u2019s tracking really nicely. It\u2019s a short turnaround with the timeframe that we\u2019ve got but it\u2019s all going well,\u201d Lynn said to cricket.com.au. \n\u201cThe docs and the physios are happy so that\u2019s all I can do. Fingers crossed I can keep going in the right direction and try to make myself available for the first game of the IPL. If not, it\u2019s not the end of the world but I\u2019m doing everything I can to get back out there. I\u2019ve had a bat during the week just on throwdowns, so I\u2019ll ramp it up next week against \u2018Cuttsy\u2019 and Billy Stanlake. If I can get through those two blokes, I\u2019ll know I\u2019m going okay,\u201d Lynn said. \nALSO READ: KKR hopeful of Andre Russell, Chris Lynn for opener vs RCB \nLynn has had three major injuries on his left shoulder in two years and they have taken a toll on the right-hander- both mentally and physically. \nRecalling the tough period, Lynn said, \u201cI just want to play some cricket \u2013 I\u2019ve missed so much cricket over the last three years. There\u2019s some strict and stern words of no diving (from medical staff), every hour of the day I get those words thrown at me.\u201d \nEarlier, Kolkata Knight Riders CEO Venky Mysore on Wednesday cleared the air about the injury concerns of Chris Lynn and said, \u201cWe are expecting Lynn and Russell to play on April 8. "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "", "published": "2018-03-24T13:57:00.000+03:00", "title": "Wriddhiman Saha warms up for IPL in style with 20-ball ton", "text": "Wriddhiman Saha takes acrobatic catch to dismiss Sadeera Samarawickrama, watch video \nWriddhiman Saha smashed a 20-ball ton playing for Mohun Bagan in a local T20 cricket match in Kolkata. Saha helped Bagan chase down a target of 152 in seven overs against Bengal Nagpur Railways (BNR) in a JC Mukherjee Trophy game. Saha\u2019s innings was punctuated by 14 sixes and four boundaries apart from two singles. He finished off the innings by hitting six sixes in an over off medium pacer Aman Prosad for six sixes. It also included a wide delivery, which means a total of 37 runs were scored. \n\u201cI could feel from the first ball that I was able to hit the ball in the middle and I went for it,\u201d Saha is quoted as saying by PTI. \u201cNot sure of this being a record, but looking into the IPL, I tried to play different shots and it worked.\u201d \nThe fastest T20 century overall was scored by Chris Gayle for the Royal Challengers Bangalore and it came off 30 balls. It is also the fasters century in any format of the game. Saha\u2019s century, though faster, was not scored in an official tournament and hence won\u2019t be considered. \nSaha has dound himself becoming Test specialist over the years. He is India\u2019s primary wicketkeeper in Tests since MS Dhoni\u2019s retirement in 2014, although Parthiv Patel was preferred over him for much of the recent tour of South Africa. But Saha has shown his ability in the T20 format and even scored a century in the 2014 edition playing for Kings XI Punjab. He was bought for Rs 5 crore by SRH in the auctions preceding the upcoming 11th edition of the IPL. Times of India", "title": "This is where the chicken in your roll may\u2019ve come from", "title_full": "This is where the chicken in your roll may\u2019ve come from | Kolkata News - Times of India", "published": "2018-03-23T03:00:00.000+03:00", "replies_count": 0, "participants_count": 1, "site_type": "news", "country": "IN", "spam_score": 0.0, "main_image": "https://static.toiimg.com/thumb/msid-63423123,width-1070,height-580,imgsize-1486809,resizemode-6,overlay-toi_sw,pt-32,y_pad-40/photo.jpg", "performance_score": 5, "domain_rank": 116, "social": {"facebook": {"likes": 587, "comments": 0, "shares": 587}, "gplus": {"shares": 0}, "pinterest": {"shares": 0}, "linkedin": {"shares": 0}, "stumbledupon": {"shares": 0}, "vk": {"shares": 0}}}, "uuid": "b151f20a502a39218cf794251528ba3221d94ebe", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/.wHSUbtEfZT0ll_t8WSZjwNKYkvzDCzyCzCzJT_rRcWOO70yURRbuZVLCZ0ZEurfuu8bATuCLc_51T3Qfat6JDRti1lDwTbbO1LYoHGQNC37Ln5SX2Xkh6wbWDXR.svFXOiGeaPGEZtPSvgCR_foit86b0dK6q58UXZHDJvqqBNyQDXKAVImgg--", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "timesofindia.indiatimes.com", "published": "2018-03-23T03:00:00.000+03:00", "title": "This is where the chicken in your roll may\u2019ve come from", "text": "This is where the chicken in your roll may This is where the chicken in your roll may\u2019ve come from Saikat Ray and Kamalendu Bhadra | TNN | Updated: Mar 23, 2018, 06:49 IST Representative image KOLKATA: Barely 100 metres from the Kolkata Municipal Corporation headquarters, a roaring business in sick and dead chicken goes on every dawn, unchecked and unabated. And, it isn\u2019t even done on the sly. At Murgi Patty on Fenwick Bazar Street behind New Market , these birds are openly sold and bought under the shadow of the clock tower. An overwhelming majority of customers are owners of roll, biryani and momo stalls that do brisk business on the city\u2019s streets, serving fares at unbelievable prices. Not just this spot, there are at least two other locations in New Market \u2014 one on Market Street and the other in the market\u2019s fish range \u2014 where sellers and buyers break into frenetic activity with lifeless and listless chicken when the rest of the city is asleep. This 45-60 minutes of business \u2014 whose turnover would run into crores a month \u2014 is so well-entrenched that civic officials and police officers deliberately look the other way. Shortly after 4.30am, the first of many trucks carrying chicken for the wholesale market arrives in the locality. Over the next hour, 20-25 trucks roll into the market, each carrying 1,500-2,000 \u2018live\u2019 chicken. But many among them are dead. They either die of temperature variation during the long hours of travel; or get suffocated in cramped cages used to transport them. Some also suffer from coccidiosis or chronic respiratory disease. The chicken are sorted out after unloading with dead and sick ones lined up on the road. Soon, the blacktop disappears as hundreds of motionless chicken pave the street and buyers converge from all over and strike deals for the dead meat. They all converse with a well-built man in the mid-30s. TOI reporters, too, approached him, posing as caterers looking for cheap meat. \u201cIt will cost you Rs 70 a kg,\u201d the man said, waving his arm at the insipid chicken. Live chicken sells for Rs 100 a kg in the market. He had a tip too. The dead and extremely sick chicken needed to be dressed immediately as transporting them could be risky given the sudden vigil on such birds following the chief minister\u2019s warning on Wednesday. All around, cash exchanged hands and the motionless birds were carted away in cycle vans. One of the buyers said he worked in a mid-rung hotel. \u201cMost of the chicken are picked up by small hotels and roadside eateries,\u201d he said. A few paces away where Fenwick Bazar Street met Market Street, a crowd had gathered before a shop where sick chicken were being dressed and sold. A couple of lay dead. Here, too, the rate was Rs 70 a kg for sick chicken. Abdul Latif, another chicken retailer in the area, said he sold them at Rs 65 a kg to regular customers. \u201cThere is no harm in consuming these chicken. They have either just died on the way or will expire soon,\u201d he reasoned. One of the buyers who has a biryani stall said he had been serving these chicken for over a year without any complaints from his customers. \u201cI sell chicken biryani for Rs 65 a plate. That includes a breast or leg piece. If I were to buy live chicken that sells for Rs 100 a kg, I would not have been able to do business,\u201d he said. Another few paces down Market Street and one lands at the fish range inside New Market. Here, too, ailing and dead chicken are sold. But the sellers here have become wary of strangers since last week. \u201cI don\u2019t sell cheap chicken to strangers,\u201d one of the traders said. When TOI later spoke to a customer exiting the fish range, he admitted having bought chicken for Rs 75 a kilo.  ", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [], "organizations": [{"name": "kolkata municipal corporation", "sentiment": "negative"}], "locations": [{"name": "kolkata", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "fenwick bazar street", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "new market", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "murgi patty", "sentiment": "none"}]}, "rating": null, "crawled": "2018-03-23T06:37:29.079+03:00"}, {"thread": {"uuid": "0e5a15b02239ce484b81eea7aa7cac13fcf78d88", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/DyQaNGXlfMpq8HEnNTp9633LOQohzWJQbtEF77zD0zBDEauHdefDlUxsxznrbyfZYl0.RIZCkgl1eD_U7n2pV3aT2a3lfVYvcMU2WTo.2lToPm1yZBa55HG0JEQ.yAVO4jNYvmZ2_EphXuNmfoB1HP_7e00XVgMtQgG4loIcL8A-", "site_full": "timesofindia.indiatimes.com", "site": "indiatimes.com", "site_section": "https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city", "site_categories": ["media"], "section_title": "India City News, Indian Cities | Cities News - "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "", "published": "2018-03-24T18:55:00.000+03:00", "title": "Kuldeep Yadav will have \u2018added pressure\u2019 in IPL, says Piyush Chawla", "text": "IPL 2018: Corey Anderson replaces Nathan Coulter-Nile in Royal Challengers Bangalore squad \nChinaman bowler Kuldeep Yadav will have \u201cadded pressure\u201d in the upcoming Indian Premier League despite his recent impressive showing for India, feels his Kolkata Knight Riders teammate Piyush Chawla. \nKuldeep is in his fourth season with KKR but it\u2019s only in the recent past that he has cemented his place in the Indian team as its go-to spinner along with Yuzvendra Chahal in the limited overs game. \nKuldeep took 17 wickets in six matches in South Africa to become the highest wicket taker by an overseas spinner in a bilateral ODI series in that country, surpassing Muttiah Muralitharan\u2019s 14 in 1998. \n\u201cThe way he\u2019s been bowling for India, it\u2019s been really good. He\u2019s been doing well both in domestic and international cricket. This season there will be added pressure on him,\u201d Chawla, who is also Kuldeep\u2019s Uttar Pradesh teammate in domestic cricket, said. \nKuldeep has an ability to soak pressure, something that has reflected in his bowling for India and Chawla feels the chinaman will do well. \n\u201cWhen he came into the scene for the first time, he was quite raw and there was not much of expectations from him. But this season, when he enters the field there will be a lot of expectations. He will definitely do well with the kind of bowler he is,\u201d Chawla said on the sidelines of a KKR promotional programme. \nKKR\u2019s \u2018mystery spinner\u2019 Sunil Narine was once again reported for suspect action during the Pakistan Super League but Chawla backed the West Indian to do well for KKR. \n\u201cThe best thing is the way he comes back after that (reported for suspect action). The effectiveness is the same. It\u2019s just that the team has started playing him a bit on the safer side. When they play you on the safer side, it becomes a bit tough for the bowlers to pick up wickets. \n\u201cBut at the same time, it is an opportunity for us to take wickets as batsmen take chances against us. So me or Kuldeep, we get chance to pick up wickets. My role will always stay the same \u2014 to take wickets. When I joined KKR, Sunil was taking wickets and our combination worked really well.\u201d \nChawla said the team was looking forward to playing under the new captain Dinesh Karthik . \n\u201cI have not that played much under him. He is one of the experienced campaigners and who has done really well. The way he\u2019s playing right now, the confidence will definitely help him to lead the side well,\u201d Chawla said referring to the Karthik\u2019s last-ball six against Bangladesh in the Tri-nation T20 final in Sri Lanka. \nKKR also have roped in three U-19 World Cup winning cricketers in Shubman Gill, Kamlesh Nagarkoti and Shivam Mavi. \n\u201cWe all have seen their performances while winning the U-19 World Cup. All of them are top level cricketers. Shubman Gill is one amazing talent, and one to look out for. He looks different, the confidence when he walks in is different,\u201d Chawla said, showering praise on Gill. \nThe programme was also attended by Ishank Jaggi who helped KKR enter the Qualifier 2 by stitching a 36-run stand with then skipper Gautam Gambhir in a rain-affected game in Bengaluru last season.
