Mohammed Shami gets central contract", "text": "Amitabh Choudhary writes to BCCI CEO objecting to appointment of new Marketing GM who had \u2018slut shamed Deepika Padukone\u2019 \nThe BCCI has handed Mohammed Shami a Grade B central contract after receiving clearance from the cricket board\u2019s Anti-corruption Unit (ACU), which also paved the way for him to play for Delhi Daredevils in the IPL. The fast bowler\u2019s contract had been held back pending investigation into the possibility that he had received money from a man through a woman based in Pakistan. \nWhile the Kolkata Police is probing the criminal charges against Shami, including Section 307 (attempt to murder), based on a complaint filed by his wife Hasin Jahan, the BCCI restricted its inquiry solely to breaching the anti-corruption code for the players. \nThe Committee of Administrators (CoA) had asked the ACU chief Neeraj Kumar to look into whether Shami had taken any money from a certain England-based Mohammed bhai, sent to him through a Pakistani woman, Alishba, in Dubai. \nOn Thursday, the BCCI release said: \u201cThe Hon\u2019ble Supreme Court of India appointed Committee of Administrators had requested Mr Neeraj Kumar, former Police Commissioner of Delhi and Head of BCCI Anti-Corruption Unit, to investigate the allegations against Mohd. Shami insofar as they pertain to the provisions of the BCCI Anti-Corruption Code. \n\u201cMr Neeraj Kumar has submitted his confidential report to the CoA. Based on the conclusions in the said report, the CoA is of the view that no further actions/proceedings under the BCCI anti-corruption code are warranted in the matter. \n\u201cFor this reason, the BCCI shall proceed with offering a Grade \u2018B\u2019 annual retainership contract to Mohd. Shami.\u201d \nThe speedster now joins KL Rahul, Umesh Yadav , Kuldeep Yadav, Yuzvendra Chahal, Hardik Pandya, Ishant Sharma and Dinesh Karthik in Grade B on Rs 3 crore per annum. And the BCCI clean chit also clears the decks for him to resume his association with his IPL franchise, Delhi Daredevils. The franchise had been waiting for the cricket board directive in this regard. \nAfter the BCCI verdict, Shami re-tweeted a DD post that said: \u201cWe\u2019re glad to hear the verdict! @MdShami11 has been cleared to play by the @BCCI.\u201d Talking to The Indian Express, Daredevils CEO Hemant Dua, too, welcomed the decision. \u201cWe are excited. You know it\u2019s for the (game of) cricket, not just for DD but more for cricket. He is a great bowler and he gets to go. We never had any doubts about that (on Shami). He is welcomed to join the DD camp, from March 27-28 (at Feroz Shah Kotla), when we start. We are very happy for him,\u201d Dua told this paper. \nMUST READ | Mohammed Shami-Hasin Jahan: How the sordid saga unfolded \nThe Daredevils exercised the Right-to-Match card option at the IPL 2018 auction to retain Shami for Rs 3 crore. \nLast week the Committee of Administrators chief Vinod Rai had told The Indian Express: \u201cAs per the recorded phone conversation, he (Shami) talks about taking money from some extraneous sources, from one Mohammed bhai. Now, the handbook for players specifically says that if they receive money from some extraneous sources, they are required to inform the BCCI. So we are asking him, what\u2019s the money for? The ACU will look into this. Rest we will follow the police inquiry.\u201d \nOff the field, however, a legal battle awaits the cricketer, as the Kolkata Police has booked Shami and his family members under non-bailable sections of the Indian Penal Code. Shami\u2019s mother Anjuman-Ara-Begum, brother Hasib Ahmed, Hasib\u2019s wife Shama and Shabina Ahjum, Shami\u2019s sister are among those who have been named in the FIR. The FIR has been lodged under section 498 A (husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty), 323 (voluntarily causing hurt), 307 (attempt to murder), 376(rape), 506 (criminal intimidation), 328 (causing hurt by means of poison), 34 (acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention) of the IPC. \nHasin, meanwhile, reportedly has sought an audience with the West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee as she said she wanted to have the chief minister\u2019s support in her \u201cfight\u201d against Shami. She has also recorded a confidential statement before a judicial magistrate. objects", "text": "Cricket Amitabh Choudhary writes to BCCI CEO objecting to appointment of new Marketing GM who had \u2018slut shamed Deepika Padukone\u2019 Amitabh Choudhary writes to BCCI CEO objecting to appointment of new Marketing GM who had \u2018slut shamed Deepika Padukone\u2019 Amitabh Choudhary has raised objections to the appointment of the Board\u2019s new General Manager (Marketing) Priya Gupta, citing a 2014 article written by her on Bollywood star Deepika Padukone. Written by Shamik Chakrabarty , Devendra Pandey | Kolkata | Mumbai | Updated: March 23, 2018 8:10 am BCCI office in Mumbai. \nBCCI acting secretary Amitabh Choudhary has raised objections to the appointment of the Board\u2019s new General Manager (Marketing) Priya Gupta, citing a 2014 article written by her on Bollywood star Deepika Padukone while working with The Times of India. Choudhary, in an email to BCCI CEO Rahul Johri, and copied to the Committee of Administrators (CoA) and other BCCI officials have also mentioned another article that described Gupta\u2019s take on the actress as \u201cSlut-shaming Deepika Padukone.\u201d \nQuestioning the BCCI\u2019s selection process that also involved recruitment firm Korn Ferry, Choudhary wrote: \u201cA simple search on the internet, revealed the following stories mentioning the candidate selected for the post we are presently concerned with, regarding an article that the person authored, the content of which is for everyone to see.\u201d \nThe two articles refer to the controversy that had started after The Times of India had tweeted a Deepika Padukone video with the caption: \u201cOMG! Deepika Padukone\u2019s cleavage show\u201d. To this, Deepika had responded with: \u201cYES! I am a Woman. I have breasts AND a cleavage! You got a problem!!??\u201d. \nGupta had defended The Times of India in an article with a headline \u201cDear Deepika, our point of view\u2026\u201d where she wrote: \u201cDeepika, just for the record, we do not zoom into a woman\u2019s vagina or show her nipples\u2026 What about all the times, and there have been many, when you have flaunted your body off screen \u2014 while dancing on stage, posing for magazine covers, or doing photo ops at movie promotional functions? What \u2018role\u2019 do you play there? So why the hypocrisy?\u201d \nAsked about Choudhary\u2019s objections, Gupta told The Indian Express: \u201cI really have no clue about it and I don\u2019t want to comment anything on it.\u201d \nKorn Ferry\u2019s candidate report on Priya Gupta, accessed by The Indian Express, gives the executive evolution, contact information, education, compensation package, personal and career details of the candidate. The \u201csummary\u201d segment said: \u201cShe has played a successful part in making Bollywood engaging. She is confident of doing that with BCCI and with cricket if she is allowed to give it a shot.\u201d \nGupta has been offered Rs 1.65 crore per year for the BCCI job, which she accepted. An email from Johri to the CoA on February 28 requested the \u201capproval\u201d to \u201cprocess the offer letter/contract\u201d. \nOn engaging Korn Ferry, Choudhary wrote: \u201cThe decision to do so was taken in a meeting in which I also participated\u2026 yet for reasons unknown, the decision\u2026 awaited my exit from the meeting despite the fact that (the) Acting Honorary Secretary\u2026 would sign on appointment letters.\u201d For all the latest Sports News , download Indian Express App Tags:", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "Writankar Mukherjee", "published": "2018-03-23T03:00:00.000+03:00", "title": "led tv prices: Customs duty on open cell displays halved, LED TV prices set to go down - The Economic Times", "text": "KOLKATA: The government has halved the basic custom duty on open cell displays used in the manufacturing of LED television panels whereby leading television makers like Samsung, LG, Panasonic and Sony are now likely to roll back the price increase on television sets. \n\nA notification issued by finance ministry on Friday evening said the government has reduced duties on open cell displays of 15.6-inch and above from 10% to 5%. This constitutes almost 95% of the television market. The government had imposed 10% duty on open cell panels in the last Budget as compared to nil which was earlier. \n\nThe industry was lobbying against the imposition of this duty and leading players like Samsung and Panasonic had earlier this month increased prices by up to 6% while others like Sony and LG had planned similar hikes for the new models which are rolled out in April. \n\nPanasonic India CEO Manish Sharma said the government\u2019s decision to revise the basic custom duty on open cell panels to 5% brings back the emphasis on \u2018Make in India\u2019 vision which will drive momentum and develop new capacities for television manufacturing within India. \n\n\u201cGoing forward, the consumer electronics industry can look forward to a developed manufacturing ecosystem whilst creating job opportunities,\u201d Sharma said. \n\nA senior industry executive said the companies will now try to absorb the impact of 5% taxation on open cell panels to boost demand, since television sales has not been growing since last October. \n\nSharma said with the new models now getting rolled out, the price increase, if any, will not be significant. \u201cWe will try to absorb the impact. With 5% duty, the overall impact on television manufacturing cost will be about 2.5%. We will make all efforts of not letting this passed to consumers to boost demand,\u201d he said. \n\nIn case of open cell panels, they are required to be finally assembled in the country to make the LED TV panel which is the heart of the LED televisions. Companies like Samsung, LG and Panasonic had started using this route for last two months and had invested on open cell assembling units. This was done after the government had increased custom duty on finished television sets and finished television panels to 20% and 15% respectively. \n ", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", humanitarian assistance for Donbas residents \nFrance allocates EUR 500,000 for humanitarian projects in Donbas, French Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian has said. \n\"We are determined to continue our assistance ... France has decided to provide financial assistance to two non-governmental humanitarian organizations that work there. France allocates EUR 500,000,\" Le Drian said at a press conference with Ukrainian Foreign Minister Pavlo Klimkin in Kyiv on Friday. \nHe expressed concern over the humanitarian situation in Donbas. \"I want to express our concern about situations that remain critical, victims that happen to be almost every week and those people who are hostage and suffer from unbearable conditions of existence,\" the minister added. \nAccording to Le Drian, the funds will be allocated for the implementation of projects to ensure the food security of the local population, as well as a project to restore the school in Krasnohorivka, Maryinsky district of Donetsk region, and restore reservoirs at the water station in Popasna, Luhansk region. The aggressor desperately aims to move the epicentre of the hybrid war as close as possible to the heart of Ukrain, to the beautiful city of Kyiv, our ancient capital city' he said.The head of the state added that over the last month, Ukraine's state security service has conducted two successful special operations. Savchenko was taken to the main building of the SBU (Ukraine's security service) in Kyiv. The court decided that Savchenko remains in custody for two months. Savchenko, the former pilot of Ukraine's Air Force and participant in the Donbas conflict, is charged with a number of crimes against the state: a coup d'etat attempt, organization of murder attempt destinations from Kyiv, five from Lviv in Oct \nIreland's low cost airline Ryanair in October 2018 is to launch flights to 10 destinations from Kyiv and five from Lviv, Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko said at a briefing in the Boryspil airport devoted to the arrival of Ryanair to the country on Friday. \nRyanair CEO Michael O'Leary said that the flights will be launched from October 15. \nThus, the airline will launch flights from Kyiv to Barcelona (four flights a week), Bratislava and Wroclaw (three each), Warsaw (four), Krakow (three), Poznan and Gdansk (two each), Vilnius and Stockholm (three each) London (five); from Lviv to Krakow (three), Warsaw (three), Dusseldorf (three), Memmingen (two) and London (three). \nAccording to a press release distributed to journalists during the briefing, the fares start from EUR 19.99, whereas in the presentation presented at the event - from EUR 9.99. \nAccording to the airline booking system, fares from EUR 9.99 are available on routes to Poland and Vilnius, EUR 19.99 - to London and Stockholm. The fare for flights to Barcelona, for example, in November starts from EUR 29.99. Sikorsky 22.03.2018, 17:27, Odnoklassniki Open source Kyiv city council agreed to name Kyiv International Airport (a.k.a. Zhuliany is one of the two passenger airports of the Ukrainian capital Kyiv, the other being Boryspil International Airport. It is owned by the municipality of Kyiv and located in the Zhuliany neighborhood, about 7 kilometers (4.3 mi) southwest of the city center. "published": "2018-03-24T14:32:00.000+03:00", "title": "Aggressor trying to move hybrid war epicenter into Ukrainian capital \u2013 Poroshenko", "text": "None 13:32 24.03.2018 Aggressor trying to move hybrid war epicenter into Ukrainian capital \u2013 Poroshenko \nUkrainian President Petro Poroshenko has said Russia is trying to move the epicenter of the hybrid war to the Ukrainian capital city. \n\"The less there is shooting in the war zone, the more active the enemy is in the rear. The aggressor is insistently trying to shift the epicenter of the hybrid war as close as possible to the heart of Ukraine, and the heart is our ancient capital, the beautiful Kyiv,\" Poroshenko said during the events on the occasion of the day of the Security Service of Ukraine in Kyiv region on Saturday. \nThe president stressed that the forces financed from Russia were preparing a coup d'etat in Ukraine in the interests of the Russian Federation, using the so-called theory of controlled chaos. \nThe president of Ukraine thanked the SBU for disclosing and documenting the link between the so-called \"protest camp outside the Verkhovna Rada\" with \"the Malorossiya political emigration into Russia\", for blocking the financial channel from Russia. \n\"You masterfully uncovered the enemy lair that was preparing large-scale terrorist attacks with numerous victims,\" he said. \nPoroshenko noted that within the framework of countering enemy propaganda, more than 100 Russian citizens were banned entry to the territory of Ukraine. \"We are talking about the spiritual heirs of Goebbels, who take part in the information war against Ukraine, posing as journalists, bloggers or experts,\" he said. \nThe president recalled that the courts had already passed 36 convictions on owners and administrators of anti-Ukrainian communities and pages in social networks VKontakte, Odnoklassniki and Facebook. \nAccording to him, sentences were also passed for actions aimed at violent change or overthrow of the constitutional order or seizure of state power (Article 109 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). \nIn 2017, 13 convicts were sentenced under the high treason charges. \"Any attempts by Russians, and even the fifth column inside the country, to revive the so-called idea of ''Novorossia' and stimulate artificial separatist movements in various regions are immediately suppressed,\" the president said. \n\"The activity of a group of persons coordinated from the territory of the Russian Federation that staged protests posing as various ethnic minorities was stopped,\" Poroshenko said. \nHe also recalled the \"Russian trace\" and the Russian involvement in provocations with the aim of fueling a conflict between Ukraine and its neighbors - Poland and Hungary. Presidential Administration The final revision of the National Security Bill provides parliamentary control of SBU work. Poroshenko stated that on the test site in Kyiv during the celebrations dedicated to the Security Service of Ukraine, broadcasted by 112 Ukraine.\u201cThe final revision of the National Security Bill provides control of SBU work by the civil parliament. It is important, as the Bill has to correspond with NATO standards, and our strategic aim is to become NATO member state,\u201d Poroshenko said.Earlier, Petro Poroshenko introduced the Bill to the Verkhovna Rada on February 28.Parliamentary representatives stressed the priority of the Bill, which will make Ukraine closer to NATO standards and provides a reform of the State Security sector. The USA insisted on this Bill to be adopted earlier.Yet, EU and NATO criticized Ukraine\u2019s Bill on National Security. Svitlana Zalishchuk, Ukrainian people\u2019s deputy, published a letter by EU representative in Ukraine, USA Ambassador in Ukraine, the Head of NATO delegation in Ukraine and the Chairman of EUAM Ukraine, where the Bill is criticized. They stressed that the series of articles in the Bill contradicts the practice of EU and NATO. "published": "2018-03-24T16:09:00.000+03:00", "title": "EU Commissioner Bienkowska to visit Kyiv on March 27", "text": "EU Commissioner Bienkowska to visit Kyiv on March 27 15:09, 24 March 2018 Politics 57 The event puts emphasis on cooperation between both partners, fostering convergence between the EU and Ukrainian regulations on specific issues. REUTERS On March 27, Elzbieta Bienkowska, European Commissioner for the Internal Market, Industry, Entrepreneurship and Small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) will visit the Ukrainian capital Kyiv. \nThe prime objective of the visit is to discuss with Ukrainian officials and business representatives the progress of reforms, the potential of EU-Ukraine industry and priorities for bilateral industrial and economic cooperation, EU Neighbours reported. \nRead also Le Drian in Kyiv: France aware what country behind aggression against Ukraine \nAccording to the EU press release, Commissioner Bienkowska will meet with Prime Minister Volodymyr Groysman and First Vice Prime Minister Stepan Kubiv, with whom she will open the 2nd EU-Ukraine High-Level Industrial and Regulatory Dialogue. \nThe event puts emphasis on cooperation between both partners, fostering convergence between the EU and Ukrainian regulations on specific issues, such as the automotive industry, textiles, raw materials, technical barriers to trade and public procurement. It also promotes enhanced cooperation on issues such as SME strategy and clusters and Ukraine's participation in key EU programmes, such as the Competitiveness of Enterprises and Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (COSME) and Horizon 2020. "title": "Tomorrow is Palm Sunday", "text": "Home \u00bb News \u00bb Tomorrow is Palm Sunday Tomorrow is Palm Sunday \nBy Sam Eyoboka \nCHRISTIANS and indeed Catholics the world over will tomorrow mark the feast of the Palm Sunday. \nPalm Sunday is the commemoration of the triumphant Entrance of our Lord into Jerusalem following His glorious miracle of raising Lazarus from the dead. Parishioners raising their palm fronds for blessing by the Catholic Bishop of Abuja, John Cardinal Onaiyekan for the procession to mark Palm Sunday, the beginning of the Holy Week to build up to Easter at the Our Lady Queen of Nigeria Catholic Church, Garki, Abuja. Photo by Abayomi Adeshida 09/04/2017 According to a release by the Director, Social Communications, Catholic Archdiocese of Lagos, Msgr. Gabriel Osu, \u201cPalm Sunday is one of the Major Feasts of our Lord, and it is the day on which the Lord Jesus Christ entered Jerusalem as a King, riding o\u00adn a donkey and a colt, the foal of a donkey. Accordingly, the crowds with palm and olive branches, who joyfully chanted \u201cHosanna, Son of David\u201d, greeted Him. On this day also, we receive and worship Christ in this same manner, acknowledging Him as our King and Lord.\u201d \nHe explained further that Palm Sunday also marks the beginning of Holy Week, the final week of Lent, and the week in which Christians celebrate the mystery of their salvation through Christ\u2019s Death and His Resurrection on Easter Sunday. The Holy Week starts from Sunday and will run till Good Friday, March 30, 2018. \nA major hall mark of the feast is the celebration of the Holy Mass followed by a procession of the faithful carrying palm branches, representing the Jews who celebrated Christ\u2019s entrance into Jerusalem. \nHere in the Archdiocese of Lagos, the Archbishop of Lagos, His Grace Alfred Adewale Martins is expected to lead thousands of the faithful in Palm Sunday procession through the streets of Lagos Island and environs. adekunle", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", Ibrahim", "published": "2018-03-24T04:36:00.000+03:00", "title": "AUGAPOL berates Buhari for kidnap, return of Dapchi schoolgirls", "text": "President Muhammadu Buhari, with the released Dapchi girls and their parents at the Presidential Villa, Abuja, on Friday. NAN photo Eric Dumo A civil society group, Activists United against Graft and Anti-People\u2019s Policies, have slammed President Muhammadu Buhari for his administration\u2019s handling of the kidnap and return of 105 female pupils of Government Girls Technical College, Dapchi, Yobe State, by Boko Haram. Describing the development as a \u201cpoorly scripted drama\u201d by the All Progressives Congress-led federal government to score a cheap political point ahead of the 2019 general elections, AUGAPOL said that rather than celebrate, the Buhari administration should cover its face in shame for the embarrassment it had caused Nigeria in the eyes of the international community. Speaking in Lagos on Friday during a press briefing, National Coordinator of the group, Comrade Mark Adebayo, said that the entire saga highlighted clearly how the regime had lost the fight against corruption it claimed to be tackling. He said, \u201cIf you look at what has happened with the kidnap and return of the female students in Dapchi by Boko Haram without any form of resistance by security agencies, you\u2019ll know that the entire drama is a poorly scripted one to score cheap political point ahead of next year\u2019s election. \u201cEven in the movie world, any director who tries to portray such as a story worthy of viewers\u2019 time, would be regarded as a quack. \u201cThis whole episode highlights just how much corruption has continued to fester under President Muhammadu Buhari, a man who rode to power with the promise of fighting graft.\u201d Speaking further, the group called on the Lagos State Governor, Mr. Akinwunmi Ambode, to put a stop to the practice of some state officials holding retreats with public funds outside the city, adding that any attempt to syphon tax payers\u2019 money through this means would be resisted Copyright PUNCH. "admin", "published": "2018-03-25T01:00:00.000+03:00", "title": "Put shame aside, come back to life, Liz Da Silva advices deportee, Lola Margaret", "text": "Breaking News Translate Home \u00bb News \u00bb Put shame aside, come back to life, Liz Da Silva advices deportee, Lola Margaret Put shame aside, come back to life, Liz Da Silva advices deportee, Lola Margaret On 11:00 pm In News , Showtime People by adekunle Comments \nBy Benjamin Njoku Nollywood actress, Liz Da Silva has advised her disgraced colleague, actress Lola Margret who is currently maintaining low profile after she was deported from the United States following alleged fraudulent activity to put the shame behind her and move on with her life. Liz Da Silva \nLola who celebrated her birthday yesterday reportedly has relocated to Ibadan from Lagos, as result of the deportation. The actress also, has since deleted her Instagram account after the incidence. \nIn her birthday message to Lola, which she posted on her Instagram page, Liz Da Silva advised the actress to put the shame behind her and move on with her life irrespective of what people would say about her. \nLiz said her shoulders are available for her to lean in case Lola needs to cry. She wrote, \u201cPls darling, you need to put somethings behind you and take the next step\u2026 come back to life as our ever smiling Lola Margaret. NOTE\u2026. those who say bullshit about you got nothing to offer, so keep you head upright and move on honey. And if truly you\u2019re around my shoulders are available okay, I love and miss you my darling friend \nApart from Liz, many other colleagues of the actress also sent her birthday messages as a show of solidarity. adekunle", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "lola margaret put", "sentiment": "negative"}, {"name": "liz da silva", "sentiment": "negative"}, {"name": "lola margaret  by benjamin njokun", "sentiment": "neutral"}, {"name": "lola margret", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "lola margaret", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "liz da silva  lola", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "lola", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "liz", "sentiment": "none"}], "organizations": [], "locations": [{"name": "united states", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "lagos", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "ibadan", "sentiment": "none"}]}, "rating": null, "crawled": "2018-03-25T01:53:47.019+03:00"}, {"thread": {"uuid": "5be0534a25f5380077d70fdfde5b11e8dd78b97f", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/8HG_hanVOKzoYS95y6Ply1gcB48yxxoUPG19IEnJXyNXuHsGfQmtaJ1MCviJB0QyGMOaCw3p5mwGVgFrFTeFNQ--", "site_full": "punchng.com", "site": "punchng.com", "site_section": "http://www.yohaig.ng/feed", "site_categories": ["media"], "section_title": "YOHAIG", "title": "Monkeys, the thieves of Lagos posh estate", "title_full": "Monkeys, the thieves of Lagos posh estate", "published": "2018-03-24T03:05:00.000+03:00", "replies_count": 0, "participants_count": 1, "site_type": "news", "country": "NG", "spam_score": 0.0, "main_image": "http://cdn1.yohaig.ng/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/Monkeys-the-thieves-of-Lagos-posh-estate1-3.jpg", "performance_score": 1, "domain_rank": 2692, "social": {"facebook": {"likes": 131, "comments": 0, "shares": 131}, "gplus": {"shares": 0}, "pinterest": {"shares": 0}, "linkedin": {"shares": 0}, "stumbledupon": {"shares": 0}, "vk": {"shares": 0}}}, "uuid": "5be0534a25f5380077d70fdfde5b11e8dd78b97f", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/8HG_hanVOKzoYS95y6Ply1gcB48yxxoUPG19IEnJXyNXuHsGfQmtaJ1MCviJB0QyGMOaCw3p5mwGVgFrFTeFNQ--", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "Abdulfatai Ayobami Ibrahim", "published": "2018-03-24T03:05:00.000+03:00", "title": "Monkeys, the thieves of Lagos posh estate", "text": "Tweet Gbenro Adeoye It looks serene: sitting quietly at the boundary of Lagos and Ogun states, tucked in the middle of the chaos offered by Lagos, the busy Lagos-Ibadan Expressway and unplanned Ogun communities. Even the large signboard that welcomes people to the estate boldly says \u2018Welcome to Riverview Estate, Isheri North \u2026For purposeful habitation\u2019. And like it says, the quiet in the estate is calming and refreshing. When Mr. Sola Olubunmi moved to LSDPC Riverview Estate, now famously known as Tinubu Estate, two years ago, he loved it immediately. He recalled being taken in by the sights and sounds as he was rewarded with the sound birds piercing the quiet of the early morning. And with monkeys being a familiar sight in the estate, Olubunmi felt the breathtaking beauty of nature first-hand. But within months of arriving in the neighbourhood, his love for the monkeys turned sour. \u201cWhen I first came here, I really loved it. It was so quiet and I loved to just look at the monkeys. They would come out from the bush behind my place and I would feed them. \u201cI felt staying close to them was added bonus. The people I met here used to tell me at the time that I would soon hate them, but I said that would never happen. Some even volunteered to get me catapult to use to dissuade them from coming to my place, but I said no. And truly, the story is different today. \u201cNow, I cannot stand them. One night, I came home and found my kitchen scattered and some food items gone. The monkeys gained access to my kitchen after tearing the window net. They ate my bread and other food items and messed up the kitchen. Then, I learnt my lesson. My love for them has turned to animosity and I can no longer stand them. It is now about \u2013 how can I get rid of them?\u201d Olubunmi said. The monkeys, including baboons and the residents of the estate are neighbours who have coexisted for over two decades. But now, the relationship is strained as the humans have grown tired of the primates\u2019 propensity to damage things and steal their food. Riverview Estate is known for its monkeys, which the residents call by different names- \u2018Thieves of Riverview\u2019, \u2018Sneaky thieves\u2019, \u2018Alibabas\u2019 and so on. It was learnt that the monkeys got to be living close to the estate because they were cut off by the expansion of human development into their natural habitat, leading to its depletion. Isheri Estates Community is a large community comprising estates and others off the Lagos-Ibadan Expressway. Some gated estates of million-naira mansions in the community include Riverview, Harmony and Isheri GRA. According to residents, the sections of the community inhabited by the monkeys are small bushy areas in Isheri North, behind Riverview Estate and by its entrance. Behind the estate is a land area allocated to some government officials in Lagos, but which is largely undeveloped. This is part of the little area that the monkeys still call home and even that will be taken away from them once development expands further. \u201cThe monkeys here failed to migrate before civilisation caught up with them. At the back of the Isheri North, there is a land area that didn\u2019t develop quite as fast as the others. Everyone allocated land there developed theirs except for some top government functionaries, who failed to develop theirs. So that part left undeveloped is the part inhabited by the monkeys. That was how the monkeys were cut off in that part that was still bushy, so they stayed back,\u201d Olubunmi said. In the community, stories abound about the first interactions humans had with the monkeys at the outset of the urban encroachment of the primates\u2019 habitat before the modern estates in the area were established. Some of the stories that have been told feature unconfirmed but interesting human encounters with gorillas. One of such stories as shared by one of the residents, who identified himself as Mr. Olamide and had lived in the community for 10 years, described how a group of surveyors stumbled across a troop of gorillas in the 1990s while investigating the land. \u201cWe heard that there was a set of surveyors that came here to work on the site in the 1990s and that the head of the group was very tough. This place was still a forest at the time. While the group was cutting through the forest, each time they saw snakes and some other wild animals along the way, the boss would tell them to proceed. The team was scared but he pushed them to go ahead. He sounded like he wasn\u2019t scared of anything. \u201cThen they stumbled across a troop of gorillas, who locked eyes with them and seemed to be sizing them up. We understand that the surveyors thought that their boss would give them the courage to still go ahead, but he didn\u2019t do that. He was the one who first took to his heels. We heard that he was so far ahead of his team that they didn\u2019t catch up with him until they got back to the Lagos-Ibadan Expressway,\u201d he said. Another famous story in the estate is about how a man, who used to catch monkeys in the area, was beaten black and blue by a gorilla. \u201cWhen I came here, I heard that there was a man that knew how to catch monkeys. I understand that he had a farm around here at the time and used to catch them to sell and to keep. Then there was a day the man realised that some monkeys were eating things on his farm, so he bought plenty palm wine and left it there. \u201cLater, he saw the monkeys drinking the palm wine and he was so happy that he had caught them because he knew that soon after, they would sleep off. And according to the story, soon after, they all slept off. So he started putting them in a cage. Then he saw something that looked like a man nudging the monkeys to wake up. But the monkeys were fast asleep. \u201cThen this thing, which the man later realised was a gorilla, grabbed a long sugarcane, cut it into two and started beating him. It was said that the man ran into the village here at the time with what remained of the sugarcane sticking out from his head,\u201d another resident, Michael Aboh, said. Although, there was no proof that the stories are true, the current residents identified the monkeys\u2019 favourite foods as bread, pawpaw, palm wine, banana and plantain, so there is no love lost between the two \u2013 humans and monkeys \u2013 with their diets clashing. The monkeys are fond of peeping into people\u2019s kitchens through the window and when they see food items that catch their fancy, they tear the net and squeeze through the burglarproof to steal it. \u201cThere are rules for people who live here and the major one is to keep anything that the monkeys might be interested in like bread, biscuits, plantains and soups away from your kitchen. When you are not there, don\u2019t leave anything they like lying around in your kitchen or anywhere they can catch a glimpse of it. \u201cBread is their favourite food. They have lived among humans for so long that they like to have some of our foods in their diet. They like pawpaw and palm wine too. When they see what they like through the window, they will do anything to get it. If you leave bread on your kitchen cabinet, they will tear the net to get it. Sometimes, I put my things, including pots of soup, in the passage. Some of my friends ask why I put them in the passage; they don\u2019t understand,\u201d Olubunmi said. Olubunmi recalled how his neighbour returned from a trip one day to find food items and monkey faeces strewn across the floor. \u201cAfter eating his soup and everything they could find to eat, they defecated in his kitchen. After that experience, his love for them disappeared. He was the one who used to encourage me to like them but after the incident, he started blaming me for encouraging them to come to the house. So he suggested that we lure them. \u201cSince they like palm wine, we thought we should even lure them with something more attractive than palm wine, so we bought two expensive bottles of whiskey and poured some on bread. But when the monkeys came, they took the bread, smelled it and tore off the part with the alcohol drink and ate only the dry part. \u201cThere was a day one came into my kitchen while I was at home. I had forgotten that I left bread on the cabinet. When I quickly rushed to the kitchen, it ran away. I was mad because the bread was still hot; I had just bought it from a bakery around here. And because it had touched it, I could not eat it again. \u201cSo I tried to lure it with the remaining bread so that I could trap it. I would leave a piece of bread in the kitchen and then attempt to quickly rush out to shut the window so I could trap him inside but each time, I failed. I must have tried it for about 10 times, and each time, he got out from the kitchen through the window before I could get to shut it. \u201cSince that day, that monkey stopped getting too close to me. I have noticed also that once you decide to catch them, they start staying away from you. They used to eat from my hand but since the time I decided that I would catch them; they stopped coming to take food from my hand. They would stay at a distance and wait for me to throw it. It was just like they could read minds,\u201d he said. There is a pawpaw tree in Olubunmi\u2019s compound, which he described as the one that survived after three attempts. He said the previous ones that were planted were eaten by monkeys and that the third one had survived because he practically guided it past the tender stage when it was edible for the monkeys. Now, for Olubunmi and the other residents of his compound, the challenge is getting to reach ripe pawpaw before the monkeys. \u201cThe pawpaw fruits that are on the tree now are being carefully monitored by residents of this house and the monkeys. As we are checking to see if the fruits are ripe, they are also doing the same. Recently, one evening, I saw one of them looking there. It looked at it, considered briefly if they were ripe and then left them after making up its mind that they were not. So we are both monitoring the fruits to see who gets them first. That is how it is here; we are competing with the monkeys,\u201d he added. All over the estate, there are different stories of experiences with the monkeys. Immanuel Adebayo shared the story of how a woman who had just bought a bunch of plantain and left it in the kitchen to quickly attend to her children, returned to see monkeys running away with it. \u201cIn just a few minutes, they had torn the net and helped themselves to the whole bunch. They took it all away. There were some children eating biscuits outside, some monkeys came down, took the remaining biscuits from them and started sharing them among themselves. All the kids could do was to stare at them. \u201cThere have been cases where monkeys have also stolen from little children sent to buy bread and snacks within the estate,\u201d he said. Adebayo, who helps his parents man their store, said he dared not leave the place for a minute for fear that the monkeys would eat the edible products being sold there. \u201cThe monkeys have stolen bread, sausages and biscuits here in the past but we are wiser now. I never leave this place for any reason except we lock it up,\u201d he said. Meanwhile, the rivalry between residents of the estate and the monkeys has recorded some casualties, on the part of the latter. Some monkeys have been caught and killed by residents. A resident, Emmanuel Kehinde, said, \u201cRecently, the security guards at the gate caught a monkey and the older ones showed up. Initially, the guards ran away before they were able to summon courage and return to drive away the monkeys that had come to fight for their own. The monkey later died and our suspicion was that the chain put round his neck to restrain him was too tight. \u201cThere was another one that was caught in a woman\u2019s kitchen and killed by residents. It was hit with an iron bar. They can be pests; we are tired of them. They damage things, including air conditioners because of the way they hop on them when jumping from house to house.\u201d However, a conservationist and environment activist, Mr. Desmond Majekodunmi, described the killing of the monkeys and their plight as \u201cvery sad\u201d, saying it was the humans that had invaded their habitat. He said, \u201cThe solution actually starts in our minds and it is not a difficult one. We have to understand that we human beings are not apart from nature; we are a part of nature. The monkeys may kill other animals but only for the purpose of eating and survival, if they are threatened. But there is no real justification for humans to kill them. We don\u2019t have to. \u201cThe developers of the estate, knowing that they had encroached on these monkeys\u2019 home, could put barbed wire on the concrete fence there and once the monkeys know that there is barbed wire there, they won\u2019t enter the estate. But because of that small amount of money they would not want to spend, they would rather kill off the monkeys. And sadly, our zoological services are not very developed and don\u2019t have enough budget, otherwise, such could try to capture them and put them in a safe place. But ideally, the whole forest area should be protected. \u201cIt is very unlikely that the monkeys would survive (since development will still get to where they are now); we don\u2019t have zoos that can take them and we don\u2019t have the right attitude that we need to protect them, and not only the monkeys, but the habitat as well. There should be small pockets of forests called urban forests that should be preserved. An example of such an urban forest is LUFASI \u2013 Lekki Urban Forest and Animal Sanctuary Initiative. \u201cDevelopment is not just concrete and asphalt. Development is working in harmony with nature, knowing that we are a part of nature. It is very sad that there is very little that can be done since the whole area will still be encroached upon.\u201d Majekodunmi, however, promised to discuss the matter with a conservation group to see if it could help find permanent sanctuary for the monkeys. "author": "Nigeria Today", "published": "2018-03-24T22:18:00.000+03:00", "title": "Lagos by-election: APC wins in Dopemu", "text": "The candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Mrs Rasheedat Adekunle, on Saturday emerged winner of the council by-election for Ward B(Dopemu) in Agege Local Government Area of Lagos State. APC \nAdekunle emerged winner after polling 980 votes to defeat MrAbdul- Rasheed Lawal of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) who got 480 votes and Lookman Afogunlowo of Accord who scored 288 votes. \nThe Returning Officer, Mr Samuel Agosu, while announcing results, said the APC candidate met the requirements to be declared winner and elected councillor. \n\u201cBy the power conferred on me as Returning Officer, I hereby declare Rasheedat Adekunle of the All Progressives Congress as winner of today\u2019s by-election. \n\u201cAnd Adekunle, having scored the majority number of votes and met the requirements of the law, is hereby returned and elected,\u201d he said. \nThe APC chairman of the ward, Mr Tunde Azeez, expressed excitement at the result. \nHe told newsmen that the outcome meant that the APC was solidly on ground in the area. \nAzeez thanked all the supporters of the party for being with the party throughout the process. \n\u201cI am glad at the outcome and the particular support of the Executive Chairman of the local government for the party in this election. \n\u201cWe are happy with the process and we hope to use this victory as a launch pad for more victories for the party in this area,\u201d he said. \nMr Lanre Ogundare, the state Secretary of Accord declined comment after announcement of results. \nNewsmen report that the election was largely peaceful in all the polling units in the area. \nThe turnout of voters was, however, low as most residents carried on with their normal activities as there was no movement restriction. \nNAN", "highlightText": "", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/jHIAmI4hxg9zMuu7yP7.9teonhbfg.v.hBA.q_hFjkfou7L6WslzLP_sbrCIVOIxcOZywmouFMzKyXgaW1TKeS1Kej1DhKOGNo.rnkpTumA-", "site_full": "www.nigeriatoday.ng", "site": "nigeriatoday.ng", "site_section": "http://www.nigeriatoday.ng/feed", "site_categories": ["7_12_education", "education"], "section_title": "Nigeria Today", "title": "I may write another letter soon "country": "NG", "spam_score": 0.0, "main_image": "http://www.nigeriatoday.ng/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/Obasanjo.jpg", "performance_score": 0, "domain_rank": null, "social": {"facebook": {"likes": 0, "comments": 0, "shares": 0}, "gplus": {"shares": 0}, "pinterest": {"shares": 0}, "linkedin": {"shares": 0}, "stumbledupon": {"shares": 0}, "vk": {"shares": 0}}}, "uuid": "53e921457613073c80835f0b823b9c315864069d", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/jHIAmI4hxg9zMuu7yP7.9teonhbfg.v.hBA.q_hFjkfou7L6WslzLP_sbrCIVOIxcOZywmouFMzKyXgaW1TKeS1Kej1DhKOGNo.rnkpTumA-", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "Ima Udoh", "published": "2018-03-22T22:14:00.000+02:00", "title": "I may write another letter soon \u2013 Obasanjo", "text": "Home \u00bb Lead \u00bb I may write another letter soon \u2013 Obasanjo I may write another letter soon \u2013 Obasanjo   Lead , News | 0 comments \nFormer president Olusegun Obasanjo has indicated he may write another letter soon barely two months after hos explosive piece on President Muhammadu Buhari. \nThe former president said this while speaking at the 14th annual lecture of Women in Management, Business and Public Service in Lagos on Thursday, TheCable reports. \nHave you read Trendiee Today? Click here to read \nIn the letter he wrote in January, Obasanjo asked Buhari to retire from active public service. He told the president to forget about contesting in 2019, saying doing so would amount to overstretching the tolerance of Nigerians. \nBut on Thursday, the ex-president said the new letter might not be as tough as that of January. \nHe also said the Coalition for Nigeria Movement which he introduced in the strongly-worded letter now has three million registered voters. \nHe said if Nigerians register for the elections in good time, they would benefit from the ideals of CNM and similar movements. \nObasanjo said at the \u201cright time\u201d, he would withdraw from CNM as long as the movement plans to groom capable hands for political positions. \nThe former president charged women on the need to be more visible in the political landscape and they have to \u201cdo enough for themselves\u201d. \n\u201cIf only womanhood was enough, Mrs Clinton would have made it to the White House but she had a man (Donald Trump) who did what he could do to get to power,\u201d he said. \n\u201cI don\u2019t want or expect women to climb palm trees to harvest bunch of palm fruits. If anybody says he wants to see my mother climb palm trees, I will take a second look at that person. \n\u201cBut women must do what it takes to succeed in Nigerian political space. \n\u201cTo you women, do not allow any body to build your world for you. Build your world for yourself. option of fine, said the convict should serve the sentence with hard labour.\n\u201cYou are hereby sentenced to 30 months imprisonment with hard labour and without an option of fine.\n\u201c\u201dThe \u201ctwice more expensive\u201d than national average   Lisbon rental prices \u201ctwice more expensive\u201d than national average \nIt is no surprise that Lisbon is more expensive to live in than any other city or town in Portugal, but new data has shown that renting a house in the Portuguese capital is twice pricier than the national average. \nThe average rental price of a property per square metre in Lisbon was \u20ac9.62 in 2017, way above the national average of \u20ac4.39. \nThe nearby towns of Cascais and Oeiras follow as Portugal\u2019s priciest places to rent a house, costing \u20ac8.06 and \u20ac7.84 per square metre respectively. \nNext on the list is Porto (\u20ac6.77), with the Algarve (\u20ac4.96) also highlighted as being among the most expensive areas to rent a house. \nThe data was revealed by the national statistics institute (INE). "2018-03-24T03:00:00.000+03:00", "title": "Dillian Whyte v Lucas Browne: Whyte knocks out Browne - BBC Sport", "text": "Dillian Whyte knocks out Lucas Browne in sixth round in London 24 Mar   Dillian Whyte produced a commanding performance at the O2 Arena Dillian Whyte moved closer to a fight with WBC champion Deontay Wilder with a punishing sixth-round knockout of Australian Lucas Browne at London's O2 Arena. \nThe 29-year-old Briton, who has now lost just once in 24 fights - to Anthony Joshua in 2015, ended Browne's unbeaten record in compelling fashion. \n\"I knew this was going to happen. Deontay Wilder where you at? June - let's go,\" he said afterwards. \nBrowne was treated by ringside medics. \nWhyte had vowed to make his opponent bleed and did so in the first round, opening up a cut under the 38-year-old's left eye that worsened as the fight progressed. \nWhyte was totally in control and had former nightclub bouncer Browne, who briefly tried to rally in the third, in trouble throughout with his jab speed and powerful right hand. \nIt was a left hook that ended the contest and resulted in Browne needing treatment, before eventually getting back to his feet to walk out of the ring after the stoppage. \nHe was taken to hospital as a precaution. \nWhyte, who is ranked number one by the WBC, remains the prime contender for a potentially lucrative contest against that organisation's high-profile champion Wilder. \nWilder, however, will be ringside at Joshua's fight with Joseph Parker next week, and could try to pursue a huge unification fight with the winner of that bout. Whyte found plenty of success with his right and ended the bout with a powerful left hook \nFellow heavyweight Tony Bellew said he was relieved Browne, who appeared slow and cumbersome from the second round onwards, was able to walk away. \n\"I'm just happy Browne has left the ring himself and not on a stretcher,\" he tweeted. \"Whyte has announced himself on the world scene. Browne is usually an extremely durable man. Wasn't tonight.\" \nWhyte said the win proved he can win a world title. \n\"Hopefully he's OK, he showed up and tried,\" he told Sky Sports. \"I proved I'm world class. My training paid off. I'm a good fighter but people haven't seen it yet. \n\"I need the challenge there. Lucas Browne thought his power was incredible. I might not have 22 knockouts but I can crack. \n\"When people stand in front of me it's a different story. I'm going to lay all of these guys out one by one. \n\"If Wilder fights anyone else I'm going to go to America and kick off. I just want to fight.\" \nWhyte had weighed in at 18st 2lbs 2oz, almost eight pounds heavier than when he outpointed British heavyweight Dereck Chisora in a notable 2016 victory, but still lighter than the 18st 11lbs 22oz Browne. Derek Chisora also had an early win in another decisive heavyweight fight \nEarlier on Saturday's undercard, Chisora stopped Frenchman Zakaria Azzouzi with a fierce right hand in the second round. \nChisora, 34, then demanded old rival David Haye put his purse with Bellew on the line in order for him to agree to a fight with Joe Joyce, whom Haye promotes. \n\"I'll make a deal with you right now: if he beats me you write me a cheque of \u00a31, if I beat him you give me your purse against Tony and your TV rights,\" said Chisora. \nHaye declined the offer. \nAlso on the undercard, Lewis Ritson successfully defended his British lightweight title with a second-round win against former champion Scotty Cardle. \nAnd Commonwealth light-heavyweight champion Callum Johnson added the British belt to his collection by beating Frank Buglioni by technical knockout in the first round.", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "lucas browne", "sentiment": "negative"}, {"name": "dillian whyte", "sentiment": "negative"}, {"name": "whyte", "sentiment": "negative"}, {"name": "browne", "sentiment": "negative"}, {"name": "deontay wilder", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "anthony joshua", "sentiment": "none"}], "organizations": [{"name": "bbc", "sentiment": "negative"}, {"name": "wbc", "sentiment": "none"}], "locations": [{"name": "london", "sentiment": "none"}]}, "rating": null, "crawled": "2018-03-25T02:17:37.019+03:00"}, {"thread": {"uuid": "336d5eaab04c89b4dd9dcceec850e13130c06ef3", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/.wHSUbtEfZRNMkchhcOVhynU3PuH_Hcs0ZE4dDORHzsOi1lfO1UaSysU3hPnaq8bpdJG9Z39cLWcHgg5Vb6gKaFPc_n.RRDVpTh7.p5o53I-", "site_full": "www.mirror.co.uk", "site": "mirror.co.uk", "site_section": "http://www.mirror.co.uk/rss.xml", "site_categories": ["media"], "section_title": "mirror - The scene of the latest shooting in Mile End, east London (Image: Twitter/rosehuang51) \nThere have been no arrests and enquiries continue. \nIn a separate incident, a man is fighting for life after being stabbed in Lambeth. \nPolice were called to the scene on Kennington Road at 11.38am on Friday. \nA 30-year-old man remains in hospital in critical condition. \nIt comes as the capital suffered its eighth murder in a week on Tuesday night. \nA man in his 20s was stabbed to death at Stratford shopping centre. \nAnd student Russell Jones, 23, was said to have been shot and stabbed to death in an unprovoked attack in Enfield last Saturday. \nHe was said to have been in 'the wrong place at the wrong time' when he was brutally assaulted by four thugs. "theguardian.com", "site_section": "http://feeds.guardian.co.uk/theguardian/business/uk-edition/rss", "site_categories": ["media"], "section_title": "Economy | The Guardian", "title": "\u2018Britain seems broken now\u2019: the Brexit refugees leaving for a new life in Europe | Money", "title_full": "\u2018Britain seems broken now\u2019: the Brexit refugees leaving for a new life in Europe | Money | The Guardian", "published": "2018-03-24T03:00:00.000+03:00", "replies_count": 0, "participants_count": 1, "site_type": "news", "country": "GB", "spam_score": 0.0, "main_image": "https://i.guim.co.uk/img/media/43363920348e981828d9ce5dfe5e7d795b53a219/0_403_6651_3991/master/6651.jpg?w=1200&amp;h=630&amp;q=55&amp;auto=format&amp;usm=12&amp;fit=crop&amp;crop=faces%2Centropy&amp;bm=normal&amp;ba=bottom%2Cleft&amp;blend64=aHR0cHM6Ly91cGxvYWRzLmd1aW0uY28udWsvMjAxOC8wMS8zMS9mYWNlYm9va19kZWZhdWx0LnBuZw&amp;s=852d70eb8772c4abf460009777a831d3", "performance_score": 10, "domain_rank": 170, "social": {"facebook": {"likes": 2844, "comments": 0, "shares": 2844}, "gplus": {"shares": 0}, "pinterest": {"shares": 2}, "linkedin": {"shares": 0}, "http://omgili.com/ri/.wHSUbtEfZSJlbPFf2vcZQ7DQwnenE_nMyOsLqYPnkzOeMnCMx_BAyCqcDQ6Rt5tZlQOmv0cZ9t7CzDwOt0C1TpEianlqz9CToh6f_olXedDGfagMkdk_VAJQ76itK53", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "Anna Tims", "published": "2018-03-24T03:00:00.000+03:00", "title": "\u2018Britain seems broken now\u2019: the Brexit refugees leaving for a new life in Europe | Money", "text": "A n increasing number of Brits disappointed and angry about the referendum result are opting to start a new life in Europe before the UK leaves the EU on 29 March 2019. They include Vishal Vora, who has quit London for Berlin and says \u201cBritain really seems broken now\u201d, and Liz and Gary Trow, who have relocated to France, saying that their daughter is enjoying a more multicultural environment.\nSome of the escapees have been setting up their own businesses, while others have managed to secure equivalent or even better jobs. And some have used this as a chance to make a career switch. And, rather than isolating themselves in the traditional expat enclaves, many are keen to embrace the local communities in their host countries.\nIn the week it was announced that the UK and EU have reached an agreement on a Brexit transition deal , Guardian Money spoke to three families who have upped sticks about how difficult it was to make the move and how they are coping.\n\u2018For an academic Britain is finished\u2019 Vishal Vora is happy to describe himself as a Brexit refugee. The 37-year-old says that \u201cfor an academic, Britain is finished\u201d so, following the June 2016 vote, he and his family decided to emigrate.\nHe is a legal academic and his wife, Abbie, is a magazine journalist. They have three children: Ramona, five, Grayson, two, and baby Margot, who is two months old.\nVora got a research fellowship in Germany and the family moved to Berlin last autumn. They have swapped their former home in Stoke Newington, north London \u2013 where they were \u201cliving like Victorians, four of us in a tiny one-bedroom flat ... many people wondered how we managed\u201d \u2013 for a beautiful and spacious \u201caltbau\u201d (old-build) flat in the centre of the German capital.\nHe adds: \u201cMy salary is \u20ac51,000 (\u00a344,500). We rent a 122 sq metre three-bedroom flat in the city centre with tenure for life, and the \u20ac1,835 (\u00a31,600) a month rent includes heating, water and housekeeping. The only extra is electricity, which is around \u20ac50 (\u00a344) a month. By contrast, my monthly mortgage payments on my 27 sq metre flat in London are \u00a31,000.\u201d\nI wanted to give my children the best start and for the basic stuff \u2013 housing, education and healthcare \u2013 to be sorted\nMeanwhile, the couple\u2019s children are in free full-time kindergarten, which Vora says would have cost \u00a31,800 a month in London. They have traded a car for a family cargo bike. Vora works outside Berlin and pays \u20ac400 (\u00a3350) a month on train fares. The family reckon food is pricier in Berlin but of better quality.\nVora says: \u201cI don\u2019t think it would be fair to blame Brexit entirely for our decision to leave the UK, though it played a big part. The problems in this country stem from what happened in Thatcher\u2019s reign: selling housing stock and not replacing it and privatising public services.\n\u201cThe UK has been neglected for decades and it shows: public transport is a joke, the NHS is falling to pieces, the education system is broken. I wanted to give my children the best start in life and I wanted the basic stuff \u2013 housing, education and healthcare \u2013 to be sorted. I feel in a country like Germany, this stuff \u2013 basic human rights, perhaps, in the western world \u2013 is sorted and doesn\u2019t cause me sleepless nights.\u201d\nAs a consequence, the difference between their lives in London and Berlin \u201cis as clear as night and day. Although we rent here, this isn\u2019t seen as a failure: 83% of the population rents with secure tenure. It\u2019s a contract for life, should we choose to stay here.\u201d\nHe adds: \u201cFull-time childcare is free and medical care is superb \u2013 my wife gave birth to our third child here eight weeks ago. She was able to stay in hospital for four days, we never felt pressured to go home and they provided everything for the baby. We had two other children in London at a top teaching hospital, and the difference was huge. My wife was basically asked to leave within 12 hours of giving birth.\u201d\nVora is a research fellow at the Max Planck Institute for Social Anthropology, which is funding his post-doctoral research into the role of legal identity among British Hindus, while Abbie gave up her permanent job in the UK to allow him to take this position. \u201cShe will begin freelancing in the next 12 months or so, but at the moment is enjoying being a full-time mother of three,\u201d he says.\n\u201cI visit London often for work and it will always be home, but with great regret, until the basic stuff is sorted \u2013 which won\u2019t happen in my lifetime \u2013 I don\u2019t see myself moving back. I value quality of life far too much to ask my family to put up with all of the above just to live in London. Things are going to get worse for the UK before they begin to get better.\u201d\n\u2018I had no connection here any more\u2019\nFacebook Twitter Pinterest Liz and Gary Trow have moved to France with their 12-year-old daughter.\nLiz, 35, and Gary Trow, 40, made the decision to start a new life in France with their daughter, Lara, 12, soon after the referendum.\nUncomfortable with the result, the couple felt they were in a minority in the Dorset coastal town of Poole, where there was a higher-than-average vote in favour of leaving the EU (58.2% versus 51.9% for the UK as a whole).\n\u201cI\u2019m worried it makes the UK seem unwelcoming to people from other countries,\u201d says Liz. \u201cAs an accountant I can see this affecting the stability of small businesses who rely on a continuous supply of European employees.\nIt\u2019s such a wonderful way to bring a child up - it\u2019s so different to what we were doing in the UK\n\u201cWith my grandad passing away, I felt I had no real connection or need to be here any more. No one was depending on us \u2013 it just felt like this is the time to do it.\u201d\nThe couple sold their house in Poole and bought a farmhouse and gite in the Loire valley, leaving the UK in March 2017. They relaunched Les Vigeants as a triathlon holiday centre and hosted their first guests last May.\nHaving come from an area where the majority of the population are white British (88%, according to 2011 census data for Poole, Bournemouth and Christchurch), the couple are happy that their daughter is growing up in a more multicultural environment. \u201cThe children round here are fluent in English and they are fluent in French, and have Dutch friends as well,\u201d she says. \u201cThat\u2019s such a wonderful way to bring a child up \u2013 it\u2019s so different to what we were doing in the UK.\u201d\n\u2018A kneejerk reaction after the vote\u2019\nFacebook Twitter Pinterest Terence Sheehan and his partner, Emma Holmes, now live in Alicante, Spain.\nTerence Sheehan, 51, and his partner Emma Holmes, 44, both from marketing backgrounds, have been taking Spanish evening classes to demonstrate their commitment to their new homeland since moving to Alicante in Spain, from Chiswick, west London, in June 2017.\n\u201cIt\u2019s respectful to learn Spanish and be seen to be at least attempt to pick up the language as quickly as you can,\u201d says Sheehan.\n\u201cWe are here not to just kind of mix with the expat community \u2013 we\u2019re here to mix with the Spanish community as well.\u201d\nHe adds that rather than deter them, the Brexit vote acted as a catalyst for the couple to follow through with plans to move to Spain.\nIt made us determined to make that move and to make sure everything worked out for us\n\u201cIt made us determined to make that move and to make sure everything worked out for us, which it has. It was almost a kneejerk reaction when we heard the result \u2013 just to get on with it and do our best. I still can\u2019t believe the way the vote panned out. I\u2019m a European first and foremost.\u201d\nSheehan says the property management company that they have set up, Holmes & Co, started \u201calmost by accident\u201d after a contact of a neighbour in Alicante asked for his help to market a holiday villa. \u201cOne property led to another, and we now look after about 10,\u201d he says.\nSheehan says expats are locked in a guessing game over the Brexit negotiations.\n\u201cPeople are concerned about the impact on their lives and how it will affect them in terms of healthcare, the exchange rate \u2013 will they get the same value for their money? Is the pound going to weaken?\u201d\nHe adds that there is also growing unease among retirees over whether UK pensions are going to be affected.\n\u201cAlso, when we leave the EU, expats are thinking about applying for Spanish citizenship because that will allow them to have the same benefits,\u201d he says.\n\u201cApril 2019\u2019s going to be interesting. But I can\u2019t see too much happening in terms of there being a dramatic change for everyone \u2013 there\u2019s just too much to lose for the Spanish and for the British government.\u201d\n\u2018We lost \u00a350,000 overnight\u2019\nFacebook Twitter Pinterest Alan and Julie Barber have turned their home in Portugal into a bed and breakfast.\nAlan Barber couldn\u2019t believe the referendum result. \u201cI\u2019m still not sure Brexit will happen. To me it made no sense at all,\u201d he says.\nBarber, 61, and his wife, Julia, 57, arranged the completion of their house sale for the day after the vote. They had planned to transfer the proceeds into euros to fund their new life in Castelo Branco, Portugal. But after the vote, the pound fell to its lowest level in 31 years.\nYou can almost see the stress leaving you when you get here\n\u201cWe lost \u00a350,000 overnight,\u201d Barber says. \u201cWhen we went to bed, the pound was quite high because everyone forecast that we were staying in, and when we woke up it had gone through the floor.\u201d\nEven worse, a week later and the day before they were to fly out to Portugal, the owner of the house the couple were buying found out they were from the UK and put the price up beyond their means.\n\u201cSo that house fell through and we said to the agent in Portugal: \u2018We\u2019re leaving, we\u2019re on our way, you need to find us something.\u2019 So he found us two schist stone houses, which are in a stunning location \u2013 better than the first one.\u201d\nWith the loss on the exchange rate and higher than anticipated costs on the replacement property, the couple converted their new home into a bed and breakfast.\nIn a nod to their Gaelic roots, Barber called the B&B Casa Tus Nua, which means \u201cthe house of new beginnings\u201d in Irish. \u201cBut in Portuguese it\u2019s the \u2018house of the naked women\u2019, so all the neighbours thought we were opening a brothel,\u201d Barber says. Recently the couple expanded the business by buying the nearby Vale Mour\u00e3o restaurant.\nDespite the initial upheaval, Barber likens their arrival in Portugal to \u201cthe steam rising off a wet jacket in a warm room \u2013 you can almost see the stress leaving you when you get here\u201d.\nTopics Buying property abroad Brexit Europe Consumer affairs Article 50 European Union features", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "Harriet Agerholm", "published": "2018-03-23T21:13:00.000+03:00", "title": "Cambridge Analytica: Investigators raid London offices after search warrant granted", "text": "Officers for the Information Commission have begun to search of Cambridge Analytica 's central London offices after a High Court judge granted a warrant.\nInformation Commissioner Elizabeth Denham wanted access to records and data in the control of the London-based company amid claims that Facebook data may have been illegally acquired and used for political campaigns.\nMs Denham announced on Monday she would seek an urgent warrant to search the offices, but a hearing on the matter was adjourned on Thursday.\nAnalytica : \u2018I\u2019m really sorry\u2019 The warrant was only granted on Friday evening. Less than an hour later, a group of 18 people, some wearing ICO enforcement jackets, were led by a woman holding a piece of paper that appeared to be a warrant.\nThey walked up a side set of stairs at the building in New Oxford Street, London, and were seen on the second floor - where Cambridge Analytica is thought to have its offices.\nEarlier, the Information Commission Office Twitter account posted: \"ICO granted warrant: We're pleased with the decision of the judge and we plan to execute the warrant shortly. This is just one part of a larger investigation into the use of personal data for political purposes and we will now need time to collect and consider the evidence.\"\nSeveral Twitter users have questioned the delay in obtaining the warrant, including Channel 4 News journalist Jon Snow who wrote before Thursday\u2019s adjournment: \u201cSurely unbelievable that the UK\u2019s information commissioner is STILL waiting to see a judge who will grant a warrant to go in and search the premises ... by the time she gets in there how much evidence will be left?\u201d\nBoth Cambridge Analytica and Facebook deny any wrongdoing.\nThe data watchdog\u2019s investigation includes the acquisition and use of Facebook data by Cambridge Analytica, its parent company SCL and academic Dr Aleksandr Kogan, who developed the app used to gather data. It stems from claims over the harvesting of personal data \u2013 and whether it was used during Donald Trump\u2019s US presidential campaign or the Brexit referendum.\nCambridge Analytica\u2019s chief executive Alexander Nix has been suspended while Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg has been called on to give evidence to MPs.\nAfter a hearing at London\u2019s High Court on Friday, Judge Leonard said he would give the reasons for his decision on Tuesday.\nPress Association contributed to this report", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [],
