Staff", "published": "2018-03-24T12:13:00.000+03:00", "title": "Historic non-stop flight between Australia and UK ready for take off", "text": "Historic non-stop flight between Australia and UK takes off The plane flying from Perth to London will be a Qantas Boeing 787 Dreamliner Credit: Getty Our Foreign Staff 24 March 2018 \u2022 10:53pm \nP assengers have taken off for the first direct flight between Australia and London, passing a major milestone by reducing to 17 hours a trip that once took 12 1/2 days. \nThe 9,000-mile flight from Perth, one of the world\u2019s most isolated cities, marks the first direct passenger service between the continents . \nQantas Airways' inaugural service between the Australian city of Perth and Heathrow took off on Saturday evening and will touch down in London at 5.05am on Sunday before departing for the return trip at 1.15pm that afternoon. \nPassengers will be on board the Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner aircraft for 17 hours as they make the 9,009-mile journey. \nThis is 24% further than the UK's existing longest route of 7,275 miles, operated by Garuda Indonesia between Heathrow and Jakarta. \nT he new link with Perth will be around three hours quicker than routes which involve stopping in the Middle East to change planes or refuel. \nIt will also enable faster journeys to Sydney and Melbourne than flying via Dubai. \nThe new link is part of Qantas' ambitious plans, unveiled over the past two years, to add ultra long-haul flights to its global schedules. \nThis will eventually include non-stop flights from Australia's eastern seaboard to Europe in an effort dubbed \"Project Sunrise\". \nQ antas chief executive Alan Joyce last year said such flights were \"the last frontier of global aviation ... the antidote to the tyranny of distance and a revolution for air travel in Australia\". \nTravel firm Flight Centre has recorded \"high demand\" for the new Qantas flights . \nIts head of aviation, Justin Penny, said: \"Flight Centre definitely feels that long-term the new route is viable and we will see additional services being launched from Europe to Australia in the coming years.\" Top 10 | The world\u2019s longest flights \nL isa Norman, the flight's captain, said \"we have been working towards (this) for the past three years and it\u2019s very exciting\u201d. \n\u201cWhen I joined Qantas not in my wildest imagination would I have thought this possible,\u201d she told the West Australian . \nCapt. Norman says she will be \u201cabsolutely exhilarated\u201d when the plane touches down in London. \n\u201cIt\u2019s like when a painter puts the final brush stroke on the work.\u201d Alan Joyce checks in for the first Perth to London direct flight. Possibly the most filmed check in ever at @PerthAirport @7NewsPerth pic.twitter.com/KjKhpbfbdu \u2014 Rob Scott (@Rob7Scott) March 24, 2018 \nA viation consultant John Strickland said the launch of the flights was a significant moment for the airline industry. \nHe told the Press Association: \"It will be a further test of how successful airlines can be with ultra long-haul flying and whether this delivers sufficient profitability to justify the investment in aircraft. \n\"Qantas will certainly be hoping to attract a higher proportion of premium customers due to the speed advantage combined with the 787's better cabin atmosphere.\" \nT he Dreamliners on the Perth-Heathrow route will have 42 business class flat-bed seats, 28 premium economy seats and 166 economy seats. \nThe aircraft boasts a number of advantages over other models, including lower cabin noise, larger windows, improved air quality and technology to reduce turbulence. History is being made today. Our new international terminal will open and all @Qantas services will operate from T3/T4. Check your itinerary for your terminal number. The first non-stop flight from Perth to London will depart this evening. \ud83d\udeeb \u2014 Perth Airport (@PerthAirport) March 24, 2018 \nT hey are also heralded for their fuel efficiency, although the impact of this will be reduced by the weight of the fuel needed to fly between the UK and Australia without stopping. \nThe world's longest regular passenger flight is operated by Qatar Airways between Doha and Auckland, at 9,025 miles. \nFor Qantas, the Perth connection is a high-profile test for a planned ultra long-haul network that the airline hopes will span the world by 2022. \n\u201cYou have the resources sector on both sides, you have banks, you have lawyers that all want to fly fast and reliably and comfortably,\u201d\u2019 said Rico Merkert, professor of transport and supply-chain management at the University of Sydney\u2019s business school. \u201cAnd I think they\u2019re prepared to pay the premium.\u201d flight board is live! Perth-London non-stop - last two continents to be connected by direct air service. Care to guess exact flight time (scheduled 17hrs, 20min)? I\u2019m tipping 16.59 pic.twitter.com/i3fOk73O9i \u2014 Andrew Parker (@ajamesparker) March 24, 2018 \nM ining companies in Western Australia dig up more than a third of the world\u2019s iron-ore and bring in some of the largest hauls of gems and rare earths. The sector also supports financial-services firms such as Hartleys Ltd., whose Perth-based director of corporate finance Steve Kite is booked on Sunday\u2019s flight -- the second in the new service to London -- for just a four-day trip. \n\u201cIt\u2019s effectively an overnight flight for me and that feels like I\u2019m saving a lot of time,\u201d Mr Kite said. \nN ot everyone is convinced of the route\u2019s commercial future. \nAircraft leaving Perth for London will need feeder passengers from around Australia, said Volodymyr Bilotkach, author of the book \u201cThe Economics of Airlines.\u201d But flying from Sydney to London via Perth saves little time over a transfer in Asia or the Gulf, he said. Historic flight Perth-London direct tonight with @Qantas Dreamliner making the first 17-hour non-stop service. Glad to be a part of last night's launch. Sure beats four days and 9 stops in 1947. Great boost for WA tourism and investment. pic.twitter.com/BpqLJY8Ueq \u2014 Michael McCormack MP (@M_McCormackMP) March 24, 2018 \nA ndrew McGinnes, a spokesman for Qantas in Sydney, said bookings on the new route \u201chave been strong\u201d and corporate clients in eastern Australia have indicated they\u2019ll stop in Perth for meetings on their way to London. \u201cIt\u2019s a very competitive market but this is a unique flight,\u201d Mr McGinnes said. \nAn analysis of flight times and prices highlights the challenges Qantas faces. \nFlying business class from Perth to London with Qantas in mid-June would cost A$6,614 (\u00a33,600). Opting for Singapore Airlines via Singapore would take an extra 2 1/2 hours but cost just A$4,843 (\u00a32,600), according to fares on Webjet. \nQantas has challenged Boeing and Airbus to build a jet by 2022 that can fly fully loaded from Sydney to London without a break. Success on the Perth-London service would lay the foundations for even longer routes to Europe. \n\u201cIt\u2019s really just the beginning,\u201d said Merkert at the University of Sydney. Related Topics", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [], "organizations": [{"name": "boeing", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "qantas airways", "sentiment": "none"}], "locations": [{"name": "uk", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "london", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "australia", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "middle east", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "heathrow", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "jakarta", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "perth", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "britain", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "garuda indonesia", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "dubai", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "sydney", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "melbourne", "sentiment": "none"}]}, "rating": null, "crawled": "2018-03-24T07:40:03.099+03:00"}, {"thread": {"uuid": "c469694369077ce3e8bd4a6ef09b85e8f0c4f82b", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/.wHSUbtEfZSJlbPFf2vcZQ7DQwnenE_noY1di9e.CNrnwv7NxjB728.QMbKa0xcsE8e7hZJCtT3Uf0VmLoBdFX1ypW.gy3VVK.pOermFAnRwqIfKPbNMcA--", "site_full": "www.theguardian.com", "site": "theguardian.com", "site_section": "http://www.guardian.co.uk/film/rss", "site_categories": ["media"], "section_title": "Film | The Guardian", "title": "Can we all just stop banging on about diversity in films?", "title_full": "Can we all just stop banging on about diversity in films? | Film | The Guardian", "published": "2018-03-24T03:00:00.000+03:00", "replies_count": 0, "participants_count": 1, "site_type": "news", "country": "GB", "spam_score": 0.0, "main_image": "https://i.guim.co.uk/img/media/0a5714b91057dc9531c9679c36c304920a42622d/0_0_6720_4032/master/6720.jpg?w=1200&amp;h=630&amp;q=55&amp;auto=format&amp;usm=12&amp;fit=crop&amp;crop=faces%2Centropy&amp;bm=normal&amp;ba=bottom%2Cleft&amp;blend64=aHR0cHM6Ly91cGxvYWRzLmd1aW0uY28udWsvMjAxOC8wMS8zMS9mYWNlYm9va19vcGluaW9ucy5wbmc&amp;s=fea792a7cbf782184e48a375a83da896", "performance_score": 10, "domain_rank": 170, "social": {"facebook": {"likes": 1119, "comments": 0, "shares": 1119}, "gplus": {"shares": 0}, "pinterest": {"shares": 1}, "linkedin": {"shares": 0}, "stumbledupon": {"shares": 0}, "vk": {"shares": 0}}}, "uuid": "c469694369077ce3e8bd4a6ef09b85e8f0c4f82b", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/.wHSUbtEfZSJlbPFf2vcZQ7DQwnenE_noY1di9e.CNrnwv7NxjB728.QMbKa0xcsE8e7hZJCtT3Uf0VmLoBdFX1ypW.gy3VVK.pOermFAnRwqIfKPbNMcA--", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "Romesh Ranganathan", "published": "2018-03-24T03:00:00.000+03:00", "title": "Can we all just stop banging on about diversity in films?", "text": "A va DuVernay, director of A Wrinkle In Time , spoke on the red carpet at the London premiere about how important the film was because of the diversity of the cast and crew, because the main protagonist is female and because it is part of the desire to bring a more diverse range of storytellers to the fore. Mindy Kaling, who is in the film, described DuVernay as a \u201cmovement\u201d, and Time magazine wrote about how the movie will change Hollywood.\nReviews suggest the film is dreadful. It has a 40% freshness rating on Rotten Tomatoes . The Guardian\u2019s Amy Nicholson gave it two stars , and one of those stars was purely for what Oprah did to her eyebrows. I can feel you getting annoyed with me. \u201cWhat\u2019s the matter, Romesh, are you against diversity? Are you delighted that the patriarchy has been reinforced by the failure of a film with a female protagonist?\u201d Well, no.\nBefore A Wrinkle In Time came out, you would be hard pushed to find anybody to describe at length what it was about. All the press centred on how great it was to have a female director of colour, to have a female protagonist of colour and how DuVernay \u201cwasn\u2019t just casting actresses\u201d but \u201cleaders \u2013 icons\u201d. I\u2019m not suggesting any of this is bad, by the way. This is obviously long overdue. But why does everyone have to bang on about it so much?\nTrumpeting diversity undermines what you are trying to achieve in the first place. It should happen without fanfare. There are people who are opposed to this sort of thing, and so when a film wears diversity on its sleeve, and then falls short, they throw up their hands and say things like: \u201cThis is what happens when you don\u2019t do things based on merit\u201d and, \u201cDo you remember the good old days when black characters were played by white blokes?\u201d Nobody wants these people to be happy. These people should be presented with diverse films and not told this is part of \u201ca movement\u201d. This is just how it is.\nHow did I handle casual racism in Los Angeles? Awkwardly | Romesh Ranganathan Read more\nMaybe I\u2019m being unfair. DuVernay probably did not want to focus on these aspects of the film, but that was all she was asked about. And there\u2019s something distasteful about me ignoring all the struggles she will have had as a black female director in Hollywood as I focus on how the film is being promoted. But I do think we all have a responsibility to push the discussion of these sorts of films away from \u201ca cause\u201d.\nA recent Kermode and Mayo podcast featured a listener who had written to say they had found Black Panther a bit boring, and hoped that its shortcomings did not remove Hollywood\u2019s appetite for films with a black superhero at the fore. You what, mate? I remember being chased out of school by bullies throwing eggs. I ran to where my mum was waiting. She flipped out and started battering the bullies with her handbag. For two weeks, everyone called me Mummy\u2019s boy and the girl I was going out with split up with me because she couldn\u2019t take the embarrassment. That fortnight was more fun than watching Batman v Superman, but I don\u2019t remember anyone saying that movie was going to undermine the future of films with white men saving the world.\nBlack Panther is a great film . It has the most compelling villain of any Marvel movie, and it deals admirably with the issue of diminishing jeopardy in a million superhero films where the world is going to end. It also has an almost completely black cast and some kick-ass female characters. It deserves to be judged on its own merits. We should not be talking about this film as a giant leap forward for movie-making; we should be talking about it as one of the most exciting Marvel films for a while. I would also argue that a film set in Africa having a lot of black characters in it should probably be a given, and also that Wesley Snipes must be bloody furious that everyone\u2019s forgotten about Blade .\nGhostbusters is another example. After it was announced the \u2019Busters would all be women, breaking all stereotypical traditions from the original film except for the one with the underwritten one-dimensional black character (\u201cYou guys are really smart about this science stuff, but I know New York and can borrow a car from my uncle!\u201d), the internet cracked under the pressure of a million fanboys expressing disdain from their mum\u2019s basement. The director, Paul Feig, was forced to defend these decisions and the film became a cause, with some reviewers scared to criticise it. It underperformed at the box office and the unfortunate consequence is that a load of internet losers think they\u2019ve been proved right. You can find them now campaigning for the destruction of every copy of The Last Jedi .\nAnnouncing a diversity initiative, or making it a cause, exerts unwanted pressure. This is not restricted to movies. When the BBC\u2019s then director of television, Danny Cohen, announced that it would put at least one woman on every panel show , this made the job of every woman on a panel show more difficult. All three of them were livid. In short, we should all be pushing to make more diverse films, TV shows and business opportunities. But we probably shouldn\u2019t mention it.\nTopics A Wrinkle in Time Ava DuVernay Women features", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "duvernay", "sentiment": "negative"}, {"name": "amy nicholson", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "mindy kaling", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "oprah", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "romesh", "sentiment": "none"}], "organizations": [{"name": "time magazine", "sentiment": "none"}], "locations": [{"name": "london", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "hollywood", "sentiment": "none"}]}, "rating": null, "crawled": "2018-03-24T13:02:12.013+03:00"}, {"thread": {"uuid": "ed1a0076b07bd873a2995e18267c9e348c6b6a2b", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/jHIAmI4hxg_Lw5DuKD76qeckkybPMllvY63Wnjr1GIZfDjkla8fkCQ--", "site_full": "www.bbc.com", "site": "bbc.com", "site_section": "http://www.bbc.com/news", "site_categories": ["media"], "section_title": "Home - BBC News", "title": "Cambridge Analytica offices searched over data storage", "title_full": "Cambridge Analytica offices searched over data storage - BBC News", "published": "2018-03-23T03:00:00.000+03:00", "replies_count": 0, "participants_count": 1, "site_type": "news", "country": "GB", "spam_score": 0.0, "main_image": "https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/news/1024/branded_news/14946/production/_100549248_ico.jpg", "performance_score": 10, "domain_rank": 130, "social": {"facebook": {"likes": 2769, "comments": 0, "shares": 2769}, "gplus": {"shares": 0}, "pinterest": {"shares": 12}, "linkedin": {"shares": 0}, "stumbledupon": {"shares": 0}, "vk": {"shares": 1}}}, "uuid": "ed1a0076b07bd873a2995e18267c9e348c6b6a2b", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/jHIAmI4hxg_Lw5DuKD76qeckkybPMllvY63Wnjr1GIZfDjkla8fkCQ--", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "bbc.co.uk", "published": "2018-03-23T03:00:00.000+03:00", "title": "Cambridge Analytica offices searched over data storage", "text": "Image copyright PA Image caption ICO officials were seen searching the London headquarters of Cambridge Analytica The London offices of Cambridge Analytica have been searched by enforcement officers from the UK's information commissioner.\nThe High Court granted the data watchdog a warrant amid claims the firm amassed information about millions of people without their consent, based on a 2014 quiz on Facebook.\nThe seven-hour search finished in the early hours of Saturday.\nBoth Cambridge Analytica and Facebook deny any wrongdoing.\nA group of people, some wearing ICO enforcement jackets, entered the building housing Cambridge Analytica's London headquarters at 20:00 GMT on Friday - less than an hour after a High Court judge granted the warrant.\nSeveral hours later members of the Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) were seen leaving the offices and a van - thought to be carrying gathered evidence - was driven away from the rear of the building.\nThe ICO applied for the warrant to access the databases and servers of Cambridge Analytica.\nImage copyright AFP/Getty Images Image caption The search of the London building continued into the early hours of Saturday The search is part of a wider investigation into political campaigning.\nInformation Commissioner Elizabeth Denham has said she was looking at whether personal data was acquired in \"an unauthorised way\", whether there was sufficient consent to share the data, what was done to safeguard it and whether Facebook acted robustly when it found out about the loss of the data.\nCambridge Analytica's acting chief executive, Alexander Tayler, said the company has been in touch with the Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) since February 2017 and it remained committed to helping the investigation.\nCambridge Analytica: The story so far The global reach of Cambridge Analytica Elon Musk pulls brands from Facebook In a statement , he said checks in 2015 showed all the Facebook data had been deleted but the company was now undertaking an independent third-party audit to verify none remained.\nCambridge Analytica chief executive Alexander Nix was suspended on Tuesday after footage broadcast on Channel 4 appeared to show him suggesting tactics his company could use to discredit politicians online.\nMedia playback is unsupported on your device Media caption Cambridge Analytica: What we know so far Claims over whether Cambridge Analytica used the personal data of millions of Facebook users to sway the outcome of the US 2016 presidential election and the UK Brexit referendum have also been raised.\nThe company denies any of the data harvested in the 2014 Facebook quiz created by an academic was used in its work for Donald Trump's campaign.\nMeanwhile, the director of Vote Leave has denied allegations of links between his campaign and Cambridge Analytica. Dominic Cummings said claims by the Observer newspaper are \"factually wrong, hopelessly confused, or nonsensical\".\nIn a separate development, Brittany Kaiser, Cambridge Analytica's former business development director, has told the Guardian the firm carried out data analysis for Leave.EU , the rival Brexit campaign to Vote Leave that was fronted by Nigel Farage.\nCambridge Analytica said it did \"no paid or unpaid work\" for Leave.EU.", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": ["https://ca-political.com/news/message-acting-ceo-dr-alexander-tayler", "https://www.theguardian.com/news/2018/mar/23/cambridge-analytica-misled-mps-over-work-for-leave-eu-says-ex-director-brittany-kaiser?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other", "http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-43518628"], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "alexander tayler", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "alexander nix", "sentiment": "none"}], "organizations": [{"name": "cambridge analytica", "sentiment": "negative"}, {"name": "facebook", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "information commissioner's office", "sentiment": "none"}], "locations": [{"name": "uk", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "london", "sentiment": "none"}]}, "rating": null, "crawled": "2018-03-24T00:24:27.059+03:00"}, {"thread": {"uuid": "e2799e4a18c05bd94b0a95cf5511f0f389713952", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/jHIAmI4hxg_Lw5DuKD76qUeg0cTQg9vGYPG4wZD1XMLTy8eennK2XB5ol6ZdaqrcUMKaDR_wIjg-", "site_full": "www.bbc.co.uk", "site": "bbc.co.uk", "site_section": "http://feeds.bbci.co.uk/news/world/asia/rss.xml\r", "site_categories": ["media"], "section_title": "BBC News - Asia", "title": "The evolution of UK-Australia travel into a single flight", "title_full": "The evolution of UK-Australia travel into a single flight", "published": "2018-03-23T20:21:00.000+03:00", "replies_count": 0, "participants_count": 0, "site_type": "news", "country": "GB", "spam_score": 0.0, "main_image": "https://ichef-1.bbci.co.uk/news/1024/branded_news/9DFF/production/_100474404_qantasdreamliner-imagefromqantaspress.jpg", "performance_score": 10, "domain_rank": 108, "social": {"facebook": {"likes": 1644, "comments": 0, "shares": 1644}, "gplus": {"shares": 0}, "pinterest": {"shares": 1}, "linkedin": {"shares": 0}, "stumbledupon": {"shares": 0}, "vk": {"shares": 0}}}, "uuid": "e2799e4a18c05bd94b0a95cf5511f0f389713952", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/jHIAmI4hxg_Lw5DuKD76qUeg0cTQg9vGYPG4wZD1XMLTy8eennK2XB5ol6ZdaqrcUMKaDR_wIjg-", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "", "published": "2018-03-23T20:21:00.000+03:00", "title": "The evolution of UK-Australia travel into a single flight", "text": "The flight will be the world's second-longest after Qatar Airways' route from Doha to Auckland, which spans 14,529km, according to the International Air Transport Association. \nOther carriers, including Emirates and United Airlines, have also flown non-stop journeys greater than 14,000km. Image copyright Getty Images Image caption Business class in a Singapore Airlines plane that flies from Singapore to New York \nAs technology advances make ultra-long flights more economically viable, other challengers are expected. \nSingapore Airlines plans to claim back the coveted longest-flight trophy, with a 15,300km journey between Singapore and New York. \nIt once flew that route using Airbus A340-500s, but stopped in 2013 because the four-engine plane was inefficient. \nAirbus is refining the A350, and its latest model will have a range of about 17,960km. That puts the prospect of an even longer route - such as Sydney to London - within reach. Who benefits from this route? \nThe Western Australia (WA) state government is expecting an increase in tourist numbers after an advertising blitz in London that calls on people to \"wake up in Western Australia\". \nThe state has entered into a A$5.7m (\u00a33.2m GBP) marketing agreement with Qantas, including screens showing the highlights of WA at London's Liverpool Street station. \nAccording to state Tourism Minister Paul Papalia, \"the campaign encourages travel into regional WA, as well as [local attractions] Rottnest Island, Elizabeth Quay and Perth's beaches\". Image copyright QANTAS Image caption Qantas and Western Australia's government have made an aggressive marketing push \nQantas potentially has an untapped market, according to Dr Wilkie. \n\"The UK is a standout market for Qantas, but many tourists never consider Western Australia. Now they'll get to see Perth too,\" he told the BBC. Melbourne will also benefit from a connecting flight. \nFierce competition from Asia-based airlines should also put pressure on fares, Dr Wilkie said. What's it like flying for 17 hours in economy? \nSingapore Airlines abandoned its previous flight to New York after deciding that 19 hours was too much to tolerate in economy. A move to convert the entire aircraft into business class was not financially sustainable. \nNow experts are looking at ways to minimise the toll that long-haul flights can have on passengers in economy. \nProf Steve Simpson, from the University of Sydney's Charles Perkins Centre, works with Qantas to study the impact of such a long flight on the human body. He describes it a test of human endurance. \n\"Your circadian rhythm takes cues off food and light, and this flight disrupts it,\" he said. Media playback is unsupported on your device Media caption Flying with the jet set back when travel was glamorous \nHe said that's why flight attendants typically lower window shades and serve meals at destination times - a move that often surprises passengers. \nTwenty people on the inaugural UK-Australia flight will be wired into monitors to check how their bodies are coping, including their temperature, which is crucial for sleeping. \n\"It will be 22C (72F) when people board, but 4C lower mid-flight, which tricks the body to change their internal clock,\" he said. \nPassengers can also use strategies to help themselves, he added. \n\"Get up really early a few days before the flight. Have an early lunch at [the airport], maybe at 10am,\" he said. \n\"The first meal on the plane becomes dinner. You'll sleep, even though it's only 4pm.\" Related Topics", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "londo", "sentiment": "none"}], "organizations": [{"name": "qatar airways", "sentiment": "negative"}, {"name": "united airlines", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "airbus", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "singapore airlines", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "international air transport association", "sentiment": "none"}], "locations": [{"name": "doha", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "auckland", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "new york", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "western australia", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "singapore", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "london", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "sydney", "sentiment": "none"}]}, "rating": null, "crawled": "2018-03-23T20:50:07.000+03:00"}, {"thread": {"uuid": "d27c4c7478cee3fac20f67b7873ae6f2c6335aef", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/jHIAmI4hxg_Lw5DuKD76qXsKhPHdwxyO2kYXRLafiJuiizAy0s9RUu3nQBQ_Ld1Z", "site_full": "www.bbc.co.uk", "site": "bbc.co.uk", "site_section": "http://feeds.bbci.co.uk/news/rss.xml?edition=uk#", "site_categories": ["media"], "section_title": "BBC News - Home", "title": "London Marathon: The Queen named official starter of 2018 race", "title_full": "London Marathon: The Queen named official starter of 2018 race", "published": "2018-03-23T15:18:00.000+03:00", "replies_count": 0, "participants_count": 0, "site_type": "news", "country": "GB", "spam_score": 0.0, "main_image": "https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/onesport/cps/624/cpsprodpb/10F26/production/_100541496_queen_getty.jpg", "performance_score": 10, "domain_rank": 108, "social": {"facebook": {"likes": 3606, "comments": 0, "shares": 3606}, "gplus": {"shares": 0}, "pinterest": {"shares": 1}, "linkedin": {"shares": 0}, "stumbledupon": {"shares": 0}, "vk": {"shares": 0}}}, "uuid": "d27c4c7478cee3fac20f67b7873ae6f2c6335aef", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/jHIAmI4hxg_Lw5DuKD76qXsKhPHdwxyO2kYXRLafiJuiizAy0s9RUu3nQBQ_Ld1Z", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "", "published": "2018-03-23T15:18:00.000+03:00", "title": "London Marathon: The Queen named official starter of 2018 race", "text": "  The 2018 London Marathon will be the 38th staging of the race The Queen will be the official starter for the 40,000 runners taking part in the 2018 London Marathon on 22 April. \nHer Majesty, who turns 92 on 21 April, will start the annual 26.2-mile race from the grounds of Windsor Castle. \nBBC Sport will relay coverage of the ceremony to the start in Blackheath, with the race finishing on The Mall. \nSir John Spurling, chairman of race organisers London Marathon Events said: \"We are honoured that Her Majesty The Queen has accepted the invitation.\" \nShe will step on to a special podium in front of the Round Tower at Windsor Castle to push the start button at 10:00 BST. \nIt will be the third time a member of the royal family has started the race, which was first held in 1981. The first was Princess Diana in 1988. \nDiana's sons Prince William and Prince Harry were joined by the Duchess of Cambridge to start last year's race. \nThis year's marathon, which will feature Britain's Mo Farah, takes place 110 years after the 1908 Olympic Marathon was started at Windsor Castle by the then Princess Mary, grandmother to the Queen. \nThe 1908 marathon, the showpiece finale of the Olympic Games, was the first marathon to be held over the classic 26.2 mile distance. "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "", "published": "2018-03-23T21:43:00.000+03:00", "title": "Rajya Sabha Election Result 2018: \u2018Major victory for BJP in UP\u2019, says CM Yogi Adityanath on bagging nine out of 10 seats", "text": "India Rajya Sabha Election Result 2018: \u2018Major victory for BJP in UP\u2019, says CM Yogi Adityanath on bagging nine out of 10 seats Rajya Sabha Election Result 2018: \u2018Major victory for BJP in UP\u2019, says CM Yogi Adityanath on bagging nine out of 10 seats Rajya Sabha Election Results 2018: After the success of the SP-BSP alliance in the Lok Sabha bye-elections in the two constituencies, the parties faced a tough competition against the BJP on Friday. By: Express Web Desk | New Delhi | Updated: March 24, 2018 12:54 am BJP leaders celebrate their win at the party headquarters in Uttar Pradesh on Friday. (Express photo/Vishal Srivastav) \nThe BJP in Uttar Pradesh scored a major victory on Friday by bagging nine out of 10 Rajya Sabha seats, days after it lost two crucial seats \u2013 Phulpur and Gorakhpur \u2013 in the recent Lok Sabha bypolls in the state. The remaining one seat went to the Samajwadi Party . Out of the 58 seats, the BJP has won 12 of the 25 seats in seven states as 33 candidates from 10 states were elected unopposed. \nWhile addressing reporters at the party office in Lucknow, Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath congratulated all MLAs of the party as well as of the allies. \u201cIt is a major victory for the BJP in UP. All the nine candidates of the party have won the Rajya Sabha elections,\u201d he said. The CM also blamed the Bahujan Samaj Party \u2019s (BSP) loss on the Samajwadi Party\u2019s (SP) \u201copportunism\u201d as it failed to transfer votes. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath at the party headquarters in Lucknow on Friday. (Express photo/Vishal Srivastav) \nPrime Minister Narendra Modi also conveyed his wishes to the winners. \u201cCongratulations to all those elected to the Rajya Sabha from various states and best wishes for their Parliamentary career. I hope they effectively voice the aspirations of the states they will represent,\u201d he posted on Twitter. \nREAD | Rajya Sabha Elections Results 2018 LIVE UPDATES \nSoon after the results were declared, state BJP chief Mahendra Nath Pandey said it was a victory of democracy and would boost development-oriented politics in the state. \u201cThis is the victory of democracy and it is for the welfare of Uttar Pradesh,\u201d he told media persons. \nBesides Union Minister Arun Jaitley , who is the party\u2019s most prominent winner, Ashok Bajpai, Vijay Pal Singh Tomar, Sakal Deep Rajbhar, Kanta Kardam, Anil Jain, Harnath Singh Yadav, GVL Narasimha Rao and ninth candidate Anil Kumar Agarwal, who pulled off a surprise win with the help of second preference votes, made it to the Upper House of the Parliament. \nOn the other hand, SP\u2019s candidate Jaya Bachchan won with the help of first preference votes, defeating BSP candidate Bhimrao Ambedkar in the prestigious battle of ballots, touted as a test for the new-found bonhomie between the parties headed by Akhilesh Yadav and Mayawati . \nREAD | Cross-voting charges fly thick and fast in Rajya Sabha elections \nAfter the success of the SP-BSP alliance in the Lok Sabha bye-elections in the two constituencies, the parties faced a tough competition against the BJP on Friday. With one BSP MLA believed to have cross-voted and two others in jail being denied permission to vote in the polls, the Opposition faced a challenge of numbers to ensure victory for their second candidate. \nMoving the poll panel against the two MLAs who are believed to have cross-voted, deputy leader of the BSP in the state Assembly, Uma Shankar Singh, said, \u201cWe have given a written complaint to the Election Commission that our MLA Anil Singh did not show his vote to the election agent of the party before casting it and we are awaiting a reply from the EC in this regard.\u201d BJP candidate Anil Jain celebrates his victory with his family. (Express photo/Vishal Srivastav) \nThe SP also lodged a similar complaint with regard to MLA Nitin Agarwal, who had switched sides after his father quit the party and joined the BJP recently. \u201cNitin Agarwal cast his vote without showing it to the election agent and we have demanded the cancellation of his vote,\u201d SP MLC Sunil Singh Sajan said. \nWhile the ruling BJP was confident of bagging eight of the 10 Rajya Sabha seats, the SP fielded Jaya Bachchan and the BSP, Bhimrao Ambedkar, for the remaining two seats. As the parties totted up the numbers, BSP MLA Anil Singh indicated that he had cross-voted in favour of the BJP, saying \u201cI am with Maharaj-ji\u201d, a reference to CM Yogi Adityanath. \nThe Allahabad High Court had denied permission to BSP\u2019s Mukhtar Ansari, currently lodged in the Banda jail, to vote in the Rajya Sabha elections. And a court in Firozabad had rejected a petition by SP MLA Hariom Yadav, who is in the Firozabad jail. \nThe Opposition banked heavily on the votes of two Independents \u2013 Raghuraj Pratap Singh alias Raja Bhaiya and his close associate and MLA Vinod Saroj. \nRaja Bhaiya, who has had a rocky relationship with BSP chief Mayawati, had tweeted this morning that he was with \u201cAkhilesh ji\u201d and specified that it did not mean that he was with the BSP. Akhilesh cancels victory celebration | Lucknow News", "text": "BSP: SP did its best; Akhilesh cancels victory celebration BSP: SP did its best; Akhilesh cancels victory celebration Post RS Loss, Where Is SP-BSP Bonhomie Headed? TNN | Updated: Mar 24, 2018, 08:30 IST Highlights The party called off celebrations planned to mark the victory of its lone candidate Jaya Bachchan to show its solidarity towards the BSP SP had fielded Jaya Bachchan as its candidate with 10 MLAs to spare for the BSP nominee as per the tie-up with Mayawati The celebrations included a dinner at a five star hotel in Lucknow and a \"Bhajan sandhya\" at the party office Akhilesh yadav (File Photo) LUCKNOW: With the Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) candidate, backed by Samajwadi Party (SP), losing to BJP in the Rajya Sabha polls on Friday, will the bonhomie between the two arch rivals - who came together to hand out a stunning defeat to BJP in the recently-concluded byelections in UP - continue? The first strong signal, despite the loss, came from BSP national general secretary and Mayawati 's close aide Satish Chandra Mishra, who said that the \"SP did its best in supporting the BSP candidate.\" SP was equally receptive. The party called off celebrations planned to mark the victory of its lone candidate Jaya Bachchan to show its solidarity towards the BSP. \"We had the required votes to secure Jaya Bachchan's victory and had planned celebrations in advance. But, party chief Akhilesh Yadav cancelled the programme once results began pouring in,\" said Akhilesh's close aide and SP MLC Udaiveer Singh. The celebrations included a dinner at a five star hotel in Lucknow and a \"Bhajan sandhya\" at the party office where apart from Akhilesh and Jaya Bachchan, party patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav was also slated to attend among other top leaders. According top priority to his alliance with Mayawati in the Rajya Sabha polls, Akhilesh deputed some of his senior and trusted MLAs to vote for the Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) nominee on Friday. The move, that may have put to risk SP's own candidate, is being seen as an attempt of the SP chief to win over Mayawati for a more formal and strong alliance ahead of the 2019 Lok Sabha elections. Akhilesh picked trusted MLAs to vote for BSP With a total of 47 MLAs, SP had fielded Jaya Bachchan as its candidate with 10 MLAs to spare for the BSP nominee as per the tie-up with Mayawati ahead of the Lok Sabha bypolls. However, after party MLA Nitin Agarwal joined BJP just days before the RS election and another MLA Hari Om, who was in jail, was denied permission to vote, the party was left with only eight extra MLAs. This when the party had already assured support of at least nine MLAs to the BSP supremo in the RS polls. Taking no chances that could disrupt the new found SP-BSP bonhomie, SP insiders said Akhilesh went ahead to mend fences with independent MLA Raghuraj Pratap Singh who was a member of his cabinet in the SP. Eventually, Raghuraj announced his support to Akhilesh at the SP\u2019s dinner party held on Wednesday. Thereafter, the SP chief hand-picked some of his most trusted legislators to vote for the BSP candidate to ensure that the party did not cut a sorry figure in case some of the party MLAs switched loyalties at the last moment. The final list of MLAs who would vote for the BSP was drawn on Thursday evening. On Friday, top SP leaders including leader of Opposition in assembly, Ram Govind Chaudhary, Akhilesh\u2019s two trused MLAs Subhash Pasi and Shailendra Yadav alias Lallai\u2014who was the SP\u2019s polling agent for the RS elections\u2014voted for BSP, according to senior party leaders. \u201cThe list also included names like Manoj Paras, Nahid Hasan, Rafeeq Ansari, Virendra Yadav, Prabhu Narain Singh and Gauriganj MLA Rakesh Pratap Singh, who was the host of the SP dinner held on Wednesday,\u201d said a party MP who was privy to the list. \u201cPutting his trusted men in the list goes on to show that Akhilesh kept weak links with himself to vote for the SP candidate and in case of any crossvoting, it could have put the party candidate\u2019s election in jeopardy,\u201d said a political commentator. Political observers describe Akhilesh decision to depute party veteran like Ram Govind Chaudhary and Shailendra Yadav Lallai among others to vote for the BSP as an attempt to send a message across to the BSP leadership that he has not only lived up to the \u201cdharma\u201d of the SP-BSP tie-up but at the cost of putting to risk the election of SP\u2019s otherwise secure candidate.  ", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "akhilesh", "sentiment": "negative"}, {"name": "mayawati", "sentiment": "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "timesofindia.indiatimes.com", "published": "2018-03-23T03:00:00.000+03:00", "title": "UP Rajya Sabha election 2018: I have voted for BJP, claims Mayawati's MLA", "text": "UP Rajya Sabha polls: I have voted for BJP, claims Mayawati's MLA UP Rajya Sabha polls: I have voted for BJP, claims Mayawati's MLA BSP MLA Anil Singh on Friday claimed that he had cross-voted in favour of the BJP in the Rajya Sabha polls, saying \"I am with Maharaj-ji\", referring to Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath. PTI | Updated: Mar 23, 2018, 20:37 IST Highlights Anil Singh said he had cast his vote and showed it to BSP agent Lalji Verma and the rest could be known from him \"I am with Maharaj-ji (Adityanath),\" he said after voting at the Tilak Hall in the assembly complex There are 11 candidates for 10 Rajya Sabha seats and 37 first preference votes required for victory in each seat LUCKNOW: BSP MLA Anil Singh on Friday claimed that he had cross-voted in favour of the BJP in the Rajya Sabha polls + , saying \"I am with Maharaj-ji\", referring to Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath . Deputy leader of the BSP legislature party Uma Shankar Singh also said he cannot be sure that Anil Singh had voted for the BSP candidate Bhimrao Ambedkar. \nI have voted for BJP, I don't know about the rest: Anil Singh, BSP MLA #RajyaSabhaElections https://t.co/28R7njmfnP \u2014 ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) 1521781287000 The Unnao MLA's vote could be crucial as it gives BJP the edge in getting a ninth Rajya Sabha seat from Uttar Pradesh. It is already assured of eight seats on the basis of its strength in the assembly. Anil Singh said he had cast his vote and showed it to BSP agent Lalji Verma and the rest could be known from him. Read also: All you need to know about Rajya Sabha election 2018 \"I have cast my vote after showing it to Lalji Verma and he will tell you the details ... I am with Maharaj-ji (Adityanath),\" he said after voting at the Tilak Hall in the assembly complex. According to Uma Shankar, 17 MLAs of the total 19 had cast their votes by midday and shown them to Verma. \"We are not very sure about Anil Singh as he was not present either in the meeting last night nor in the breakfast with party chief Mayawati this morning,\" Uma Shankar said. Read also: Latest updates on Rajya Sabha polls Another MLA of the party, Mukhtar Ansari, is in Banda jail. The BSP leader exuded confidence that all the nine surplus MLAs of the Samajwadi Party as well as seven of the Congress and one of the RLD have voted in favour of his party candidate. \"All the seven Congress MLAs went together to vote, while the SP has given us a list of their loyal MLAs,\" Uma Shankar said. The BSP, which has fielded the second opposition candidate, is already short of one vote in the event of the court's refusal to let Ansari vote. Independent MLA Aman Mani Tripathi said he was with 'Maharaj ji' and would vote for the BJP. There are 11 candidates for 10 Rajya Sabha seats and 37 first preference votes required for victory in each seat. Since the BJP and its allies have 324 seats in the Uttar Pradesh assembly, the saffron party can easily bag eight of the 10 seats and will still be left with 28 surplus votes as the four-MLA strong Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party (SBSP) has decided to go with the ruling party. \"There can be some contest on the ninth seat,\" a senior UP BJP leader said. The Samajwadi Party, which has fielded Jaya Bachchan, and the BSP, which nominated Bhimrao Ambedkar, appeared confident of winning one each of the remaining two seats. We have sent you a verification email. To verify, just follow the link in the message 5 /260 Amitabh Bachchan and Jaya Bachchan\u2019s assets doubled to Rs 1000 crore in past six years? Jaya Bachchan, who is a Rajya Sabha candidate for a prominent political party, on Friday, submitted her nomination and her affidavit that disclosed the financial details of the Bachchans. According to the affidavit, the assets of Amitabh and Jaya have reportedly doubled over the past six years from Rs 500 crore to Rs 1000 crore. Apparently, the immovable assets of the couple are currently stated as Rs 460 crore, which is twice more than what they had in 2012, which was around Rs 152 crore. The net estimate of their movable assets, on the other hand, has risen from Rs 343 crore to Rs 540 crore. Meanwhile, the two own jewellery worth Rs 62 Crore and 12 vehicles worth Rs 13 Crore. As for land assets, Jaya owns a 1.22-hectare agricultural plot worth Rs 2.2 crore in Kakori area of Lucknow. Likewise, Amitabh owns a 3-acre plot worth Rs 5.7 crore in Daulatpur area of Barabanki district. The Economic Times", "published": "2018-03-24T03:00:00.000+03:00", "replies_count": 0, "participants_count": 1, "site_type": "news", "country": "IN", "spam_score": 0.0, "main_image": "https://img.etimg.com/thumb/msid-63439088,width-672,resizemode-4,imgsize-77639/piyush-goyal.jpg", "performance_score": 5, "domain_rank": 116, "social": {"facebook": {"likes": 578, "comments": 0, "shares": 578}, "gplus": {"shares": 0}, "pinterest": {"shares": 0}, "linkedin": {"shares": 0}, "stumbledupon": {"shares": 0}, "vk": {"shares": 0}}}, "uuid": "8bc37cafcea9150ec7b9ca66c8374c9b00b7597c", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/.wHSUbtEfZQQUfcOKWcsr0V0Ky63VKcg8_xtNeMiMrvu2XML7eNnSoybhJ60Smoc849j.xdJpzYvaqKWuWCsVj2HjOui.coZ4URiIVSjNsHcc9sIUkUfenKX38tmIw54U2lNnhn3jq6sX2jTYkRB27m2eAEBMlvb8V9Ed5.7hKCHqJ48x6NXrJQ20ToK5OK686XdpFMcO6U-", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "Aman Sharma", "published": "2018-03-24T03:00:00.000+03:00", "title": "piyush goyal: Key players behind BJP's Rajya Sabha victory in Uttar Pradesh", "text": "Key players behind BJP's Rajya Sabha victory in Uttar Pradesh Key players behind BJP's Rajya Sabha victory in Uttar Pradesh Aman Sharma Piyush Goyal was sent to Lucknow on Thursday to strategise the moves along with CM Yogi Adityanath and both leaders remained in close touch with all MLAs to ensure they voted as per the plan. | ET Bureau | Updated: Mar 24, 2018, 13:40 IST NEW DELHI: Presence of Union Minister Piyush Goyal in Lucknow to fine-tune the strategy, BJP alloting two extra MLAs to its first eight candidates including its senior MLAs to Arun Jaitley, Anil Jain and GVL Narsimha Rao and UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath personally speaking to each MLA repeatedly to ensure there was no slip-up -- this is said to have been ingrediants of the perfect plan that tilted the scales in the favour of the BJP on the 9 seats in the Rajya Sabha polls in Uttar Pradesh . BJP allotted 39 MLAs apiece to its first eight candidates though it needed only 37 to make them win. That left only 12 MLAs of the NDA (which has 324 MLAs) for BJPs ninth candidate, Anil Agrawal but BJP made sure he sailed through by the second preference votes cast enmasse for him by the 324 NDA MLAs. \"No chances were taken for the first eight candidates as we did not want any invalid votes to mar our chances,\" a senior UP BJP leader told ET. Senior MLAs were alloted to the three prominent candidates, Arun Jaitley, GVL Narsimha Rao and Anil Jain, as a further precautionary measure. Each candidate was also allotted a senior Minister who ensured the allotted MLAs cast their vote for their enmarked candidate - senior UP minister Satish Mahana for example oversaw the MLAs who voted for Arun Jaitley. Senior Union Minister Piyush Goyal was sent to Lucknow on Thursday to strategise the moves along with CM Yogi Adityanath and both leaders remained in close touch with all MLAs to ensure they voted as per the plan. Goyal supervised a mock voting drill of all NDA MLAs on Thursday as many of them were first-time MLAs. BJP also succeeded in getting three upper-caste MLAs outside its camp to vote for its ninth candidate, Anil Agrawal who ultimately got 16 first preference votes instead of 12 alloted for him by NDA. Nishad party MLA Vijay Mishra, Independent MLA Amanmani Tripathi and BSP MLA Anil Singh voted for BJPs Anil Agrawal. Independent MLA Vinod Saroj may have voted for Agrawal too. Saroj is loyal to independent MLA Raghuraj Pratap Singh who said he voted for SPs Jaya Bachchan but went after voting to meet Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. \"We knew the BSP candidate will not reach 37 vote mark as one of that party's MLA was cross voting for us while one BSP and one SP MLA were denied permission to come out of jail and vote. The BSP candidate ultimately got only 32 first preference votes. Our strategy focussed on getting our ninth candidate to win by second preference votes - and it fell perfectly as per plan,\" a UP BJP leader said. SP, BSP MLAs cast ballot for BJP", "text": "Rajya Sabha elections: Cross-voting weakens opposition prospects in UP; SP, BSP MLAs cast ballot for BJP Rajya Sabha elections: Cross-voting weakens opposition prospects in UP; SP, BSP MLAs cast ballot for BJP While the opposition alleged BJP of \u201chorse-trading\u201d, the party clarified that they have not approached anyone and that the support from various leaders was being offered as they expressed faith in the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the CM. Written by Maulshree Seth | Lucknow | Updated: March 23, 2018 5:26 pm MLAs flash a victory sign as they are seen from a window waiting for their turn to cast vote for the Rajya Sabha in Lucknow on Friday. (PTI Photo) \nAs the polling on ten seats in the 245-member Rajya Sabha began in Uttar Pradesh, talks of cross-voting appeared to play spoilsport for the opposition, especially for BSP\u2019s ninth candidate, Bhim Rao Ambedkar. While each political party claimed that their votes were intact, some MLAs shifted their loyalties claiming that they voted in favour of \u201cMaharaj ji\u201d, UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. \nA neck to neck fight continued between BJP\u2019s ninth candidate, who appeared short of atleast five votes and BSP candidate who was short of three votes, at the time of filing this story. Challenges for BSP\u2019s Ambedkar increased after party MLA Mukhtar Ansari and SP MLA Hariom Yadav was not allowed to vote by the court. \nFollow Rajya Sabha Elections 2018 LIVE UPDATES HERE \nAs the voting began at 9 am, SP MLA and former Minister Shivpal Yadav was among some of the early voters in the assembly. Amid talks of cross-voting, Shivpal hinting at Jaya Bachchan assured that \u201cboth the candidates would win\u201d. Earlier in the day, CM Adityanath, also visited BJP Legislative Party office to meet the MLAs. \nHowever, as the day progressed, NISHAD party lone MLA Vijay Mishra made it clear that he had voted in favour of BJP to keep the unity of the country alive. \u201cDesh ki akhandata, bharstachara mukti\u2026desh ke gareeboon ko dhyan me rakhte hue vote diya , (Voted for unity, corruption-free country, keeping in mind the poor people of India),\u201d said Mishra. The shift in allegiance comes on the heels of Gorakhpur bypolls where the party had supported the SP-BSP combine. Soon, BSP MLA Anil Singh also claimed that he listened to the \u201cinner voice\u201d and went with \u201c Maharaj ji \u201d. \u201c Antaratma ki awaj mein Maharaj ji ke sath chalegaye ,\u201d said Singh. \nThe cross-voting changed the arithmetic of votes for the opposition, especially with independent MLA Raghuraj Pratap Singh, clearing in a tweet that his support for Akhilesh does not mean his support for BSP. \u201cNa main badla hun na meri rajnaitik vichardhara badali hai. Main Akhilesh ji ke sath hun ka yeh artha nahi ki main BSP ke sath hun.\u201d tweeted Singh. \nMeanwhile, SP MLA Nitin Agarwal, whose father Naresh Agarwal had recently joined BJP, also made it clear that he voted in favour of BJP candidate and so did independent MLA Aman Mani Tripathi. After casting his vote, Nitin said, \u201c Samajwadi Party chose someone who entertains the society, people will not accept her.\u201d \nCongress, which has seven MLAs in the state, had announced its support to BSP candidate issuing a party whip. Congress assured that their MLAs had not gone against the whip and voted for BSP. \nWhile the opposition alleged BJP of \u201chorse-trading\u201d, the party clarified that they have not approached anyone and that the support from various leaders was being offered as they expressed faith in the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the CM. \u201cWe are going to win all the nine seats. It is not we, who started this. In fact, BSP with just 19 MLAs fielded their candidate, so they started it. Since we had 28 additional votes for the ninth candidate we fielded too and all of them will win,\u201d said Deputy Chief Minister Keshav Prasad Maurya. We had held a meeting of our MLAs and it was decided that we will strongly support the BJP,\" national president of Apna Dal (S) Ashish Patel told PTI today.\nThe declaration of support from the Apna Dal (S) comes days after SBSP chief Om Prakash Rajbhar, a Cabinet minister in UP government, declared his party's support for the BJP candidates.\nThere are in all 11 candidates, including Union finance minister Arun Jaitley , in the fray for the 10 seats for which polling will take place on Friday.\nAccording to the Election Commission, voting will be held from 9am to 4pm. Counting of votes will be taken up at 5pm tomorrow itself.\nThe BJP and its allies have 324 MLAs in the 403-member assembly after the death of its Noorpur MLA in a road accident recently.\nTo secure a win in this Rajya Sabha election, a candidate needs 37 first preference votes. Arithmetically, the BJP can easily win eight of the 10 seats and will be left with 28 surplus votes.\n\"There will be contest on the ninth seat,\" a senior UP BJP leader said, exuding confidence that the saffron party would bag nine seats.\nThe SP and the BSP also appeared sure of win one seat each.\nThe SP has fielded Jaya Bachchan and the BSP Bhimrao Ambedkar. With 19 MLAs, the BSP is short of 18 first preference votes. With Naresh Agarwal's son Nitin, who is still an SP MLA, likely to cross-vote for the BJP, the task will become difficult for the candidate of the Mayawati-led party.\nBSP insiders said to be doubly sure of victory, Mayawati has sought a list of SP's loyal MLAs who will vote for her party candidate. She is also banking on some independent MLAs, who, though, are yet to reveal their cards, they said.\nRiding on the new bonhomie with the SP, Mayawati is banking on the 10 surplus votes of Akhilesh Yadav's party, besides seven votes of the Congress and one of RLD to reach the magic figure of 37 votes.\nHowever, Nitin Agarwal can queer the BSPs pitch if he votes for the BJP. Naresh Agarwal, who recently quit the SP and joined the BJP, has said his son would vote for the saffron party in the Rajya Sabha polls .\nThe country's most populous state sends 31 MPs to the 245-member Rajya Sabha, and the BJP, which won a massive victory in the 2017 Assembly elections, is set to get a lion's share of these.\nPresently, the BJP has 58 Rajya Sabha MPs.\nThe BJP candidates in the fray from UP are Union finance minister Jaitley, Ashok Bajpai, Vijay Pal Singh Tomar, Sakal Deep Rajbhar, Kanta Kardam, Anil Jain, Harnath Singh Yadav, GVL Narasimha Rao and Anil Kumar "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "", "published": "2018-03-23T14:38:00.000+03:00", "title": "Rajya Sabha elections 2018: Polling ends for 25 seats in six states", "text": "Rajya Sabha elections 2018: Polling ends for 25 seats in six states Rajya Sabha elections 2018: Polling ends for 25 seats in six states Source : SIFY Last Updated: Fri, Mar 23, 2018 17:08 hrs \nLucknow : With one BSP MLA believed to have cross-voted and two others in jail being denied permission to vote in the Rajya Sabha polls, the Opposition today faced a challenge of numbers to ensure victory for their second candidate. While the ruling BJP is assured of eight of 10 Rajya Sabha seats for which voting was underway today, the Samajwadi Party has fielded Jaya Bachchan and the BSP Bhimrao Ambedkar for the remaining two seats. As the parties totted their numbers, BSP MLA Anil Singh indicated that he had cross-voted in favour of the BJP, saying \"I am with Maharaj-ji\", a reference to Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. The Unnao MLA's vote could be crucial as it gives the BJP the edge in getting a ninth Rajya Sabha seat from Uttar Pradesh. However, reports also said that he met UP CM Yogi Adityanath after casting his vote. The Allahabad High Court has denied permission to BSP's Mukhtar Ansari, currently lodged in Banda jail, to vote in the Rajya Sabha elections. And a court in Firozabad has rejected a petition by SP MLA Hariom Yadav, who is in Firozabad jail. The Opposition is now banking heavily on the two votes of Independents -- Raghuraj Pratap Singh alias Raja Bhaiya and his close associate and MLA Vinod Saroj. Both appeared set to vote for SP's Jaya Bachchan, prompting party chief Akhilesh Yadav to thank Raja Bhaiya and post a picture with him on Twitter. Raja Bhaiya, who has had a rocky relationship with BSP chief Mayawati, had tweeted this morning that he was with \"Akhileshji\" and specified that it did not mean that he was with the BSP. The BSP did not take an adverse view of Raja Bhaiya's comment. \"... had he any reservations he would have said openly,\" said BSP deputy leader in the Vidhan Sabha Uma Shankar Singh. He added that he could not be sure that Anil Singh had voted for the BSP candidate. Keeping it ambiguous, Anil Singh said that he had cast his vote and showed it to BSP agent Lalji Verma and the rest could be known from him. \"I have cast my vote after showing it to Lalji Verma and he will tell you the details... I am with Maharaj-ji (Adityanath),\" he said after voting at the Tilak Hall in the Assembly complex. According to Uma Shankar, 17 MLAs of the total 19 BSP legislators had cast their votes by midday and shown them to Verma. The BSP leader exuded confidence that all the nine surplus MLAs of the Samajwadi Party as well as seven of the Congress and one of the RLD have voted in favour of his party candidate. \"All the seven Congress MLAs went together to vote, while the SP has given us a list of their loyal MLAs,\" Uma Shankar said. Independent MLA Aman Mani Tripathi also said he was with 'Maharaj-ji' and would vote for the BJP. There are 11 candidates for 10 Rajya Sabha seats and 37 first preference votes are required for victory in each seat. Since the BJP and its allies have 324 seats in the Uttar Pradesh Assembly, the saffron party can easily bag eight of the 10 seats and will still be left with 28 surplus votes as the four-MLA strong Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party has decided to go with the ruling party. \"There can be some contest on the ninth seat,\" a senior UP BJP leader said. BJP candidates in the fray from Uttar Pradesh are Union Finance Minister Arun Jaitley, Ashok Bajpai, Vijay Pal Singh Tomar, Sakal Deep Rajbhar, Kanta Kardam, Anil Jain, Harnath Singh Yadav and G V L Narasimha Rao. This ninth candidate is Anil Kumar Agarwal, a businessman. An LMC team will conduct a survey to determine the number of vendors in a ward to be granted permission. \n\nMunicipal commissioner Uday Raj Singh has directed the committee working on tobacco-related issues to prepare a draft for the licence system which can be implemented soon. \n\nHe said, \"We aim to implement licence system for tobacco vendors from the next financial year.\" \n\nTill date there is no regulation of tobacco products' sale and vendors opened shops wherever they wished. Many are also seen flouting the guidelines of Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act 2003 (COTPA) which restricts sale of eatables at tobacco shops. The rule also says that there should be no tobacco shop within 100 metre periphery of a school. \n\nLMC is planning to keep the licence fee considerably high to discourage people from selling tobacco products. As per the latest Global Adult Tobacco Survey , the consumption of tobacco has declined in India, but has shot up in UP. \n\nTIMESVIEWIt is a good move but success will depend on following three factors: 1) It will be a herculean task for the LMC to enroll tobacco vendors given the huge number of shops across the city. 2) LMC will have to put a dedicated team for issuance of licences and monitoring to catch violators. 3) LMC's track record in implementing such measures has been poor. For examples, many tobacco shops can be found around schools and colleges in violation of law. "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "Tennis World", "published": "2018-03-22T21:20:00.000+02:00", "title": "ATP ANALYSIS: Del Potro hits 25 winners and 11 errors against Raonic at IW", "text": "ATP ANALYSIS: Del Potro hits 25 winners and 11 errors against Raonic at IW MARCH 22, 2018 20:20 ATP Tennis \nIn what has been their fourth and so far the most important match, Juan Martin del Potro toppled Milos Raonic 6-2 6-3 in 65 minutes to reach the final at Indian Wells, his fourth at Masters 1000 series and the first since Shanghai 2013. Milos, who struggled with injuries in the second part of 2017 and scored just one win in the first three tournaments he played this year, found a good form at Indian Wells and he advanced into his first semi-final since Lyon last May and the first at Masters 1000 level since Paris 2016. \nOn the other hand, del Potro came to the desert with a lot of confidence, winning the title in Acapulco (his first above ATP 250 level after 2013) and he scored challenging wins over Leonardo Mayer and Philipp Kohlschreiber in order to reach the semi-final. \nBoth players were eager to give their best and earn the place in the final but it turned out to be a rather one-sided affair, that lasted just over an hour. Del Potro controlled the match from start to finish, losing eight points on serve and never facing a break point. \nThe pressure was on Milos and he couldn't handle it, dropping almost half of the points in his games and making too many errors to it an exit door in just over an hour. Working with Goran Ivanisevic, Milos tried to make more net rushings here at Indian Wells but it didn't work against del Potro who tamed his shots nicely to keep the points on his racquet and dominate the scoreboard from start to finish. \nThe Argentinian had 25 winners and just 11 errors in total while Raonic stood on a negative 21-28 ratio that couldn't bring him the better result. The Canadian had 13 service winners but that wasn't enough to keep his service games safe without a strong first groundstroke after an initial shot. \nDel Potro was returning well and imposing his shots after a few exchanges, sending deep and precise balls from both wings to keep Milos without an answer and forcing him to make a lot of errors. They had a similar number of direct points from the field but Raonic needed much more than that if he wanted to stay on the court more since he found it hard to control his strokes, both from the baseline and at the net. \nIt was a calm and collected game from del Potro that we also saw in the final against Roger that gained him the advantage on the court, sailing through his service games, moving around the court nicely to cover every part of it and taming his shots to have the upper hand in both the short and longer points. \nThe Argentinian was 15-13 in front in service winners and 10-8 in the direct points from the field, which could only mean trouble for Raonic. The Canadian sprayed 15 unforced errors compared to only seven from Juan Martin and they were on a similar distance in terms of forced errors, with 11 for Milos and only three for his rival. \nDel Potro had the upper hand in the shortest points up to four strokes with a 31-19 advantage, losing just three points behind his first serve and firing his first groundstroke with more efficiency than Milos. He was also 14-10 in front in the mid-range exchanges from five to eight strokes and 8-3 when the point would reach the ninth shot. \nPoint by point result and the number of shots in the rallies: \u2193 SHOW RESULTS \u2193 \n1. "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "Lucy.Whitehouse@wrbm.com (Lucy Whitehouse)", "published": "2018-03-23T16:26:00.000+03:00", "title": "Groupe GM tackles increased demand with multi-million investment in French manufacturing site", "text": "  Groupe GM tackles increased demand with multi-million investment in French manufacturing site By Lucy Whitehouse Email to a friend Groupe GM, a major player in the global guest amenity industry, has announced a multi-million euro investment in the expansion of its Groupe GM Cosm\u00e9tiques France (GGMCF) plant in Lyon. \nAccording to the French company, the factory - which produces high-quality amenity products for hotels in more than 70 countries - has been facing a considerable increase in orders since late 2016. \nGrowing demand \u200b \nIn terms of production, the company has witnessed significant growth in units produced. In 2015, the Lyon plant manufactured 40 million tubes and bottles. \nIn 2019, GGMCF will reportedly be able to produce up to 85 million of tubes and bottles - more than twice the amount delivered in 2015. To bolster this growth, the factory has also doubled its emulsion production capacity. \n\u201cThe expansion of our Groupe GM Cosm\u00e9tiques France factory in Lyon is an important investment for Groupe GM as it responds to the growing demand for our products\u201d \u200b, said Laurent Marchand, President of Groupe GM. \n\u201cIn the future, these investments will enable Groupe GM to have sufficient production capabilities and grow our company\u2019s position as a leading amenity brand. Our priority is to develop partnerships with new brands and international chains, but also with new agents and distributors.\u201d \u200b \nExpanding production capabilities \u200b \nBy summer 2018, the factory is set to grow from 4000m\u00b2 to 5200m\u00b2. \nTo combat growing demand, the company is also planning to purchase nine new machines in 2018, expanding the plant\u2019s production capabilities to 31 machines in total, with the possibility of adding three to five more machines in the future. \nPersonnel growth is another element in the initiative: staff numbers have already grown from 50 to 85 workers. By summer 2018, the plant will reach 100 employees, representing a doubling in staff levels over the last year alone. \nSpecific roles are to be created to assist with the plant\u2019s transformation, as well as a dedicated employee working on laboratory and the bulk production. In addition, new supply chain software has been rolled out to streamline processes. \nInternational expansion \u200b \nThe move comes soon after the French company announced the expansion of its international distribution \u200b network, which included four new distributors in Asia and Brazil. \nThe expansion formed part of Groupe GM\u2019s plans to consolidate its worldwide presence. "author": "", "published": "2018-03-23T01:00:00.000+02:00", "title": "El webrooming se impone al showrooming, seg\u00fan el \u00faltimo and #8203;Informe BIG DATA sobre el comportamiento del consumidor 2017 en las calles comerciales espa\u00f1olas de TC Group Solutions", "text": "< Volver 23 de Marzo de 2018 \u200bInforme BIG DATA sobre el comportamiento del consumidor 2017 en las calles comerciales espa\u00f1olas de TC Group Solutions \u00b7 El Black Friday se consolida en todo el pa\u00eds, con un aumento medio del 11% de tr\u00e1fico peatonal a lo largo de toda semana. \u00b7 Madrid desplaza a Barcelona como capital de la moda en 2017. \u00e1reas y calles comerciales del pa\u00eds trav\u00e9s de su flujo de peatones, los d\u00edas y horas de m\u00e1s y menos afluencia, o el coste por cliente potencial derivado del precio de alquiler inmobiliario, a la vez que analiza el comportamiento de este consumidor omnicanal para detectar nuevas tendencias.Este tercer Informe sobre el comportamiento del consumidor en las calles comerciales Espa\u00f1olas se present\u00f3 ayer 21 de marzo en Madrid en el marco del Retail F\u00f3rum por los representantes de la empresa y el Prof. Dr. Carles Torrecilla, Doctor en Comercializaci\u00f3n e Investigaci\u00f3n de Mercados y Profesor titular del Departamento de Direcci\u00f3n de Marketing de ESADE, quien hizo la conferencia inaugural \"Fiebre (comercial) y term\u00f3metros digitales\". Seg\u00fan Marta Fern\u00e1ndez Melgarejo, directora de Marketing de TC Group Solutions y responsable del estudio, \u201cel webrooming se impone al showrooming en las calles comerciales espa\u00f1olas\u201d. 2017 ha sido un a\u00f1o de bajada generalizada en la tasa de atracci\u00f3n comercial, con decrementos en los porcentajes de entradas a las tiendas que van desde los 1,5 puntos (Barcelona) a los 0,5 puntos (ciudades del Grupo III). En cambio, en todas las ciudades analizadas, ha aumentado favorablemente la tasa de conversi\u00f3n a ventas: entre los 3,6 puntos (Madrid) y los 0,3 puntos (ciudades del Grupo III). Menos visitantes pero, a la vez, m\u00e1s dispuestos a efectuar su compra en la tienda f\u00edsica en lugar de deambular por la tienda evaluando los productos y acabar saliendo con las manos vac\u00edas.El comportamiento del consumidor es el de practicar menos showrooming (visitar las tiendas f\u00edsicas para evaluar un producto que finalmente se acaba adquiriendo online) y m\u00e1s webrooming (cuando se analiza el producto en la red pero se realiza la compra en la tienda f\u00edsica). El informe se\u00f1ala que en Espa\u00f1a, el 37,6% de los clientes que entran en una tienda a pie de calle acaba comprando algo.El mensaje de la conferencia del Dr. Carles Torrecilla fue claro: \u201csolo cruzando los datos del mundo online con los del mundo offline podr\u00e1, el retailer offline, convertir la amenaza en oportunidad y competir, o convivir, con el mundo online en igualdad de condiciones.\u201d Pero, por otro lado, Torrecilla tambi\u00e9n hizo hincapi\u00e9 en que \u201ctanto dato e informaci\u00f3n hace que adem\u00e1s debamos poner especial atenci\u00f3n a la legalidad de la recogida, almacenaje y tratamiento de la informaci\u00f3n, por lo que debemos estar muy atentos a que nuestros proveedores de servicios cumplan con la legislaci\u00f3n en continua evoluci\u00f3n.\u201d La segunda conclusi\u00f3n que se extrae del estudio de este a\u00f1o 2017, es que \u201cel Black Friday\u201d llega a Espa\u00f1a para quedarse\u201d. La jornada de grandes descuentos Black Friday se ha convertido en una semana de aumento de tr\u00e1fico peatonal en las calles Comerciales espa\u00f1olas, con un aumento medio del 11% evidenciando que, cada vez m\u00e1s, los espa\u00f1oles aprovechan para concentrar sus compras pendientes e incluso avanzar los regalos de Navidad.En Madrid, el Black Friday fue el d\u00eda de m\u00e1s tr\u00e1fico peatonal del a\u00f1o 2017 en con una media de 7.891 transe\u00fantes en sus principales v\u00edas comerciales.La jornada de descuentos super\u00f3 en afluencia al periodo navide\u00f1o de a\u00f1os anteriores. Sin embargo, la cifra registrada fue menor a la de 2016, cuando el lunes 4 de enero se lleg\u00f3 a los 8.047 peatones. Otro mensaje extra\u00eddo de la presentaci\u00f3n de este estudio es la importancia de conocer el Coste por Cliente Potencial. Este indicador (CCP) combina el tr\u00e1fico medio de la calle con la renta media de alquiler de los locales comerciales de la misma, ofreciendo como resultado un valor en euros por cada cliente potencial que pasa frente al escaparate de una tienda ubicada en dicha calle.Esta edici\u00f3n, el informe ha escogido la calle Fuencarral en Madrid, para analizarla en profundidad, junto a las calles Pelayo (Barcelona), Tetu\u00e1n (Sevilla) y Jaime III (Palma de Mallorca).En la calle Fuencarral, un espacio comercial de 80 m2 est\u00e1 pagando 4,14 c\u00e9ntimos de euro por cliente potencial, frente a los 2,7 c\u00e9ntimos de euro que costar\u00eda la calle Pelayo de Barcelona, los 2,58 c\u00e9ntimos que pagar\u00eda en la calle Tetu\u00e1n de Sevilla o los 3,9 en Jaime III de Palma de Mallorca.Finalmente, el Estudio, que agrega todos los sectores de la distribuci\u00f3n (a excepci\u00f3n de supermercados, restauraci\u00f3n y estaciones de servicio, dado que el comportamiento de los consumidores es claramente distinto), dedica un cap\u00edtulo completo a estudiar por separado el comportamiento del consumidor de moda, entendiendo como moda las tiendas de ropa, calzado y complementos. Este consumidor, que en los dos \u00faltimos estudios protagonizaba el mercado barcelon\u00e9s, se ha desplazado a Madrid como capital de la moda. La media de clientes diarios de una tienda a pie de calle del sector moda, en Madrid, es de 154, 28 m\u00e1s que en Barcelona, 59 m\u00e1s que en las ciudades del Grupo II y 82 m\u00e1s que en las del Grupo III. Contenido del informe El tercer Informe Big Data sobre el Comportamiento del Consumidor se ha realizado a partir de los millones de datos recopilados por los sensores inteligentes instalados en las calles comerciales de toda Espa\u00f1a, junto con las miles de entradas de clientes y las transacciones que se realizan diariamente en los puntos de venta, siempre almacenados y tratados de manera an\u00f3nima, agregada y acorde con la legislaci\u00f3n vigente.Estructurado en cuatro cap\u00edtulos, en el primero presenta el comportamiento del tr\u00e1fico peatonal (por d\u00f3nde se mueve, qu\u00e9 d\u00edas de la semana, a qu\u00e9 horas\u2026) de las calles comerciales de Espa\u00f1a, clasificadas en tres grupos de ciudades:\u2014 Grupo I: metr\u00f3polis nacionales de m\u00e1s de un mill\u00f3n de habitantes, Barcelona y Madrid, estudiadas por separado.\u2014 Grupo II: metr\u00f3polis regionales de primer orden, de 300.000 a un mill\u00f3n de habitantes, estudiadas de forma agregada (Valencia, Sevilla, Bilbao, Zaragoza y M\u00e1laga).\u2014 Grupo III: metr\u00f3polis regionales de segundo orden (200.000-300.000 habitantes), tambi\u00e9n estudiadas en conjunto: La Coru\u00f1a, Vigo, Oviedo, Santander, San Sebasti\u00e1n, Pamplona, Valladolid, Salamanca, Alicante, Murcia, C\u00f3rdoba, C\u00e1diz, Granada, Palma de Mallorca, Tenerife y Las Palmas.En el segundo cap\u00edtulo se toma una calle representativa de cada grupo para analizarla en profundidad, a lo que han denominado radiograf\u00edas: la evoluci\u00f3n del tr\u00e1fico y afluencia seg\u00fan las horas del d\u00eda y los d\u00edas de la semana, los precios de alquiler de los locales comerciales y, en consecuencia, el coste por cliente potencial de cada una.El tercer cap\u00edtulo compara los ratios de atracci\u00f3n y de conversi\u00f3n de las distintas ciudades, es decir, cu\u00e1ntos de estos transe\u00fantes est\u00e1n de paso y cu\u00e1ntos realmente entran en las tiendas con alguna intenci\u00f3n de compra o curiosidad y cu\u00e1ntos de ellos efect\u00faan alguna compra o salen con las manos vac\u00edas.Finalmente, el \u00faltimo cap\u00edtulo estudia por separado el sector moda, entendiendo como moda las tiendas de ropa, calzado y complementos. Los anteriores cap\u00edtulos incluyen todos los sectores de la distribuci\u00f3n, a excepci\u00f3n de supermercados, restauraci\u00f3n y estaciones de servicio, puesto que el comportamiento de los consumidores es claramente distinto. TC Group Solutions Nacida como T-Cuento Soluciones en 2007, hoy TC Group Solutions es l\u00edder en el desarrollo de todo tipo de soluciones para recopilar, almacenar, tratar y analizar el BIG DATA que interacciona con las organizaciones de Retail. Con oficina central en Barcelona y delegaciones propias en Par\u00eds, Mil\u00e1n y NY, hoy TC Group Solutions est\u00e1 presente en m\u00e1s de 40 pa\u00edses de 4 continentes, y cuenta con m\u00e1s de 15.000 sensores instalados y recopilando millones de datos, an\u00f3 Noticias Relacionadas:", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": EPA-EFE/Chema Moya Men\u00e9ame \nA photo exhibition chronicling the career of Real Madrid star Cristiano Ronaldo was opened on Friday at EFE international news agency's Madrid headquarters with 29 still shots and 50 television images covering the Portugal player's soccer career, including his five Ballon d'Or wins. \nSponsored by Turismo del Norte de Portugal, \"Ronaldo, the Golden Boy\" on behalf of his team. \nRonaldo's spill at Sporting Lisbon was depicted at the exhibition, as well as his arrival at Manchester United and his signing for Real Madrid in 2009. \nOne of the "author": "media", "published": "2018-03-22T16:38:00.000+02:00", "title": "Good Tourism Practices to Advance Sustainable Development in the Americas", "text": "Good Tourism Practices to Advance Sustainable Development in the Americas Location: 22 Mar 18 UNWTO/OAS Report Madrid, Spain 22 March 2018 \u2013 Concrete examples of how to advance sustainable development through tourism take centre stage in the first joint publication between the World Tourism Organization (UNWTO) and the Organization of American States (OAS). \u2018 Tourism and the Sustainable Development Goals: Good Practices in the Americas \u2019 provides 14 case studies from across the region on why tourism ranks high among the economic sectors better positioned to enable the Agenda 2030 for Sustainable Development and its 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Ranging from tourism projects to strengthen the peace process in Colombia to initiatives in the heart of the Peruvian Amazon, addressing climate change in Mexico or providing insight into management and sustainability systems in Honduras or Panama. A total of 14 case studies portray the contribution of tourism to advance the Sustainable Development Goals in the Americas. \u2018 Tourism and the Sustainable Development Goals: Good Practices in the Americas \u2019 recommends to pay critical attention to tourism management as well as to strengthening partnerships between national and international public and private stakeholders, as well as local communities. The report also addresses the emergence of a more responsible traveler and how destinations in the region should integrate resource efficiency and multi-stakeholder involvement in their policies, actions and initiatives. \u201cWith more than 200 million international tourists who traveled to the Americas in 2017, tourism can and must play a significant role in delivering solutions for sustainable development in the region\u201d, said UNWTO Secretary-General, Zurab Pololikashvili. \u201cI am grateful for the partnership with the Organization of American States and am confident that together we will support tourism's role in the sustainable development agenda of the region up to and beyond 2030\u201d, he added. According to the Executive Secretary for Integral Development of the OAS, Kim Osborne, this joint effort \u201cprovides greater awareness on how tourism can help address poverty alleviation, protect biodiversity and cultural heritage, and support community development in the Americas\u201d. Authorities at all levels in the Americas have identified tourism as a priority sector to promote economic development and diversification and countries across the region are adopting new legislation and policies in this direction. Against this backdrop, \u2018 Tourism and the Sustainable Development Goals: Good Practices in the Americas \u2019 provides insight into how a common approach \u2013 including policy makers, private sector, tourists and the development community \u2013 can catalyze sustainable development through tourism. The report was presented during the 2018 Inter-American Congress of Ministers and High-level Authorities of Tourism, under the theme \u2018Connecting the Americas through sustainable tourism\u2019.
