"2018-03-23T16:25:00.000+03:00", "title": "Kalasha International TV, Film Market 2018", "text": "Kalasha International TV, Film Market 2018 Posted By: The Kalasha International TV and film market is set for next week \nFrom left Acting KFC CEO Timothy Owase, KFC Chairman Chris Foot and Denis Rene from the French High Commission during the press briefing. \nKalasha International TV & Film Market, the second edition, has been slated for Tuesday 26th March this year to 29th March at the Kenyatta International Convention Centre (KICC) grounds in Nairobi, the Kenya Films Commission (KFC) has confirmed. \nThe 3-day trade fair event organised by the Kenya Film Commission in collaboration with the French embassy is aimed at creating a platform for film industry players (producers, writers, distributors, among others) to trade and share their ideas and content, as well as initiate new business prospects across different regions. \nAmong the activities scheduled for the 3 days include pitching sessions, where people with ideas based on the advertised terms submit their projects in either of the following categories \u2013 animation films or TV shows/series and feature films \u2013 stand a chance to win a price. Also Read Kenya Health Forum 2018 to be held next week \nWhile making the announcement, Mr Foot explained, \u201cThe pitching competition will see practising and upcoming filmmakers given a chance to pitch a concept or project to potential investors in the following categories; TV shows, TV series and Animated TV series/featured film.\u201d Get breaking news on your Mobile as-it-happens. SMS \u2018NEWS\u2019 to 22163 \nFor the animation category, the winner will attract a fully paid trip to Mifa, an animation market in France, while the winner of the TV Show and feature category will walk home with KSh. 500,000. Also Read Opips, Jardel release new club banger \n\u201cWinners in the TV shows and series categories will walk away with half a million Kenya shillings, with the winner in the animation category winning a fully paid trip and free participation at the Annecy International Animation Film Festival and Market (MIFA) in June 2018 in France.\u201d He added. \nAdditionally, there will be workshops where local and international filmmakers, as well as professionals from different parts of the world, will engage filmmakers on a number of issues relating to the industry. \nThis is ultimately expected to equip all filmmakers with skills on the changing trends, growing partnerships, developing new business opportunities as well as making favourable policies to the industry. Also Read Lady Jaydee releases new song featuring reggae legend Luciano \nIn his closing remarks, Mr Owase urged players in the film industry to join them at the KICC, \u201cWe urge all the filmmakers and stakeholders to come join a large number of international professionals from the Audiovisual and Film industry for a unique opportunity to boost your business through trading content, partnership opportunities, networking and more.\u201d \nExhibition Booths will also be available for companies to showcase, sell and buy content to and from other filmmakers and industries from different policemen in Nairobi By Cyrus Ombati | Published Fri, March 23rd 2018 at 08:08, Updated March 23rd 2018 at 16:47   Share on Twitter \nA businessman was robbed of Sh1 million by three men posing as policemen. \nThe trader had just alighted at the Kencom bus stop, from Jomo Kenyatta International Airport, where he had withdrawn the money, on Tuesday. \nALSO READ: Mother asks court to spare killer cop\u2019s life \nHe told officers at the Central Police Station that he was crossing Moi Avenue near the National Archives to board a taxi when three men with walkie-talkies and guns approached him. They identified themselves as police officers and said they wanted to question him at Central Police Station. \nCentral OCPD Robinson Thuku said the robbers led the trader into a waiting car and drove toward Jeevanjee Gardens. They kicked the man out of the car after robbing him of the money and other valuables. \n\u201cThey sped off with the cash. We have yet to identify them. Investigations are going on,\u201d Thuku said yesterday. \nThe investigators said they hoped CCTV cameras near Kencom and on Moi Avenue had captured the robbery. Avoid fake news! Kv\u00e6rner: \nKv\u00e6rner er en ledende, spesialisert leverand\u00f8r av ingeni\u00f8rtjenester, anskaffelser og fabrikasjonstjenester (EPC) til offshore olje- og gassplattformer og landbaserte anlegg. Kv\u00e6rner ASA best\u00e5r av b\u00e5de datterselskaper og tilknyttede selskaper (\"Kv\u00e6rner gruppen\") og er en internasjonal leverand\u00f8r og foretrukket partner for olje- og gass operat\u00f8rer, samt andre ingeni\u00f8r- og fabrikasjonsselskaper. Kv\u00e6rner og selskapets rundt 2 700 HMS-fokuserte og erfarne medarbeidere er anerkjent for \u00e5 planlegge og gjennomf\u00f8re noen av verdens mest krevende prosjekter. I 2017 hadde Kv\u00e6rners Field Development segment en samlet omsetning p\u00e5 7,6 milliarder kroner. Selskapet hadde en ordrebok per 31. desember 2017 p\u00e5 8,1 milliarder kroner. Kv\u00e6rner er notert p\u00e5 Oslo B\u00f8rs med tickerkoden \"KVAER\". For mer informasjon, se www.kvaerner.com . Ingrid Moe Wold t.v mot Ingrid Katrine Buer S\u00f8nden\u00e5 t.h.i toppseriekampen mellom V\u00e5lerenga-Lillestr\u00f8m p\u00e5 Intility Arena. Foto: Terje Pedersen / NTB scanpix Foto: Pedersen, Terje Av NTB 24. mars 2018, kl. 19:15   19:27 \nAnf\u00f8rt av kaptein Ingrid Moe Wold fra Kapp serie\u00e5pnet LSK Kvinner med seier 5\u20130 borte i lokaloppgj\u00f8ret mot V\u00e5lerenga i eliteserien. DEL Det var knyttet stor spenning til kampen. Tidligere LSK-trener Monica Knudsen har tatt over V\u00e5lerenga, mens flere tidligere Lillestr\u00f8m-spillere ogs\u00e5 har byttet ut gult med bl\u00e5tt. L\u00f8rdag var gjestene klart best og s\u00f8rget for at samtlige som er glad i Lillestr\u00f8m fikk en over gjennomsnittet god l\u00f8rdag. Hege Riises lag ga seg ikke f\u00f8r det sto 5-0, og det siste m\u00e5let kan fort st\u00e5 igjen som sesongens scoring n\u00e5r det skal telles opp til slutt. Guro Reiten dro med seg ballen over midtstreken etter 71 minutter, og hun s\u00e5 da at V\u00e5lerenga-keeper Tinja-Riikka Korpela sto langt ute. LSKs nummer 10 dro til, og ballen forsvant i en bue over Korpela og dalte ned i den finske burvokterens venstre hj\u00f8rne. F\u00f8r det hadde Ingrid Engen gitt gjestene ledelsen etter fem minutter. I det 51. minutt doblet Sophie Roman Haug til 2\u20130 da hun p\u00e5 vakkert vis headet inn et str\u00f8kent innlegg av Synne Skinnes Hansen. LSK-laget la p\u00e5 til 3-0 etter 61 minutter etter vakkert angrepsspill. Ingrid Moe Wold fant Reiten inne i feltet, og p\u00e5 vakkert vis satte hun inn scoringen. Kun minutter senere ga oppskriften Skinnes Hansen/Haug scoring igjen. F\u00f8rstnevnte svingte inn et perfekt innlegg, og Haug kunne sette skotuppen til og juble for sin andre nettkjenning for kvelden. "published": "2018-03-23T14:24:00.000+03:00", "title": "EMAS refinancing hinges on Oslo listing", "text": "EMAS refinancing hinges on Oslo listing Singapore OSV owner's new investor wants continued presence in Norway. \nThe restructuring of heavily indebted Singapore OSV owner EMAS Offshore is contingent on its retaining its primary Oslo listing, it has revealed. \nThe company is continuing to work together with its advisers, creditors and key bank lenders to ensure a vital refinancing. \nWhite knight BTI, a subsidiary of BakerTechnology, is looking to invest up to $50m in the company in return for a majority stake under a term sheet signed in early December. \nOn 15 March, the company received an improved restructuring plan from BTI, it said, without giving further details. \nThe plan requires the continued listing of the company\u2019s shares on the Oslo Stock Exchange on terms that are acceptable to BTI. \nDelisting coming? \nThis could be a problem, however, as the Oslo bourse is on course to delist the company on 27 April. \nEMAS can continue to make representations to the exchange in the meantime, after an initial appeal failed this week. \nThe bourse has previously said EMAS was \u201cnot in a position to comply with its financial reporting obligations\u201d. \nEMAS said: \"The group will work closely with its investors, principal bank lenders and other stakeholders to bring to fruition the restructuring plan in the near future.\" \nIts principal bank lenders had indicated support for the refinancing plan in February. \nHuge loss last year \nThe company also revealed a loss of $705.66m for 2017. This compares to a deficit of $535.24m the year before. \nRevenue dipped to $136.48m from $167.57m, as it continued to be negatively impacted by the weak market environment, resulting in low utilisation and charter rates. \n\"Other expenses\" were $475.52m, mainly related to impairment losses on property, plant and equipment, a loss on the disposal of a subsidiary and provisions for onerous contracts. \nThe comparative figure last year was $378.1m. EMAS Offshore wins bank support for restructuring \nTotal liabilities increased by 8% to $1.125bn as at 31 August 2017. \n\"The market environment in the offshore oil and gas industry is expected to remain challenging,\" it said. \n\"Oil prices have not reached an extent that will result in a significant increase in activities in the offshore oil and gas sector while the situation of over-supply of offshore vessels continues to persist.\" Subscribe to read this story. \nWant to try TradeWinds? \nEssential shipping news \nKeep up-to-date with all the latest news, breaking stories and marketing-leading analysis with a TradeWinds subscription \nWe use cookies on tradewindsnews.com for analysis, customizing content and advertising, and to develop our products and services. 0, "author": "IntraFish Media", "published": "2018-03-23T16:53:00.000+03:00", "title": "AquaChile board approves Oslo IPO", "text": "  AquaChile board approves Oslo IPO Directors officially OKed a capital increase of $200 million. \nAquaChile\u2019s board of directors approved the initial public offering (IPO) proposal announced by the company earlier this year. \nIn a board meeting, the directors approved the capital increase of $200 million (\u20ac162 million) that will allow the company to finance its investments plan, it said. \n\u201cOur decision is based on the opportunities that the Norwegian capital market offers for being a stock market in which the marine animal sector has a high importance,\u201d said Francisco Lepeley, AquaChile\u2019s CFO.  ", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "francisco lepeley", "sentiment": "none"}], "organizations": [], "locations": [{"name": "oslo", "sentiment": "none"}]}, "rating": null, "crawled": "2018-03-23T18:14:36.127+03:00"}, {"thread": {"uuid": "536ad826b394290a5817af1d1558980e76a2b6d4", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/.wHSUbtEfZQujfav8g98PhOvWMK9dDCM3QZ4.L4idbGjtQuSmHeOTqxBgCUXprmUAcZkAjn3416qB6Pg1Z3jnGU6uQsggRh5QsqRELs_UkefI9TFfmp72A--", "site_full": "www.thelocal.no", "site": "thelocal.no", "site_section": "http://www.thelocal.no/feeds/rss.php", "site_categories": ["media"], "section_title": "The Local", "title": "Sylvi Listhaug resigns as Norway's justice minister", "title_full": "Sylvi Listhaug resigns as Norway's justice minister", "published": "2018-03-20T09:15:00.000+02:00", "replies_count": 0, "participants_count": 0, "site_type": "news", "country": "NO", "spam_score": 0.0, "main_image": "https://www.thelocal.no/userdata/images/article/3f957e3f92a5f182a870b343e937d72540f3b4d73b3083fdcadab08c6f9c8683.jpg", "performance_score": 0, "domain_rank": null, "social": {"facebook": {"likes": 0, "comments": 0, "shares": 0}, "gplus": {"shares": 0}, "pinterest": {"shares": 0}, "linkedin": {"shares": 0}, "stumbledupon": {"shares": 0}, "vk": {"shares": 0}}}, "uuid": "536ad826b394290a5817af1d1558980e76a2b6d4", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/.wHSUbtEfZQujfav8g98PhOvWMK9dDCM3QZ4.L4idbGjtQuSmHeOTqxBgCUXprmUAcZkAjn3416qB6Pg1Z3jnGU6uQsggRh5QsqRELs_UkefI9TFfmp72A--", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "", "published": "2018-03-20T09:15:00.000+02:00", "title": "Sylvi Listhaug resigns as Norway's justice minister", "text": "Sylvi Listhaug resigns as Norway's justice minister The Local Sylvi Listhaug confirms her resignation as Justice Minister in Oslo. Photo: H\u00e5kon Mosvold Larsen / NTB scanpix The Local 20 March 2018 08:15 CET+01:00 Sylvi Listhaug has resigned as Norway's Minister of Justice following a motion of no confidence against her by opposition parties. \nParliament had been set to vote on the motion of no confidence on Tuesday. \nBut the minister pre-empted the vote by announcing her resignation early Tuesday morning, stating she could not allow the Progress Party to lose power over her departure. \nListhaug is a high-profile figure in the anti-immigration party, which is part of Norway\u2019s tripartite coalition government. \nPrime Minister Erna Solberg earlier said that if there was a majority against Listhaug, she would call a vote of confidence ( kabinettssp\u00f8rsm\u00e5l in Norwegian) in the entire government, potentially resulting in new elections or either Solberg or Jonas Gahr St\u00f8re, the head of the opposition, being asked to form a new government. \nThe minister said her resignation was made on her own initiative. The decision is reported by state broadcaster NRK to have come as a surprise to both Solberg and Progress Party leader Siv Jensen. \n\u201cI appreciate that Siv and the entire [Progress] party were prepared to prepared to set aside our position as a government partner to support me as justice minister. But I cannot allow my departure to result in the Progress Party losing power and influence,\u201d Listhaug wrote in a statement, which was also posted on her Facebook page. \nShe is reported to have given no indication on Monday to government or Progress Party leadership of her intention to resign. \n\u201cIt was entirely up to me whether to see this through to the end or to step down,\u201d she wrote. \nThe minister's resignation is the culmination of political and public outcry over an image and message posted by Listhaug on Facebook. \nIn the March 9th social media post , which contained a photo of al-Shabaab militants, she accused Labour of considering that \"the rights of terrorists are more important than the security of the nation\". \nShe was criticising Labour's opposition to a proposal to strip the citizenship of Norwegians who pose a threat to the nation's vital interests, without a court order. \nLabour members were the main victims of the deadliest attacks on Norwegian soil since the Second World War when, on July 22nd, 2011, Anders Breivik, who once was a member of the Progress Party, killed 77 people in twin attacks: one targeting then Labour prime minister Jens Stoltenberg's office in Oslo and another against a Labour youth camp on the island of Ut\u00f8ya. \nIn the message confirming her resignation, the minister wrote that her post \u201cwas nothing to do with July 22nd\u201d and claimed the subsequent outrage was a \u201cwitch-hunt\u201d. \n\u201cI have found this to be nothing but a witch-hunt, in which Jonas Gahr St\u00f8re\u2019s intention was to connect freedom of speech to an issue which is one of the most important things we must discuss for Norway\u2019s future,\u201d she wrote. \n\u201cThe most important thing for me is the Progress Party and that it will continue to govern Norway,\u201d she said at a press conference Tuesday according to NRK \u2019s report. \nShe also reiterated her criticism at Tuesday\u2019s press meeting of St\u00f8re for connecting her Facebook post to the July 22nd attacks. \n\u201cThe aim of the [2017] election campaign was to keep Jonas Gahr St\u00f8re away from the Prime Minister\u2019s office, and that is still my goal. I don\u2019t think he is suitable for the role of Prime Minister of Norway. I am happy that Siv [Jensen] and the rest of the party have supported me 100 percent. They were willing to see this through,\u201d she said. \n\u201cSt\u00f8re has tried to label me, compare me with the views of Norway\u2019s worst mass murderer. I strongly reject that,\u201d she said. \nListhaug confirmed that she will continue as an MP and \u201cconcentrate one hundred percent on promoting Progress\u2019 politics with my excellent parliamentary colleagues.\u201d \nListhaug\u2019s decision comes after the Christian Democrats on Monday refused to back her over the controversial Facebook post. \nAlthough Listhaug eventually removed the post and apologised in parliament, a motion of no confidence against her gained the support of all parties in Norway's opposition, leaving her fate as justice minister potentially in the hands of the one remaining non-coalition party, the centre-right Christian Democrats. \nBoth Labour and the Centre Party are reported to have decided to move against Listhaug after seeing the way the apology was made. \nShe was asked for an apology on eight occasions and came to the speaker's stand four times during the session on Thursday last week. \nThe Facebook post announcing her resignation was published at 8am on Tuesday, just two hours before the no confidence motion was set to be voted in parliament. \nAfter a long meeting Monday, the Christian Democrats concluded that they no longer could support Listhaug as justice minister, furthering the possibility of the government crisis, although they did not give a final confirmation as to how they would vote on the no-confidence motion. \nThe party\u2019s votes would have determined whether the motion gained a majority. \nOn Monday evening, the three government parties \u2013 the Progress Party, Solberg\u2019s Conservatives and the Liberal party \u2013 held crisis talks at the prime minister\u2019s residence. Neither Solberg nor Jensen are thought to have asked Listhaug to step down, NRK reports. \nAt Tuesday\u2019s press conference, she called the Christian Democrats a party \u201cwithout a backbone, leadership or a way forward\u201d.", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "sylvi listhaug", "sentiment": "none"}, "Anne Siri", "published": "2018-03-23T19:50:00.000+03:00", "title": "Women in charge", "text": "The Nobel Peace Center and Civita invited to an event Thursday March 22nd 18.00\u201419.30. \n\nCivita and the Oslo Women\u2019s Rights initiative invited to a meeting with women\u2019s rights activists from Libya, Iran and Jordan at the Nobel Peace Center. What is the situation for women in countries with extreme gender equality issues? How can women activists from countries like these connect and cooperate to build lasting, sustainable change in the world? The Oslo Women\u2019s Rights Initiative is an alliance of individuals and groups who support women\u2019s rights activists from countries with extreme gender equality issues. The Initiative is being launched in Oslo in Mar ch, where a group of prominent activists from countries including Iran, Saudi Arabia, Syria, Jordan, Yemen and Libya are brought together to share their experiences. Nargess Tavassolian from Iran is a journalist and legal analyst who has worked for several NGO\u2019s in Iran who is currently an anchor at Iran International News TV, providing policy and analysis on gender equality issues and human rights violations. Daughter of Nobel Peace Prize laureate Shirin Ebadi. Asma Khalifa from Libya is an activist and researcher working on civil society and human rights, women\u2019s rights and youth empowerment, co-founder of the think tank Tamazight Women Movement. Afaf Jabiri from Jordan is senior lecturer at the School of Social Sciences in the University of East London and author of the book \u2018Gendered Politics and Law in Jordan: Guardianship over Women\u2019. Afaf has more than 20 years of experience in advocating for gender equality, law, and policy reform in the Middle East. Menneskerettighetene i Uganda 7. desember 2011 \n\u00abMuseveni has fanned the flames of homophobia in Uganda to the point of encouraging legislation that would penalize homosexuality with execution. By rallying the public against \u00abthe homosexual threat\u00bb with one hand, he is able to free his other hand to continue consolidating his repressive rule,\u00bb skriver Thor Halvorssen fra Oslo Freedom Forum i Huffington Post. KONFERANSE: F\u00f8lg Oslo Freedom Forum live 9. mai 2011 \nMenneskerettighetskonferansen Oslo Freedom Forum samler Nobelprisvinnere, statsledere, menneskerettighetsaktivister, overlevende og entrepren\u00f8rer. Fjor\u00e5rets konferanse ble av The Economist kalt \"a spectacular human rights festival\u2026on its way to becoming the human-rights equivalent of the Davos economic forum.\" Innlegg og diskusjoner blir livestreamet [\u2026] ARTIKKEL: The Economist om Oslo Freedom Forum 28. mai 2010 \nThe Economist skriver i ukens utgave om Oslo Freedom Forum: \"a spectacular human-rights festival, held in Norway at the end of April, where veterans of human-rights struggles\u2014with a preponderance of anti-communists and victims of harsh Islamic regimes\u2014were invited to tell [\u2026] MENNESKERETTIGHETER: Fokuser p\u00e5 sivile og politiske rettigheter 5. mai 2010 \nMenneskerettsaktivister b\u00f8r motst\u00e5 fristelsen til \u00e5 inkludere komplekse \u00f8konomiske og sosiale sp\u00f8rsm\u00e5l i menneskerettighetene. Les Jacob Mchangama, sjefsjurist [\u2026] Les mer \u00bb St\u00f8tt Civita \nCivita er en liberal tankesmie som gjennom sitt arbeid skal bidra til \u00f8kt forst\u00e5else og oppslutning om de verdiene som ligger til grunn for en fri \u00f8konomi, det sivile samfunn og styrket personlig ansvar. Civita er en ideell virksomhet. V\u00e5rt arbeid best\u00e5r av debattm\u00f8ter, seminarer, publikasjoner, skolering og viktige innspill i samfunnsdebatten. Dette er gjort mulig ved hjelp av st\u00f8tte fra private. "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "civita", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "nargess tavassolian", "sentiment": "none"}], "organizations": [{"name": "ngo", "http://omgili.com/ri/jHIAmI4hxg9iAw_aLcK3BT2ybYSD3B3RWOJpb2E1UEOMjimcSuf61MUp.lBSaCs_2iEjZwpt69g-", "site_full": "www.highnorthnews.com", "site": "highnorthnews.com", "site_section": "http://www.highnorthnews.com/feed/", "site_categories": ["financial_news", "tech", "finance"], "section_title": "High North News", "title": "Op-Ed: Russia \u2013 Our enemy?", "title_full": "Op-Ed: Russia \u2013 Our enemy?", "published": "2018-03-21T15:10:00.000+02:00", "replies_count": 0, "participants_count": 1, "site_type": "news", "country": "NO", "spam_score": 0.0, "main_image": "", "performance_score": 0, "domain_rank": null, "social": {"facebook": {"likes": 0, "comments": 0, "shares": 0}, "gplus": {"shares": 0}, "pinterest": {"shares": 0}, "linkedin": {"shares": 0}, "stumbledupon": {"shares": 0}, "vk": {"shares": 0}}}, "uuid": "96edf13bf5ee7c3eb977fc30f42553da802f7bac", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/jHIAmI4hxg9iAw_aLcK3BT2ybYSD3B3RWOJpb2E1UEOMjimcSuf61MUp.lBSaCs_2iEjZwpt69g-", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "Hege Eilertsen", "published": "2018-03-21T15:10:00.000+02:00", "title": "Op-Ed: Russia \u2013 Our enemy?", "text": "Minda Holm is a research fellow at the Norwegian Institute of Foreign Affairs and a PhD Fellow in Political Science at the University of Copenhagen and the Danish Institute for International Studies. She specializes in security politics, global order and opposition to liberal values, focusing in particular on Russia and the US. 21/03/2018 \nOn Sunday 18 March, Russians head to the polls. Several events in Oslo discuss Putin\u2019s victory. It is usually a bad testament to a regime\u2019s democratic character if such events can be planned in advance. \nYet, Putin is unquestionably popular. Although the opposition is limited in its room for maneuver, Russia is not a totalitarian regime, as some have argued. The election is nevertheless neither free nor fair. \nThis poses a challenging question: On what basis do we evaluate Russia? \nIn the 1990s, there was an expectation that Russia would become like \u201cus\u201d. Thus, we apply a different standard to Russia than for example China. Russia is close and similar enough to be compared to our own political praxis, yet also different enough to be kept outside the idea of what constitutes \u2018Europe\u2019. We criticize China, but far more cautiously. \nWhen Putin first came to power in the autumn of 1999, he gave a speech in which he argued that while Russia was European, it shouln\u2019t be measured by the same standards as liberal democracies. Since then, the regime has increasingly emphasized its distinctly conservative character, in particular from Putin\u2019s third presidential period in 2012 and onwards. In parallel, the regime has intensified its criticism of Western international politics. It is today easy to forget that Russian authorities were once open to join both the EU and NATO. \nFor many of us working on Russian foreign and security policy, it has been a point to nuance some of the criticism levied against our eastern neighbor with reference to what the world looks like from the Kremlin. The annexation of the Crimea in 2014 was, for instance, a clear violation of international law, but hardly a sign of a new, nationalist and/or expansionist imperialism. The Crimea holds a very special role in Russian identity and cannot be compared to for example the Baltic states, as some have done in various threat assessments. \nThe Russian threat has, at times, been presented as disproportionally large. This unfortunately also catalyzes negative reactions from the Russian side, not unlike the ones that come when people feel that they are being unfairly treated. \nBreakups rarely happen overnight or out of the blue. Western authorities have generally been dismissive of constructive input from Russia, as in relation to the war in Libya. Their criticism of Western military interventions is shared by many academics, but when the criticism is coming from Russia, it is interpreted as polemics. \nLast Tuesday, the independent UN Commission for Syria published a report detailing civilian casualties. \nThe report concludes that both Russian and American air strikes are the cause of mass civilian deaths. A Russian attack in November 2017 killed at least 84 people, an American attack in March 2017 at least 150 people. Both countries should be criticized heavily. Nevertheless, the criticism against Russia is far more visible in the media, which they can unfortunately use to undermine it. \nFrom a Russian point of view, the authorities are tired of being evaluated according to standards to which their critics do not adhere. Russia correctly points to the double standards applied to Western versus Russian behavior, such as in the US cooperation with Saudi Arabia. If we are to criticize someone morally in international politics, we should do so on principles that are clear and apply to everyone on an equal basis. As a result of the inconsistency in who and what many governments choose to criticize, Russian authorities can more easily and reject otherwise legitimate criticism. \nCriticizing Russia for interfering in US elections while tacitly looking the other way when the US meddles in other countries\u2019 elections and regimes raises tough questions. The US-based researcher Dov Levin has investigated election interference by the US and the Soviet Union/Russia during the period 1946-2000. Levin counts at least 81 interferences by the US, 36 by Russia. After 2000, the USA has interfered in elections such as in Kenya (2013), Lebanon (2009) and Afghanistan (2009). \nHe defines election interference as \u201ca costly act which is designed to determine the election results [in favor of] one of the two sides\u201d. \nIs the action itself good as long as the intent is \u2018good\u2019, and is the intent good as long as we consider the actor to be good? Some seem to argue that American interferences are legitimate due to the liberal foundation on which they are based, despite the occasionally very negative outcomes, such as in Iraq and Libya. The attempt to remove president Karzai from power in Afghanistan in 2009 was, on the other hand, primarily about US self-interests, not a larger moral good. \nDuring the past few years, Norwegian media have also jumped to rash and unfounded conclusions about Russian behavior. \nThe debate about Storskog in the autumn of 2015 is a clear example. As researchers Lars Rowe and Arild Moe have successfully argued, the accusation that Russian authorities controlled the flow of refugees \u2013 as a form of hybrid war \u2013 was unfounded. We should keep that debate in mind when we choose to judge Russia for a negative action which it may have had the motivation to do, but without any evidence to substantiate our claims. \nAs the enemy image has grown stronger, less documentation is apparently required to accuse Russia of transgressions. It does not mean that Russia, for example, is not behind the poisoning of the former spy Sergej Skripal and his daughter in England, but a potential motive cannot automatically be equated with guilt. \nThat said, the authorities aren\u2019t making it any easier for those of us who want to nuance the image of Russian politics. \nRussia is currently ranked 148 th out of 180 countries on the Reporters without Borders\u2019 annual index of press freedom. Critical journalists are risking their lives. If freedom of speech is a political and/or moral priority, we should be able to criticize. The same goes for the systematic stigmatization of gays, lesbians and other who do not fit into the hetero-normative family idealization. \nThe regime is moving in an increasingly conservative and authoritarian direction, on par with countries like Turkey. \nThere is, nevertheless, another important side of Russian foreign policy: the border cooperation. This year, we are celebrating 25 years of the Barents Cooperation. In 2017, the number of border resident cross-border journeys increased by 25.5 percent. Marit Jacobsen of the Barents Secretariat stated that this traffic \u201cshows that people want to be in touch with their neighbors and are curious about each other\u201d. \nOur neighbor is perceived differently in the north than in Oslo, where the image of Russia is more tightly linked to the regime and Putin. That is also why the arrest of Frode Berg, a driving force behind the people-to-people cooperation, was all the more disappointing. \nI have had the pleasure of spending parts of my childhood in Russia, and many journeys and stays in the years after. Russia has become a part of my identity, and the current enemy image is physically palpable. Criticism of the state\u2019s policies leaks into xenophobia against ordinary Russians. Over the past few years, it has also become more difficult to nuance the representation of Russia in research contexts. \nI can only imagine how difficult this enemy image might feel like for those of Russian origins in Norway.", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "minda holm", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "putin", "sentiment": "none"}], "organizations": [{"name": "norwegian institute of foreign affairs", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "university of copenhagen", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "danish institute for international studies", "sentiment": "none"}], "locations": [{"name": "russia", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "oslo", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "china", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "us", "sentiment": "none"}]}, "rating": null, "crawled": "2018-03-23T04:05:12.059+03:00"}, {"thread": {"uuid": "d9058a329bfda19a12c42f3f083352d6c96f22eb", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/j.JM_ertN3IK5b9ahrgZ54icXlZtNN9jG9rFCYspAg.a0SB0SqywLkJhjc1zSwEItWaa_HGXvR.krRi5DcQhTg--", "site_full": "elverumfhs.no", "site": "elverumfhs.no", "site_section": "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/j.JM_ertN3IK5b9ahrgZ54icXlZtNN9jG9rFCYspAg.a0SB0SqywLkJhjc1zSwEItWaa_HGXvR.krRi5DcQhTg--", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "Eivind Ellingsen H\u00f8imyr", "published": "2018-03-23T15:05:00.000+03:00", "title": "Film fra Teater/Musikal i Oslo", "text": "Film fra Teater/Musikal i Oslo 2018-03-23 2018-03-23 http://elverumfhs.no/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/Elverum-FHS-logo_web_retina_v3.png Elverum folkeh\u00f8gskole http://elverumfhs.no/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/teater-musikal-i-oslo-elverum-folkehgskole.jpg 200px 200px Skriv en kommentar", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "elverum-fhs-logo_web_retina_v3.png elverum", "sentiment": "none"}], "organizations": [], "locations": [{"name": "oslo", "sentiment": "none"}]}, "rating": null, "crawled": "2018-03-24T12:31:56.003+03:00"}, {"thread": {"uuid": "5a25cb24b4b874760c01b8adb4c96e07b6f22752", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/2wGaacqxApt2Sz72Xr9xK6Ssf9gUDUQbDgDe5GCJschyJyCw2NsfAAxWItCyEs8gMSQpgVfOw79F3ufsT_qgGK_ceETX3OZhS.Zol.2G.Nv_PIGqFSEJog--", "site_full": "montagesmagazine.com", "site": "montagesmagazine.com", "site_section": "http://montages.no/feed/", "site_categories": ["photography", "hobbies_and_interests"], "section_title": "Montages", "title": "Painful but necessary: Erik Poppe\u2019s U \u2013 July 22", "title_full": "Painful but necessary: Erik Poppe\u2019s U \u2013 July 22", "published": "2018-03-24T11:57:00.000+03:00", "replies_count": 0, "participants_count": 1, "site_type": "news", "country": "NO", "spam_score": 0.0, "main_image": "http://montagesmagazine.com/files/2018/03/utoys-720x310.jpg", "performance_score": 0, "domain_rank": null, "social": {"facebook": {"likes": 0, "comments": 0, "shares": 0}, "gplus": {"shares": 0}, "pinterest": {"shares": 0}, "linkedin": {"shares": 0}, "stumbledupon": {"shares": 0}, "vk": {"shares": 0}}}, "uuid": "5a25cb24b4b874760c01b8adb4c96e07b6f22752", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/2wGaacqxApt2Sz72Xr9xK6Ssf9gUDUQbDgDe5GCJschyJyCw2NsfAAxWItCyEs8gMSQpgVfOw79F3ufsT_qgGK_ceETX3OZhS.Zol.2G.Nv_PIGqFSEJog--", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "Anne Gjelsvik", "published": "2018-03-24T11:57:00.000+03:00", "title": "Painful but necessary: Erik Poppe\u2019s U \u2013 July 22", "text": "NRK special news broadcast Helge Lur\u00e5s : \u2018It doesn\u2019t have to be a group with an international agenda, these could be local groups, elements from Norwegian immigrant community exhibiting antipathy towards norwegian society.\u2019 \nThe perception that terrorist equals Muslim is also touched upon in the film. \u2018Is it, like, terrorism?\u2019, Magnus ( Aleksander Holmen ), a participant at the summer camp, asks when news of the bomb in Oslo reaches Ut\u00f8ya. One of the others, Issa ( Sorosh Sadat ), quickly replies \u2018I hope it wasn\u2019t Muslims who did it, or all hell will break loose\u2019. \nThis is why it the film\u2019s focus, in its closing titles, on the terrorist\u2019s goals, ideology and notion of an enemy is both crucial and correct; without it, the atrocities could not be contextualized. It is also important that other pick up where this film leaves off. * To see or not to see 18 February 2018 Now This: Emma Gonzalez (activist/survivor of the school shooting at Stoneman Douglas High School 14 February 2018): \u00abI know it is hard to watch those videos, and some people are saying \u00abhow dare they post something like that\u00bb. No, if we had to live through it you should have to live through it too, if that\u2019s what it\u2019s gonna take for you to understand what it feels like then watch the freakin video.\u00bb \nSeeing this film, thinking about it, and writing about it, has been difficult, and it has affected me for days. This film is not for everyone , but I think it is for many more than many think. \n\u2018Do we need to see this?\u2019 or \u2018What good will making a film do?\u2019, are of course pertinent questions. But, above all, it is important to remember that not everyone has their own memories of 22 July. Those who today embark on their teens were young children when this happened, and the narratives we create now are both for those who still remember and those who were not yet born. For the youth of today, as for many others, reaching for the books of \u00c5sne Seierstad, Aage Storm Borchgrevink ( A Norwegian Tragedy: Anders Behring Breivik and the Massacre on Ut\u00f8ya , 2012) or Kjetil Stormark ( Da terroren rammet Norge: 189 minutter som rystet verden /\u00abWhen Terrorism Struck Norway, 189 Minutes that Shocked the World\u00bb, 2012) to understand may not be the obvious choice. \nWhile choosing whether or not to see the film is up to the individual, it does come with challenges not so easily avoided. The media attention surrounding this film, and the other films soon to come (Reconstructing Ut\u00f8ya [Carl Jav\u00e9r] will appear in cinemas this autumn; Norway [ Paul Greengrass ] is to be released on Netflix around the same time; Sara Johnsen and P\u00e5l Sletaune s television series will premiere on NRK in 2019) can be difficult for survivors and loved ones, and is not something one can opt out of. \nI often defend film as a medium from those who see a contradiction between film and art, or think film can only ever be entertainment. We are so used to encountering killers, violence and gunfire as part of entertainment products, that the notion of a film about mass murder being something other than that might seem alien. Sitting down in a full theatre, where others in the audience had brought popcorn and sweets, to see this film, was thus disconcerting. \nPerhaps we have become more desensitized to violence. The latest crime fiction about serial killers, or the latest school massacre on the news, might pass us by without leaving much of a trace or spurring much reflection. But maybe film as a medium, and a film such as this specifically, can help combat our insensitivity, as Indiewire film critic David Ehrlich claims in a piece linking Poppes film to American school shootings. That was my sense, at least, as I, along with everybody else in a full theatre, sat quiet and motionless until all of the end credits, and the final notes of Wolfgang Plagge s moving soundtrack, were gone. \nCinema has qualities and characteristics that make unique experiences possible, and as such, film can offer different kinds of explorations of these incidents of terrorism than literature, music, or other visual arts can. When people hesitate to approach Ut\u00f8ya as a filmic experience, it is particularly in fear of encountering images they wish not to see, or have attempted to avoid creating for themselves. But the film does not visualise violence nearly as much as one might fear, and I am not the only one to express relief that it is less painful to watch than expected. Many of the young people who were there on that day did not witness violence directly; they saw paths, rocks, bushes, and other frightened and desperate kids. The facts described in the verdict from the 22 July trial is far, far more brutal than this film. \nAs a fact-based fiction film, U \u2013 July 22 supplements the information offered by the verdict, the reports, the non-fiction prose and the news media. Not even \u00c5sne Seierstad\u2019s literary approach and multi-faceted perspective provided the intensity Poppe and his team have achieved in their rendering of what the kids on the island experienced during those 72 minutes of executions. It is too soon to say how important this work will be to us, but I am already certain that it will provide us with new insights. It could also potentially become politically significant. \nWhat U \u2013 July 22 offers, as the first work on this subject matter so far, is a sense of presence. It brings us very close to the camaraderie, and the loneliness; it captures frightened breaths. It shows us how easy it was to trip on the steep slopes, how few places there were to hide, how muddy it was (although the real place was even wetter). What we are left with is not mainly images in our minds or sounds in our ears; it is an engulfing bodily sensation. I have felt the island against my back, because I have lain on pine needles along with Kaja and other terrified youths. I have felt Tyrifjorden against my shins, because I have tossed my shoes and attempted to wade to safety upon the sharp rocks there. I have been frozen, by fear and by the cold. I have felt my heart pounding in my chest as I try to hide behind a rock face that offers no shelter. 22 July has, with this film, been given body as well as face. \nAnd this is why I am happy U \u2013 July 22 was made, and that Erik Poppe was the one to pick up this immense challenge and put it on his own, and his collaborators\u2019, shoulders. Together with a strong team of contributors, not least the young amateur actors led by Andrea Berntzen, the director has given life and soul to the events of that day. Working through a trauma that has affected so many is a heavy undertaking, and bringing such a project home requires determination, skill, experience, and a strong moral compass. U \u2013 July 22 is Poppes most important work, and as such it is a good thing that it is also his best. *", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "erik poppe", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "helge lur\u00e5s", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "magnus", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "aleksander holmen", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "issa", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "sorosh sadat", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "emma gonzalez", "sentiment": "none"}], "organizations": [{"name": "nrk", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "stoneman douglas high school", "sentiment": "none"}], "locations": [{"name": "oslo", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "ut\u00f8ya", "sentiment": "none"}]}, "rating": null, "crawled": "2018-03-24T16:32:06.031+03:00"}, {"thread": {"uuid": "34bbff9d28642783f9357df66cad59f28458b0d8", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/jHIAmI4hxg8.JeAKxaZY6lAFOE.fzz1HL9WRZ5YrZivfz4mO6ZGXXcm4ufubgN5xPVHXP3e8MQt1DYaI9Yb90A--", "site_full": "www.mynordickitchen.no", "site": "mynordickitchen.no", "site_section": "", "site_categories": [], "section_title": "", "title": "Byggrynsgr\u00f8t | Barley Porridge - way to the north", "text": "Primary Sidebar With love from Oslo \nHi! I am so happy you are here! My name is Therese Elstad and welcome to My Nordic Kitchen from Oslo, Norway. Since 2016, this blog has been a place for me to express my love for the Nordic region and our food culture. The recipes you will find on this blog will be plant-based, nutritious and greatly inspired by the Nordic areas surrounding me with inspiration from the rest of the world. Food is something that affects everyone, no matter who and where you are. We should therefore all have enough knowledge about food to be able to live a long and happy life. It should not be a burden- nor should it be boring. Food should be something that makes you thrive to be able to live the life you want, it should bring people together in the most wonderful way and last but not least- it should be fun. Toute l'actualit\u00e9", "title": "6 000 Parisiens form\u00e9s aux gestes qui sauvent", "title_full": "6 000 Parisiens form\u00e9s aux gestes qui sauvent", "published": "2018-03-23T19:49:00.000+03:00", "replies_count": 0, "participants_count": 0, "site_type": "news", "country": "FR", "spam_score": 0.0, "main_image": "http://s1.lprs1.fr/images/2018/03/23/7625406_68120720-2eb9-11e8-bbc8-a425285f33d6-1.jpg", "performance_score": 5, "domain_rank": 2525, "social": {"facebook": {"likes": 527, "comments": 0, "shares": 527}, "gplus": {"shares": 0}, "pinterest": {"shares": 0}, "linkedin": {"shares": 0}, "stumbledupon": {"shares": 0}, "vk": {"shares": 0}}}, "uuid": "1e7fb4b65a57d7ed39209af690ed5aef27ac654d", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/jHIAmI4hxg_uLIFkiFW.Qm0j9KQR4c3Ms0XVmoNNF0NnqrnQJFElradxQ3p21yDlvFCjfUvdpzH2Z9YA9BYzs_TlYGqU6bDEynZRrZpumZV3Pz51jBL0.1LWYGkZR0AJ.34JBedPBCk-", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "", "published": "2018-03-23T19:49:00.000+03:00", "title": "6 000 Parisiens form\u00e9s aux gestes qui sauvent", "text": "> \u00cele-de-France & Oise > Paris | 23 mars 2018, 17h49 | Dans Paris, \u00e0 l\u2019h\u00f4tel de Ville comme dans les mairies, vous pourrez apprendre les gestes qui sauvent. LP/F.G. Ce week-end, les Parisiennes et les Parisiens sont aussi invit\u00e9s \u00e0 participer \u00e0 l\u2019initiative Paris qui sauve, organis\u00e9e par la Ville de Paris et les services de secours parisiens. \nPour la troisi\u00e8me ann\u00e9e cons\u00e9cutive et pour ouvrir les Semaines parisiennes de la sant\u00e9, le \u00ab samedi qui sauve \u00bb offrira aux Parisiennes et Parisiens une initiation gratuite de ces gestes simples qui peuvent sauver la vie. Ce week-end, les Parisiennes et les Parisiens sont aussi invit\u00e9s \u00e0 participer \u00e0 l\u2019initiative organis\u00e9e par la Ville de Paris et les services de secours parisiens. L\u2019id\u00e9al pour celles et ceux qui souhaitent d\u00e9couvrir les gestes \u00e0 conna\u00eetre face \u00e0 diff\u00e9rents types de risques tout en s\u2019amusant et en dialoguant avec des professionnels et des b\u00e9n\u00e9voles du secours, ou encore devenir \u00ab un super citoyen \u00bb form\u00e9 et relais des secours, rendez-vous sur le parvis de l\u2019H\u00f4tel de Ville (ce samedi et ce dimanche de 13 heures \u00e0 19 heures). A 13h45, un flash mob \u00ab Portez secours, vous ne risquez que de\u2026sauver une vie ! \u00bb animera le parvis de l\u2019H\u00f4tel de Ville. Cette ann\u00e9e Paris qui sauve s\u2019\u00e9largit \u00e0 la pr\u00e9vention d\u2019autres types de risques comme l\u2019inondation majeure ou les canicules, dans le cadre de sa strat\u00e9gie de r\u00e9silience. L\u2019initiative est d\u00e9clin\u00e9e dans les mairies d\u2019arrondissements et 21 autres lieux qui accueilleront les volontaires pour des formations de 2 heures avec 3 cr\u00e9neaux propos\u00e9s : 10h-12h / 13h30-15h30 / 16h-18h. Retrouvez l\u2019int\u00e9gralit\u00e9 du programme sur paris.fr/parisquisauve.", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [], "organizations": [{"name": "la ville de paris", "sentiment": "none"}], "locations": [{"name": "paris", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "la ville de paris", "sentiment": "none"}]}, "rating": null, "crawled": "2018-03-23T20:04:30.007+03:00"}, {"thread": {"uuid": "e5363581f84f8443de3be9db40522a8562a1483c", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/jHIAmI4hxg.jqmG9d5TL0CNosokxbTj3SRsHbjUSzmAariC0CY2iM6s7WA23.8neYGwvNREVRhcIrZNpzsTkJYOGZkdk5A5GoxPjHkwHHTSKuO5k9WVpxGl.uRR3TS.GoDm84d2kXBGYN3UdkKZ.Og--", "site_full": "www.france24.com", "site": "france24.com", "site_section": "http://www.france24.com/en/monde/rss", "site_categories": ["media"], "section_title": "Top stories \u2013 France 24 - International News 24/7", "title": "Michelin-starred chef transforms food waste into fine dining for needy of Paris", "title_full": "Michelin-starred chef transforms food waste into fine dining for needy of Paris", "published": "2018-03-23T18:02:00.000+03:00", "replies_count": 0, "participants_count": 1, "site_type": "news", "country": "FR", "spam_score": 0.0, "main_image": "http://scd.france24.com/en/files/imagecache/home_1024/article/image/massimofelix.jpg", "performance_score": 1, "domain_rank": 5515, "social": {"facebook": {"likes": 164, "comments": 1, "shares": 164}, "gplus": {"shares": 0}, "pinterest": {"shares": 0}, "linkedin": {"shares": 0}, "stumbledupon": {"shares": 0}, "vk": {"shares": 0}}}, "uuid": "e5363581f84f8443de3be9db40522a8562a1483c", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/jHIAmI4hxg.jqmG9d5TL0CNosokxbTj3SRsHbjUSzmAariC0CY2iM6s7WA23.8neYGwvNREVRhcIrZNpzsTkJYOGZkdk5A5GoxPjHkwHHTSKuO5k9WVpxGl.uRR3TS.GoDm84d2kXBGYN3UdkKZ.Og--", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "Ratiba HAMZAOUI", "published": "2018-03-23T18:02:00.000+03:00", "title": "Michelin-starred chef transforms food waste into fine dining for needy of Paris", "text": "Text by Ratiba HAMZAOUI Latest update : 2018-03-23 Italian chef Massimo Bottura opened his sixth Refettorio community kitchen in Paris last week. The concept? To provide a sumptuous feast to the most vulnerable of Paris while also battling food waste. \nDon\u2019t talk to Bottura about charity. For the only chef in Italy to earn three Michelin stars, his chain of restaurants \u2013 the Refettorii \u2013 is above all a community project. \n\u201cI didn\u2019t want to recreate a soup kitchen where you have to stand in line. At the Refettorio , we serve them as clientele should be treated, with consideration and dignity,\u201d Bottura told FRANCE 24. \nIn Milan, Modena, London, Rio and, as of March 15, Paris, the most vulnerable will not have to accept food handouts or face the frequently dehumanising soup kitchens. At Bottura\u2019s Refettorio \u2013 which translates as \"recuperate\" or \"restore\"\u2013 they are invited to enjoy a delicious meal carefully prepared by a professional chef in a warm, convivial environment surrounded by exquisite artwork. The Refettorio in Paris opened its doors on March 15, 2018. \u00a9 Shehan Hanwellage/Food for Soul French photographer JR (pictured right) came up with the idea of bringing the Refettorio to Paris. \u00a9 Shehan Hanwellage/Food for Soul The hands of Chef Massimo Bottura are pictured on the plates and wall of the Refettorio in Paris. \u00a9 Shehan Hanwellage/Food for Soul Renowned French chefs Alain Ducasse (pictured left) and Yannick Alleno (pictured right) were in the kitchen for the launch of the Refettorio in Paris. \u00a9 Shehan Hanwellage/Food for Soul \"Beauty restores the soul\". In each of his community kitchens, Bottura has sought to make beauty an indispensible element of his cuisine. \u00a9 Shehan Hanwellage/Food for Soul \n\u201cOn the opening day of our Refettorio in London, a 92-year-old woman told me it was the most beautiful place she had been to in her life. For her, we had created a community. And that\u2019s the very essence of the project. We restore dignity for the forgotten with a stunning dining experience,\u201d the chef said. \nWaste not, want not \n\u201cDo you know what the most important ingredient in a kitchen is? Culture!\u201d Bottura exclaims. \nYet in a world where 1.3 billion tonnes of food are wasted each year, the link between a cultural experience and cuisine isn\u2019t always obvious. \n\u201cFrom culture comes knowledge, and from knowledge comes awareness, and from awareness comes action. The Refettori aren\u2019t soup kitchens, because in our kitchens we\u2019re not working with urgency. Our meals are a cultural, hopefully life-changing experience. We\u2019re trying to construct a better future. There are more than 860 million people who don\u2019t have enough to eat: the goal isn\u2019t to produce more, but to waste less,\u201d the chef said. \nFor Bottura, 55, a native of the northern Italian city of Modena, the birthplace of \u201ccucina povera\u201d or the art of simple cooking, the fight against food waste is almost innate. From his childhood kitchen table to his community kitchens, not throwing away food is instinctive. \n\u201cYou can\u2019t throw away bread \u2013 that\u2019s sacrilege! Even stale bread can be used to make a delicious recipe, like bread pudding or pesto,\u201d explains Bottura, whose Proustian madeleine cookie recipe calls for one cup of warm milk, bread crumbs and a dash of coffee. \n\u2018You make garbage taste so delicious\u2019 \nCooking with surplus ingredients is an art that Bottura has mastered. \u201cYou make garbage taste so delicious,\u201d the American late-night television host Jimmy Kimmel joked after inviting Bottura to cook on his show in February with leftovers found around the studio. \nThe subtitle of Bottura\u2019s most recent book of recipes, Bread is Gold , more or less sums up the chef\u2019s entire philosophy: \"Extraordinary meals with ordinary ingredients\". \nBottura was trained by the best. \u201cMy fight against food waste is an homage to my grandmother,\u201d he explained. \nGrowing up, food was no laughing matter in the Bottura household. They grew it, cooked it and ate it. \n\u201cI come from a large family. We were at least 10 at every meal \u2013 my brothers and sisters, my cousins, my grandparents, my friends. We grew up with the idea of being together at the table. It was a moment where we could talk to each other, share ideas, dream,\u201d Bottura recalled. \nHis career as a lawyer (\u201cto make my father happy\u201d) was short-lived. Since then, Bottura has been no stranger to success. The Osteria Francescana, his three-Michelin-starred restaurant in Modena is fully booked five months in advance. Want to reserve a table? Prepare to beg. \nAfter winning the \u201c Best Chef in the World \u201d title in 2016, Bottura has nothing left to prove. Yet despite his myriad of awards and honours, he isn\u2019t content serving just the rich and famous. \n\u2018Why should art and fine dining be reserved for the wealthy?\u2019 \n\u201cWhy should art and fine dining be reserved for the wealthy?\u201d Bottura demanded. When reminded of the massive gap between his wealthy clientele at the Osteria Francescana and the more vulnerable patrons at his Refettori community kitchens, Bottura replies matter-of-factly. \u201cThe ingredients may change but the process is still the same.\u201d \n\u201cWho says that a chef should keep his mouth shut behind his stove? That\u2019s absurd,\u201d Bottura\u2019s friend, the Danish chef Ren\u00e9 Redzepi, exclaimed in a Netflix documentary on the Italian. \nBottura is also a famous activist. In 2010, while hiking in a regional park along the Po River, he came across a ranger who deplored the state of the neglect of the wetlands. The chef kicked up such a fuss that the local government eventually invested \u20ac16 million to restore the park. \nBottura, who is also an advocate of Italy\u2019s Slow Food movement (a group that promotes local food and traditional cooking), was approached in 2012 by a consortium of parmesan cheese producers. A string of earthquakes in Italy\u2019s Emilia-Romagna region had left more than 300,000 wheels of the famous cheese damaged. Bottura came up with the idea of transforming the recipe for cacio e pepe (cheese and pepper) into a risotto that replaced the traditional sheep-based pecorino cheese with parmesan. Two months later all of the damaged wheels had been sold. \nThe beginning of Refettorio \nIn 2015, the organisers of the World Expo in Milan invited Bottura to talk on the theme, \u201cFeed the planet\u201d. The Italian chef, however, took it one step further. After founding the non-profit Food for the Soul, he opened his first Refettorio community kitchen in a suburb of Milan. Some of the world\u2019s greatest chefs flocked to support him, preparing meals for the city\u2019s most vulnerable populations using only surplus ingredients. A cuisine and design enthusiast, Bottura also invited artists and architects to help create a warm and inspiring venue. Mens sano in corpore sano , or \u201ca healthy mind in a healthy body\u201d, was his motto. The Refettorio provides a fine dining experience for the most vulnerable populations. \u00a9 Food For Soul To fight against food waste, only surplus ingredients are used in the creation of dishes. \u00a9 Food For Soul Bottura believes that culture is the most important ingredient in any kitchen. \u00a9 Food For Soul \u201cFrom culture comes knowledge, and from knowledge comes awareness, and from awareness comes action,\" said Bottura. \u00a9 Food For Soul \nThe initiative was such a success that the Refettorio, which was meant to shut its doors at the end of the World Expo, remained open. Even better, the model has since been exported abroad. In France, it was the French photographer JR who came up with the idea of launching a Refettorio in Paris while at a dinner party hosted by his friend Jean-Fran\u00e7ois Rial, CEO of the travel agency Voyageurs du Monde. Rial is now president of the Refettorio in Paris. \n\u201cJR told me about Massimo Bottura\u2019s Refettorii around the world, and proposed launching one in Paris. I thought it was a great idea: restoring dignity to the impoverished through quality food, a quality environment and the quality of the chefs,\u201d Rial said. \nEvery evening, from Monday through Friday, a team of five staff, including one young chef, prepare approximately 100 meals in the Crypt Restaurant beneath the Madeleine church in Paris\u2019s 8th arrondissement for a clientele made up of migrants and the homeless. The kitchen will regularly be taken over by some of the most famous names in French cuisine, including Alain Ducasse, Yannick All\u00e9no, Jean Imbert, Olivier Rollinger and Michel Bras. \n\u201cChefs can no longer content themselves with cooking in their restaurants. They have a responsibility to the future of global food security,\u201d Bottura argues. On his left arm, a tattoo of the words \u201cNo more excuses\u201d serves to remind us of that. Date created : 2018-03-23", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "ratiba", "sentiment": "negative"}, {"name": "massimo bottura", "sentiment": "negative"}, {"name": "bottura", "sentiment": "none"}], "organizations": [{"name": "michelin", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "france", "sentiment": "none"}], "locations": [{"name": "milan", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "modena", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "refettorio", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "london", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "italy", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "rio", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "bottura", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "paris", "sentiment": "none"}]}, "rating": null, "crawled": "2018-03-23T18:25:50.030+03:00"}, {"thread": {"uuid": "eb9294a890cca22d8c941a935c9bf5d04a9cb36f", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/m1nCBNv_poxYvjjogEGfIZ1MRmbVTjR9Bl9CH07kSoU45TpFCAVZSUm4qFF7JRH7osq9kBDaLGJKAMG1p.xFuqTVuBBjJ8UdBo..IKslU6PYkbShJ0_gpgsvU8nbKu0lXxaoVdDG0PtbGpQ5pCueyR5SaWjrMCn4", "site_full": "il.fashionnetwork.com", "site": "fashionnetwork.com", "site_section": "http://il.fashionmag.com/rss/feed/il,1,12.xml", "site_categories": ["fashion", "style_and_fashion"], "section_title": "News - FashionNetwork.com Israel", "title": "Made in France Premi\u00e8re Vision show to focus on vocational training", "title_full": "Made in France Premi\u00e8re Vision show to focus on vocational training", "published": "2018-03-22T11:31:00.000+02:00", "replies_count": 0, "participants_count": 1, "site_type": "news", "country": "FR", "spam_score": 0.0, "main_image": "http://media.fashiongroup.com/m/03f8/83e3/1b14/a15a/0b06/7b66/7493/c0fd/6a71/cd1e/400x250/cd1e.jpg", "performance_score": 0, "domain_rank": null, "social": {"facebook": {"likes": 0, "comments": 0, "shares": 0}, "gplus": {"shares": 0}, "pinterest": {"shares": 0}, "linkedin": {"shares": 0}, "stumbledupon": {"shares": 0}, "vk": {"shares": 0}}}, "uuid": "eb9294a890cca22d8c941a935c9bf5d04a9cb36f", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/m1nCBNv_poxYvjjogEGfIZ1MRmbVTjR9Bl9CH07kSoU45TpFCAVZSUm4qFF7JRH7osq9kBDaLGJKAMG1p.xFuqTVuBBjJ8UdBo..IKslU6PYkbShJ0_gpgsvU8nbKu0lXxaoVdDG0PtbGpQ5pCueyR5SaWjrMCn4", "ord_in_thread": 0, "author": "mguinebault@fashionnetwork.com ( Matthieu Guinebault)", "published": "2018-03-22T11:31:00.000+02:00", "title": "Made in France Premi\u00e8re Vision show to focus on vocational training", "text": "Home \u203a News \u203a Trade shows \u203a Made in France Premi\u00e8re Vision show to focus on vocational training Made in France Premi\u00e8re Vision show to focus on vocational training By Matthieu Guinebault - March 22, 2018 Made in France Premi\u00e8re Vision, the show promoting French textile/apparel manufacturers, will be held on 28th-29th March at the Carreau du Temple venue in Paris, featuring 104 exhibitors, including 23 new entries, with seven different industry specialisations. The Made in France trade show - Premi\u00e8re vision The crafts and trades represented are accessory manufacturing, components, garment and knitwear manufacturing, fabric enhancement and raw materials. In addition, service providers, professional associations and training organisations will also be represented. Vocational training will be this edition's central theme, notably via the presentation of studio work by the Trans-faire workshops, the Atelier du Haut-Anjou and the flexible materials section (shoe and leather accessory makers, upholsterers and trunk-makers) of the Compagnons du Devoir and Tour de France craft associations, as well as via a showcase by nine international designers.The Rencontres du Made in France conferences, organised in partnership with the French Fashion Institute (IFM), will focus on the perennial issue of recruitment and training, at a time when the French government intends to review apprenticeship rules. While France's textile and apparel exports are growing, 45% of entrepreneurs say they struggle to hire skilled workers, and as a result have to cut back on output.One of the conferences will be hosted by the IFM's Dominique Jacomet, with panellists Delphine de Canecaude (Twenty Magazin), Jean-Luc Fran\u00e7ois (Groupement de la Fabrication Fran\u00e7aise) and Olivier Toussaint (of the Le Club des CHO think-tank).Four other conferences are scheduled, their themes ranging from the redirection of sourcing towards France, to the challenges of company acquisitions, the role that a digital approach can play for French craftsmanship, and how French manufacturing is regarded by foreign buyers. Made in France Premi\u00e8re Vision 2017 In 2015, French textile manufacturers' revenues were worth \u20ac7.2 billion, providing 5,700 jobs, while the French apparel industry was worth nearly \u20ac8 billion, with 39,826 jobs. Last year, France apparel exports were worth \u20ac9.5 billion, up 27% over a period of ten years.", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "matthieu guinebault", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "devoir", "sentiment": "none"}], "organizations": [{"name": "premi\u00e8re vision", "sentiment": "none"}], "locations": [{"name": "france", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "carreau du temple", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "paris", "sentiment": "none"}]}, "rating": null, "crawled": "2018-03-22T21:56:25.024+02:00"}, {"thread": {"uuid": "fecf115e550d091b615e005f22f13cdd73bb5e5a", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/jHIAmI4hxg.Bp1SBJ85Xp1JetXX3Borwy4e6mCJyed1xTcQSe4nYr9bIF_3lY9_jmYJL1L2vqdPiQzw2VksCDqzH8HfE2RvSoCSlRtu6jSC9JCOLEb8rwSWoAgPZCE6r", "site_full": "www.linkfinance.fr", "site": "linkfinance.fr", "site_section": "http://www.linkfinance.fr/rss.xml", "site_categories": ["job_search", "jobs"], "section_title": "linkfinance.fr - "2018-03-23T11:09:00.000+03:00", "title": "Fake French terror attacks victim gets fours years behind bars", "text": "Fake French terror attacks victim gets fours years behind bars AFP 23 March 2018 09:09 CET+01:00 A woman who claimed \u20ac25,000 in compensation after posing as a victim of the 2015 Paris terror attacks was sentenced Thursday to four and a half years in prison. The 49-year-old, who claimed to be at the Bataclan concert hall where Islamic State attackers killed 90 people, had already been found guilty of fraud on three different occasions. Before her arrest in February she had also been holding a paid job at a charity for victims of the gun and bomb attacks in which jihadists murdered a total of 130 people. In her claim to police in February 2016 the woman told of \"bullets whistling past her ears\" at the Bataclan, but investigators found she had faked a receipt for the concert ticket and other documents to build up her claim for compensation. On top of the 25,000 euros ($31,000) she claimed from the state's FGTI compensation fund for terror victims, she received more than 13,000 euros from the French health service. She is not the first person to be caught impersonating a victim of the carnage at the national stadium and Paris nightspots on November 13, 2015, France's worst attacks since World War II. Two people have been found guilty of fraud and another 11 of attempting to swindle the FGTI out of compensation, according to the fund. In December Cedric Rey, an ambulance driver, was sentenced to six months in jail for pretending to have been at the Bataclan when he was not even in Paris at the time of the attack. See catwalk Prada - Fall-Winter2018 - Womenswear - Milan - \u00a9 PixelFormula According to The Fashion Spot's latest Runway Diversity Report, 32.5% of the models cast to walk in the Fall/Winter 2018 shows this February and March were women of color. The figure represents a 2.3% increase from the previous Spring 2018 season. Notable appearances included supermodel Anok Yai, who, upon opening the Prada show in February, became the first black woman to do so for 20 years. Overall, New York was found to be the most racially diverse fashion city during the Fall 2018 season, followed by London, Paris and finally, Milan.Transgender and non-binary models also saw an increase in catwalk appearances this season, with 56 transgender models and eight non-binary models walking in a total of 52 shows. New York, Paris and London all featured more transgender and non-binary appearances than the last season.However, when it comes to size, it seems the fashion industry is far from being diverse. Although plus-size models such as Ashley Graham and Candice Huffine have seen their profiles skyrocket recently, according to The Fashion Spot, merely 30 plus-size models walked in the Fall Fashion Month shows -- down from 38 last season. Similarly, the number of women aged 50 plus also declined compared to last season, with the total standing at 13 models across all four cities -- 14 fewer than Spring 2018.", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "", "language": "english", "external_links": [], "entities": {"persons": [{"name": "anok yai", "sentiment": "none"}], "organizations": [{"name": "prada", "sentiment": "none"}], "locations": [{"name": "new york", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "milan", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "london", "sentiment": "none"}, {"name": "paris", "sentiment": "none"}]}, "rating": null, "crawled": "2018-03-23T21:30:31.003+03:00"}, {"thread": {"uuid": "05d5c9fd63134a0a2e79a4a197cc8eb6259e184e", "url": "http://omgili.com/ri/jHIAmI4hxg9wODMzV2pILnsol7ippDlk0lDq8HCgZAmnMX2sVOyHC_FB90jX6nLYC5IyqBHmaEwSVH4Nuyu5_Ty4vB9CqNBJD_lzTimlg.Hab6zCYDqw2RazWAcwnR08vEWAd2WKMlt.3kgFmmO0kw--", "site_full": "www.infoconcert.com", "site": "infoconcert.com", "site_section": "http://www.infoconcert.com/rss/news.xml", "site_categories": ["music", "entertainment"], "section_title": "Infoconcert - "author": "Rebecca Trigger And Jacob Kagi", "published": "2018-03-24T01:17:00.000+03:00", "title": "How to survive 17 hours stuck on a plane", "text": "Dry mouth, confusion, increased anxiety or simply extreme boredom \u2014 these are just some of the unpleasant sensations you can expect to experience with long-haul air travel. Longest long-haul flights Auckland\u2014Dubai: 17 hours, 25 minutes Perth to London: 17 hours Dallas/Fort Worth\u2014Sydney: 16 hours, 55 minutes Johannesburg\u2014Atlanta: 16 hours, 50 minutes San Francisco\u2014Singapore: 16 hours, 30 minutes Abu Dhabi\u2014Los Angeles: 16 hours, 30 minutes \nWith Qantas launching its 17-hour non-stop flight from Perth to London this weekend, passengers are now facing one of the longest treks in commercial aviation. \nFlights of this length are not unheard of, with routes from Houston and Dallas to Sydney and direct services such as Los Angeles to Singapore and Auckland to Dubai already on offer for travellers wanting to trade a stopover or two for a direct service. \nAnd while the destinations might differ, the problems rarely do: how do you keep yourself feeling human after three-quarters of a day stuck in a metal tube. \nHere are some tips from the experts on how to cope with spending so long in a confined space. External Link: Nicolas Cage tastes sweet freedom after stepping off a plane in Con Air The doctor \nDry lips, nose, mouth and eyes \u2014 and don't forget the sometimes debilitating jetlag \u2014 are among the most common issues long-haul flyers can expect, according to travel doctor Sandy Dunne. \nBut she points to deep vein thrombosis (DVT), which is a blood clot in the leg veins, as the thing flyers should be most mindful of. \nDr Dunne said some people were at higher risk of DVT, including: People who have had DVT previously Women who are pregnant or on female hormone replacement therapy Individuals who are either very tall or short, as well as obese people People who have had recent surgery, or anyone unable to walk around during a flight Photo: Qantas says seats in the economy cabin are roomier. (Supplied: Qantas) \nShe recommends that anyone who is at heightened risk consult a travel doctor ahead of their flight. \nDr Dunne said travellers should ensure they stay well hydrated, and take practical steps to minimise the impact of dryness, such as packing lip balm and eye drops. \nShe strongly advises against using sleeping pills on flights. \n\"If you are drugged out on a sleeping tablet you can stay in one position for a long time and that can increase your risk of DVT,\" she said. The psychologist \nEnvironmental psychologist Rob Hall said airports and, by extension, planes could be places that drew strong emotional responses from people, especially those who were anxious about flying or who were leaving loved ones behind. \nDr Hall said the ultra long-haul experience could take its own particular toll on people, with time disorientation, fatigue, irritability and even the disruption of a person's rhythm of going to the bathroom potentially affecting a passenger's emotional state. Photo: Business class and premium economy seats take up more than half the plane between them. (Supplied: Qantas) \nHe said it was important people find something to keep their mind occupied and find a way to keep moving, even through in-seat exercises \u2014 for which many airlines provide 'how-to' guides. \n\"If you are going on a very long flight, it is worth having a little mental checklist and saying, 'OK, at least once an hour I'll do all these waggly exercises, I'll stand up and maybe walk up and down the aisle once or twice',\" Dr Hall said. \n\"They help you to burn off a bit of muscular energy \u2026 and they protect you from things like deep vein thrombosis.\" The pilot \nCaptain Brad Hodson, Australian and International Pilots Association acting president, said passengers not knowing what to expect might actually be surprised by how quickly time could pass on a long-haul flight. Photo: Captain Brad Hodson says a bit of respect goes a long way on a long flight. (Supplied: AIPA) \n\"You just have to turn up pretty well rested, drink a lot of water, try not to drink too much alcohol and try to sleep when you can,\" he said. \nCaptain Hodson said with the passengers stuck in the same space for so long, treating each other well was important for ensuring a smooth experience. \n\"Obviously people will want to get up and stretch their legs and that sort of thing, so it will take a bit of respect for each other to ensure that functions reasonably well,\" he said. \n\"Most of the people who will do this flight are probably seasoned travellers, and will do it because it gets them to their destination quicker than they otherwise would have [on an indirect route].\" \nLong-haul routes such as Perth to London are made more manageable for crews with the presence of four pilots on the aircraft, allowing two at a time extended rest periods in designated sleeping areas. \n\"You are able to sleep in them a lot better than you would in a business class seat because they are quieter, they are more comfortable,\" Captain Hodson said. Photo: The crew sleeping area on the Qantas Dreamliner 787-9 allows pilots to take regular breaks. (Supplied: Qantas) The airline \nQantas claims it has made the long-haul flight more pleasant for travellers by offering a more spacious cabin, with 236 seats on its Boeing 787-9 aircraft \u2014 as opposed to the more than 300 seats squeezed in by other airlines. \nBut the airline also had to take fuel capacity into account when deciding how many passengers and how much luggage the aircraft could carry over such a long distance. \nMuch of the lower density is because of the high number of business class and premium economy seats Qantas has opted for \u2014 with those cabins taking up more than half the plane between them. External Link: More than half the Qantas 787s are business and first class \nBut the airline has also promised a \"roomier\" economy seat. \nQantas itself recommends wearing comfortable clothing, charging personal electronic devices in advance and bringing your own snacks and basic plane-friendly toiletries to make a long-haul trip more enjoyable.", "highlightText": "", "highlightTitle": "",
